loans.name: Atilio

texts.es:
Don Atilio, tiene 65 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive junto a su esposa, administran una tienda que nació hace 11 años, también trabaja la agricultura, pero actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería para la tienda.
El señor Atilio, es muy trabajador y procura mantener el negocio con lo suficiente para dar abasto a la demanda, por lo que el actual préstamo le ayudara a tener un mayor inventario y a darle una mayor ganancia.
La aspiración de él es ver el negocio grande, contar con muchos víveres, que su clientela crezca y que su calidad de vida sea cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Don Atilio is 65 years old and lives with his wife in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  He runs a general store that he established 11 years ago.  He also works in agriculture. 

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for the store.  Mr. Atilio is a very hard worker and strives to keep his business stocked well in order to meet customer demand.  The loan will help him keep a larger inventory so he can earn more income.  

His goal is to grow his business and have a wide range of products so his customer base will increase and his lifestyle will get better and better.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ada Ruth

texts.es:
la señora  Ada Ruth H. tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijas que dependen de ella.
Ada se dedica a la venta de refrescos en varios tamaños, agua y jugos, tiene 2 años de tener su negocio.
Ada vive en el barrio Mongollano desde hace 15 años y su eposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, agua  y jugos. en todo momento se venden los refrescos, agua y jugos ya que esta zona es muy caliente (es la zona climatica mas caliente de Honduras) y las personas buscan este tipo de producto para refrescarse.
 
la señora Ada es popular y gentil, le gusta hacer bromas y su mayor sueño es graduar a su ultima hija de la universidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ada Ruth H. is 46 years old, married, and she has 2 daughters who depend on her. 
Ada sells soft drinks in various sizes, water and juice, and she has been in business for 2 years.  

Ada has lived in the Community of Mongollano for 15 years and her husband helps her with the household expenses. 

The loan will be used to purchased soft drinks, water and juices. Soft drinks, water and juices are always in high demand especially because the region is very hot (the climate is the hottest in Honduras) and people always look for this kind of product for refreshment.

Ada is well known and kind and she likes to tell jokes. Her greatest dream is to see her youngest daughter graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, water, and juices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mathurin

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 41ans, marié, père de deux enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 et 11ans.

Depuis 5ans, il exerce la vente en alimentation et divers sur étalage dans un grand marché de la place. Par jour, il a des ventes  de 80.000F à 150.000F par jour.
 
Avec le prêt qu’il va recevoir, il  achètera :
    1 sac de sucre,  1sac de riz, 1carton des détergents, 1carton des boites de conserves, 1carton de boites de lait concentré, 1carton de spaghetti, 1carton de litres d’huile  2cartons des savons de lessives et de toilettes.

Il compte beaucoup vendre afin de générer plus de revenus, faire des bénéfices considérables pour soutenir  la scolarité de ses enfants et  améliorer leurs conditions de vie.
texts.en:
This young man is 41 years old and married with two children aged 5 and 11. For the past five years, he has been selling food and various items which he displays at the grand market of the area. His daily sales range from 80,000 to 150,000 F.

He plans to use his loan to buy one bag of sugar, one bag of rice, one carton of detergent, one carton of canned goods, one carton of condensed milk, one carton of spaghetti, one carton of liters of oil, and two cartons of laundry and toilet soaps.

He expects his sales to reach a high volume in order to increase his revenue and earn substantial profits to support his children’s education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar, as well as cartons of canned goods, soap, milk, oil, tomatoes, toilet paper, and detergents

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la señora Maria Santos F. tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la aldea El Polvo desde hace ya mucho tiempo, sus hijos viven en los Estados Unidos y a veces recibe ayuda de ellos.
Maria se a dedicado a la cria de ganado, Maria las ordeña y la leche que saca la vende, y la que le queda  hace rosquillas y quesadillas.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materieles para la fabricacion de las rosquillas y quesadillas.

doña Maria Santos es una mujer seria no le gusta mucho conversar, pero es muy trabajadora y toda su vida se ha dedicado a la ganaderia.
 
su mayor tiempo lo utiliza para cuidar de su ganado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Santos F. is 65 years old, a widow, and she does not have children who depend on her. She has lived in the community of El Polvo for a long time. Her children live in the United States and she receives support from them sometimes.

Maria raises cattle. She milks them and she sells the milk that is produced and whatever is left she makes into donuts and quesadillas.

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients to make donuts and quesadillas. 

Maria Santos is a serious person who doesn't like to talk much but she is very hard working. She has been dedicated to raising cattle all her life. 

The majority of her time is taken up with the care of her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, water, cinnamon, and sugar to make donuts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta D. productos plásticos, gorras, carteras, este negocio ha ido mejorando desD. que inicio hace 7 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en variedad D. productos plásticos, ya que la demanda por parte D. los clientes cada día le exige nuevos artículos, con este préstamo espera abastecer el negocio, aumentando el inventario, así mismo mejorar las ventas.
El objetivo D. Maritza en contar con una amplia gama D. artículos, que sus clientes estén satisfechos y que encuentren en su negocio lo que necesitan, también desea mejorar su condición familiar y con el préstamo pues cancelarlo oportunamente.
texts.en:
Maritza is 38 years old, and lives in Jiqulisco in the department of Usulután.  She lives with her husband and two children, and makes a living selling plastic products, caps, and purses.  Her business has improved since she started it 7 years ago.

Maritza is now requesting a loan to invest in a variety of plastic products, since she needs new items due to her customers’ daily demand.  She hopes to use the loan to restock her business and increase her inventory, and thus improve her sales.

Maritza’s goal is to have a wiD. range of items, and to keep her customers satisfied and able to find what they need at her business.  She also hopes to improve her family’s standard of living, and this loan will give Maritza an opportunity to do just that.

loans.use: Purchasing a variety of plastic products

loans.name: C2389 Dukundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Adrienne is 67 years old and is married with five children who are between 12 and 28 years old. Adrienne's business is well-known which is an advantage for her. Adrienne is the leader of a group which is called "Dukundumurimo", consisting of five women and one man. In the photo, Adrienne is the first person on the right side.

Adrienne and her group has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a additional vegetables and fruits for increasing her profits. If successful, she will be able to reinvest in her fruit and vegetables business. In the long term, Adirenne hopes that her investment will enable her to accrue savings in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
la sra. Martha Lidia C. tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Martha vive en la aldea el polvo, tiene mas de 30 años de vivir en su casa propia, le a tocado dificil mantener y educar a sus  hijos sola, mas sin embargo a luchado para sacar adelante su hogar.
Martha se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ganancias.
  
su sueño es que su negocio crezca y se convierta en un mercadito bien acondicionado para una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Lidia C. is 62 years old and she is a single mother of 3 children. Martha lives in the community of El Polvo. She has lived in her own home for more than 30 years. She has had difficulty raising her children and sending them to school on her own. But in spite of it she has fought hard to support her home. Martha sells every day products. She has a grocery store in her house where she lives. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to supply her business in order to have improved earnings.

Her dream is to expand her business and to convert it into a well-conditioned food market to provide her clients with a better level of service.

loans.use: to purchase basic needs merchandise to supply her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, es empleado desde hace 7 años, trabajando como vendedor en un comercial del centro de El Transito.
El actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que este medio le dará mayor rapidez para llegar del trabajo a la casa y viceversa, esperando con esto satisfacer las necesidades básicas y alcanzar sus objetivos y metas por el buen desempeño en su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and lives in El Transito, in Usulután department, with his wife and two children aged 3 and 5.  José has been working for a company for 7 years.  He is a salesman in a store in the center of El Transito.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle as this will enable him to get home from work, and vice versa, more quickly.  He hopes this will help him to cover his basic needs and reach his goal to do well at work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos A. N. Es vecino de  Cartagena en Guanacaste, es conocido por su don de servicio  y de gente.
 En este momento el necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una Tanqueta de miel necesaria para iniciar su proyecto de venta de una miel conocida como melaza, esta sirve de alimento para el ganado  y se ha convertido en un gran negocio para la comunidad.
El forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena, una de una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Cartagena, Guanacaste, and is well known for his gift of serving other people.

At this time, he needs a loan of 500,000 Colones to buy a tank for hauling honey, in order to begin a project of selling a kind of honey known as 'melaza' (molasses).  It serves as cattle feed and has become a big business in his community.

Carlos belongs to the Empresa de Credito Comunal de Cartegena (Communal Credit Enterprise of Cartegena), one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: TO BUY A MOBILE TANK FOR HAULING HONEY

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora  Lucia, la  presidenta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, producción de polainas, costura de edredones y gorros – sombreros, artesano en mantas, tejido de mantas, ayudante de minibús, artesanía en chamarra, venta de papa, venta de chuño, costura, cultivo y venta de flores.

La señora Lucia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C. “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA”  año y medio.   La señora Lucia tiene como negocio la venta de CD`s y pollo.  El crédito le servirá para la compra de ambos productos y los podrá vender en diferentes ferias.  La ciudad de El Alto se caracteriza por contar con ferias en diferentes zonas y son nominadas por días, es así que se tiene la feria de Lunes, la feria de Martes,  y así sucesivamente, la feria más grande es la feria de Jueves y Domingo, la misma que se ubica en la  Zona 16 de Julio. La señora Lucia esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos, como su negocio requiere de llevar la mercadería a las diferentes ferias día tras día recibe la ayuda de sus hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The nonprofit “Santa Rosa de Lima” (Saint Rosa of Lima) began its third cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of Germán Busch’s focal group.  It is made up of eight members and the communal association is directed by a board headed by Lucia, the president.  The businesses that the members work in are varied.  Among them we have: neighborhood store, production of leggings, sewing comforters and hats, artisan handicrafts from fabric, weaving of fabric, minibus helper, artisan blankets, selling potatoes, selling freeze dried potatoes (for soup), sewing, and growing and selling flowers.

Lucia, the president of the communal association, says that she has been a part of the nonprofit “Santa Rosa de Lima” for a year and a half.  Her business is selling CDs and chicken.  The loan will enable her to buy both products and then she can sell them in different fairs.  The city of El Alto is characterized by having fairs in different areas which are named by their day.  Thus there is a Monday Fair, a Tuesday Fair, and so on.  The largest fairs are the Thursday and Sunday Fairs which are located in the 16th of July Zone.  Lucia is married and has four children.  As her business requires her to take her merchandise to different fairs day after day, her children help her.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the training they give.

loans.use: to buy CDs and chicken.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Don Marcos de 47 años de edad, reside en  Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, pipián y plátanos, vive con su esposa y dos nietos que está a su cargo, él aprendió de su padre la actividad agrícola, hoy día tiene 26 años de estar dedicándose por completo a la siembras, de las cuales comercializa y de sus ganancias mantiene a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para el alquiler del terreno, para realizar la siembra, el piensa alquilar dos parcelas de tierra para 5 años, al igual que comprar insumos para el mantenimiento del cultivo, esta ayuda es muy importante para él, pues lograra continuar con su trabajo y dar en cuido necesario para tener una buena producción.
El objetivo de don Marcos es aumentar el tamaño de terreno para cultivar, ya que así podrá sembrar más y tener una mayor cosecha, este será un gran aporte para su familia ya que dependen de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcos is 47 years old and lives in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department.  He works as a farmer, growing corn, 'pipián' (a type of squash) and bananas.  He lives with his wife and two grandchildren who are in his care.  Marcos learned how to farm from his father and he has been working on his own crops for 26 years.  He sells his crops and uses the profits to support his family.

Marcos is currently requesting a loan to rent some land so that he can sow it.  He is thinking of renting two plots of land for 5 years.  He will also buy some supplies to maintain his crops.  This help is very important to him since it will enable him to continue with his work and provide necessary care to his crops so that he achieves a good production.  Marcos' goal is to increase the size of the land that he works on as this will enable him to grow more and enjoy bigger harvests.  This will be a great support for his family since they depend on his work.

loans.use: to pay rent for some land so that he can grow crops on it

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
la señora Josefina M. C. esta casada y tiene tres hijos que dependden de ella, Josefina vive en la aldea El Polvo Agua Fria Valle, tiene casa propia y se dedica junto con su esposo a hacer rosquillas, quesadillas y tustacas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las rosquillas,quesadillas y las tustacas.
 
doña josefina es una mujer seria y de poca platica, es muy formal en sus compromisos.
su meta es darles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educacion a sus hijos.
Josefina se encarga de hacer el pan y su esposo de repartirlo en diferentes lugares de san lorenzo, nacaome y comunidades cercanas a su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Josefina M. C. is married and has three dependent children. She lives in the small village of El Polvo Agua Fria Valle in her own home and together with her husband makes rosquillas (ring-shaped cookies), quesadillas, and tustacas (a type of corn cake with sugar). The loan will be used to buy ingredients for these items. 

Sra. Josefina is a serious woman of few words who keeps her promises. Her goal is to provide her children with a better quality of life and a good education.

Josefina’s role is to make the items and her husband’s to deliver them to different places in San Lorenzo, Nacaome, and communities close to their home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cinnamon, sugar, milk, curd, butter, and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 58 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque. Desde hace cuarenta años, se ha dedicado a la cultivación de arroz en un terreno situado cerca de su domicilio. Vende su arroz a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con el apoyo de su único hijo que vive con ella. Desea usar su crédito para comprar semilla y otros productos para sembrar una hectárea de arroz. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
58-year old Maria is a widow and has a son. She lives in her own home in the rural part of Lambayeque district. For the last 40 years she has earned her living by growing rice on land near her house. She sells the rice to business people who come regularly to the area where she lives.

She learned about rice growing from her father who is an expert in this field. Her only son, who lives at home, helps her. Maria wishes to use the loan to buy seeds and other agricultural products and sow another hectare of rice. For this reason she approached Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a loan of S/.1000.

loans.use: to buy rice seed

loans.name: Darwin Omar

texts.es:
el señor Darwin P. A. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene tres hijos que dependen de el. Su compañera de hogar le ayuda con los quehaceres de la casa y a cuidar a sus hijos.
Darwin vive en el barrio La Ceibita desde hace 30 años y tiene casa propia.
Darwin se dedica al comercio vende ropa usada de manera ambulante, se traslada a los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo en una motocicleta, sus clientes han aumentado debido a que ahora se moviliza mas rapido y mas largo, tiene un medio de transporte mas rapido que es la motocicleta, antes se transportaba en Bicicleta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de fardo de ropa y para semana santa quiere vender ropa de playa como ser calsonetas, gorras, camisetas y trajes de baños.
su mayor sueño es comprar un carro para transportar mas producto y asi tener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
39-year old Señor Darwin P. A. has three dependent children and lives with his partner who helps him take care of the household and look after the children. Darwin has lived in the neighbourhood of La Ceibita for 30 years and has his own home.

He earns his living by selling used clothing in the streets and neighbourhoods in the San Lorenzo area from a motorised rickshaw. His clients have increased in number as he now travels around more quickly and to more distant places; he used to have a bicycle only.

The loan will be used to buy a bundle of clothing, and during Easter week he wants to sell beach items such as blouses, caps, shirts, and bathing suits.

Darwin’s greatest wish is to buy a vehicle so he can carry more products and make more sales.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino A. M. es vecino de  Cartagena en Guanacaste, es uno de los socios que participaran en el proyecto de la venta de miel para ganado (melasa.
En este momento el necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una Tanqueta de miel necesaria para iniciar su proyecto de venta de una miel conocida como melaza, esta sirve de alimento para el ganado  y se ha convertido en un gran negocio para la comunidad. El asegura que son más de 40 ganaderos que van a necesitar de sus servicios a penas inicie el proyecto 
El es parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena, una de una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Marcelino A. M. lives in Cartagena in Guanacaste. He is one of the members who participate in the project selling sugar for cattle (molasses)

He needs a loan in the amount of 500 000 (five hundred thousand colones) to purchase a tub of molasses that he needs to start his business selling the sugar known as molasses. This is used as feed for cattle and it has become a profitable business for the community. He is certain that there are more than 40 farms that will require his services and he has only started the business.

He is a member of Empresa de Credito Communal de Cartagena, one of the 110 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase molasses

loans.name: Diamantina

texts.es:
Diamantina V. V.   es vecina  de  Cartagena en Guanacaste, ella es una excelente líder, y además la mejor vendedora de la comunidad
 En este momento ella necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una Tanqueta de miel necesaria para iniciar su proyecto de venta de una miel conocida como melaza, esta sirve de alimento para el ganado  y se ha convertido en un gran negocio para la comunidad.
Ella forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena, una de una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Diamantina V. V. lives in Cartagena in Guanacaste. She is an excellent leader and she is also a merchant in the community.

She requires a loan in the amount of 500 000 (five hundred thousand colones) to purchase a tub of molasses she needs to start her business selling sugar known as molasses. It is used as feed for cattle and it has become a profitable business in the community.

She is a member of Empresa de Credito Communal de Cartagena, one of the 110 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase molasses

loans.name: Henry Avelardo

texts.es:
el señor Henry Avelardo V. P. tiene 22 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo pequeño, su esposa trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Henry sale a vender en su carro cuatro veces por semana y se traslada a Nacaome, tambien vende en los pueblos aledaños, barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo. tiene la ayuda de un hermano para la venta de sus productos.
tiene 3 años de tener su negocio.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa para playa, calsonetas, camisetas, bikinis, sandalias y zapatos.
nos comento que le a ido muy bien en los ultimos meses, mas con la venta de ropa escolar.
su meta es continuar creciendo con su negocio.
 
su mayor deseo es darle buenos estudios a su hijo y una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Henry Avelardo V. P. is 22 years old, married, and he has a young son. His wife works and helps him with the household expenses.

Henry goes out with his car to sell four times a week, traveling in Nacaome. He also sells to the rural villages, communities, and colonies of San Lorenzo. His brother helps him sell the products. He has been in business for 3 years.

He will use his loan to purchase beach clothing, undergarments, t-shirts, bikini bathing suits, sandals, and shoes.

He mentioned that the last few months have been successful, especially with the sale of school uniforms. His goal is to keep his business growing.

His greatest wish is to provide his son with a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Esneda

texts.es:
que por la falta de oportunidades laborales en el campo de donde es oriunda, se vio en la necesidad de emigrara hacia Medellín para buscar fuente de ingresos que le permitieran mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Al lado de su esposo, sin conocer la ciudad y sin saber en qué trabajar, Esneda decidió convertirse en vendedora en el centro de la ciudad, allí se instaló con su puesto de frutas y empezó a laborar independiente para ganarse la vida. 

Actualmente, Esneda necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos para la venta, así podrá incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Esneda, for lack of labor opportunities in the rural area she comes from, saw the necessity of emigrating towards Medellin, to look for a source of income that would permit her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Beside her husband, without knowing the city and without knowing what to work at, Esneda decided to become a vender in the city center.  Here she installed herself, with her post of fruits and began to work independently in order to earn her living.

Now, Esneda needs a loan to buy products to sell, in hopes of increasing her sales and augmenting her earnings.

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio  tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos ya independientes. Vive con sus hijos en Cruceta, un caserío en Tambo Grande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta de comida y la producción de chicha de jora, una bebida típica de Perú a base de harina y maíz. Realiza estas actividades en su propio domicilio. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de una olla lo que le ayudará a reducir el tiempo de preparación de la chicha. También, desea comprar más mesas y sillas  para poder servir más clientes. Espera aumentar su producción y venta de comida y chicha para lograr mejores ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Artemio, 45, is single and has two children who are now independent.  He lives with them in Cruceta, a hamlet in Tambo Grande, an agricultural zone located in Piura Province, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

For the last three years he’s been selling food and making “chicha de jora,” a drink typical of Peru made from a flour and corn base.  He does these activities at home.  He has requested a 2000 new sol loan to buy a pot that will help him reduce the time it takes him to make the chicha.  He also wants to buy more tables and chairs to accommodate more customers.  He hopes to increase food and chicha production and sales to improve profits and continue investing in his business.

loans.use: to buy a pot, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis Humberto M. M. tiene 68 años, Es viudo vive solo en  el Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de ganado vacuno. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica.

Le gusta que los créditos sean de un monto mas alto ya que los productos están mas caro.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto M. M., 58, is a widower living alone in San Miguel Canton, Bolívar Province; he does not have any children. 

The “CALZADO SOLIDARIO” communal bank is located in Calzado which belongs to San Miguel Canton and is located half an hour from this office.  It has 12 members who are short cycle corn, potato and broad bean farmers; they also raise cattle and barnyard animals.

Luis is a corn, potato and broad bean farmer and raises cattle.  He buys his supplies in the San Miguel market every week and sells them at the Thursday farmers market in San Miguel.

He is requesting the loan to buy seed for his crops and to buy feed for the animals.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather fluctuations.  His dream is to improve his economic situation.

He likes that the loans are for larger amounts because supplies prices are more expensive.

loans.use: to buy seed for his crops and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
el señor Felipe de Jesus C. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Mayra Funez y tienen tres hijos, viven en la aldea El Rebalce Pespire, Felipe tiene un taller en donde repara llantas de vehiculos
pesados, livianos y motocicletas, tambien vende lubricantes, llantas usadas, hace cambios de aceite y vende gasolina en pocas cantidades,  su negocio esta creciendo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de de llantas, neumaticos, aceite para motor, parchos, pegamento, lija, limas, gasolina. 
nos comento que esta muy contento porque que necesitaba un carro y ya lo compro, en el hace trabajos a 
domicilio de su taller y asi obtiene mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Felipe de Jesus C. is 34 years old and is married to Mayra Funez. They have three children and live in the village of El Rebalse, Pespire. Felipe has an auto shop where he does tire repairs for heavy and light vehicles, as well as for motorcycles. He also sells lubricants, used tires, and small amounts of gasoline, and does oil changes. His business is growing.

He will use the loan for the purchase of rims, tires, motor oil, patches, glue, sandpaper, files, and gasoline.

He mentioned to us that he is very happy because he needed a car and he already bought it. He does at home jobs and works from his shop to earn more.

loans.use: to buy rims, tires, motor oil, patches, glue, sandpaper, files, and gasoline.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Angélica de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de comida en su casa. Escogió la actividad ya que a mucha gente le gustaba la comida que ella preparaba. 

Comenzó con la venta de almuerzos. En la actualidad trabaja haciendo almuerzos en la cocina de su casa para venderlos a un precio cómodo. Trabaja todos los fines de semana haciendo meriendas y almuerzos. Los platos que vende son arroz, con pollo, carnes etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, platos para hacer diferentes comidas.
texts.en:
Angélica is 28 years old. She is a hardworking woman who runs a business selling food from her home. She chose this business because many people liked the food that she prepared.

She began selling lunches and she currently works making lunches in the kitchen of her house to sell at a reasonable price. She works every weekend making snacks and lunches. The dishes that she sells include rice with chicken, meat, etc. She has many aspirations for her business, which is why she wants to continue working. For now, she wants the loan to purchase rice, sugar, and plates to make different foods.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and plates.

loans.name: Las Reynas Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REINAS TRIUNFADORAS” iniciará un nuevo proceso más en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por  nueve integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva que tiene como presidenta la señora Angélica.

La señora Angélica, indica que es el primer ciclo de trabajo de la A.C. “Reinas Triunfadoras”, y nos cuenta que antes estuvo trabajando en el centro focal de Alto Lima cuatro ciclos.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de ropasicos (perlas en las telas); pero con el préstamo que ahora sacara piensa abrir otro negocio, el que consiste en el tejido de chambritas (chompas para bebe) y que los mismos serán vendidos en la feria 16 de julio, de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le ayudará a apoyar un poco más a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consultó qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro obligatorio y que ella esta animada a seguir adelante.

Con respecto a las integrantes de la asociación, podemos decir que ellas llevan adelante  variados tipos de negocios, los que son: Tienda de barrio, tienda de abarrotes, tejido de mantas, producción de mantas, venta de dulces, venta de verduras, venta de comida, comercio de deportivos.
texts.en:
The “REINAS TRIUNFADORAS” (Triumphant Queens) communal bank will start a new process in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board chaired by the President, Angélica.  She mentions that this is her first cycle with the “Reinas Triunfadoras” communal bank but she worked four cycles in the Alto Lima Focal Center.

She tells us that she currently has a “ropasicos” (pearls on fabric) business but will use the loan she’s taking out now to open another business consisting in knitting “chambritas” (infant sweaters) that will be sold in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio market.  This work will help her contribute to her family’s support a bit more since she’s married and has three children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answered that she likes the required savings and that she’s motivated to continue forward.

With respect to the members of the association, we can state that they are running a variety of businesses, such as: neighborhood store, grocery store, blanket weaving, blanket manufacturing, candy sales, vegetables sales, food sales and sportswear merchandising.

loans.use: to open a new business of infant wear sales.

loans.name: Deivis Arley

texts.es:
Convertirse en generador de empleo para su comunidad, es el sueño de Deivis Arlet V. quien después de trabajar en un taller de confección decidió crear su propio negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida la de su familia y así aportar con el progreso de quienes lo rodean. 

Deivis se dedica a la confección y comercialización de cortinas y tendidos, negocio que le permite pagar los gastos familiares y aunque como el mismo lo afirma en ocasiones la falta de capital para elaborar mayor producción es una limitante considera que la perseverancia y el trabajo diario le permitirá salir adelante. 

Actualmente, Deivis necesita de un prestamos para comprar materia prima y así lograr una mayor producción para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Deivis Arlet V.’s dream is to become a job creator for his community. After working at a workshop, he decided to start his own business to improve his quality of life and that of his family and this way, contribute to the progress of the people surrounding him.

Deivis works making and selling curtains and bedding, a business which allows him to pay the family expenses. However, he sometimes lacks the money to have higher production which is a limitation. He believes that perseverance and daily work will allow him to get ahead in life.

Deivis currently needs a loan to purchase raw material to achieve higher production in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy raw material, fabrics, buttons, and thread.

loans.name: Albertina Cleotilde

texts.es:
la señora Albertina Cleotide Z. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en union libre y su compañero de hogar trabaja en una institucion gubernamental. juntos se ayudan para salir adelante con su hogar.
Albertina se dedica a la comercializacion de ropa como ser: pantalones, faldas, vestidos, blumeres, bikinis.
Albertina viaja en autobus y a veces a pie para vender sus productos, con esta actividad a sacado adelante a sus hijas ya que todas se han graduado y actualmente trabajan y le ayudan economicamnete.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa de verano, ya comienza la epoca de semana santa y desea comprar ropa para playa y en estos momentos ya tiene varios pedidos.
texts.en:
Albertina Cleotide Z. is 42 years old. She has a common-law husband who works for a governmental institution. Together, they help one another to move forward in life. Albertina works selling clothing such as pants, skirts, dresses, panties, and bikinis.

Albertina travels by bus and sometimes by foot to sell her products. Through this business, she has gotten her daughters ahead in life, as they have all graduated and currently work and help her financially. She will use the loan for the purchase of summer clothing because the Easter season is beginning, as well as beach clothing. She currently has several requests.

loans.use: to buy swimming trunks, bathing suits, T-shirts, sandals, underwear, socks, and flip-flops.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos; el tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica a la artesanía a la pintura, el socio compra materiales como pinceles, oleos para así poder realizar su trabajo, él expone sus pinturas en un local ubicado en la plaza de armas de Cusco, él socio a la vez trabaja en el ministerio de cultura ,el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para seguir realizando su arte.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 50 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Carlos produces paintings and will purchase materials such as brushes and oil-based paints to complete his work. He exhibits his paintings from a space in the Plaza de Armas in Cusco. At one time, Carlos worked for the Ministry of Culture. He is a cheerful person who has tremendous desire to succeed. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials to continue with his art.

Carlos is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: To purchase art supplies and materials.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa; la socia tiene 58 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía en cerámica decorativo, la socia tiene su stand que se encuentra ubicado en la plaza de armas del cusco en el salón de exposición, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le gusta mucho ya que este negocio hace que ella pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de mercadería para así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 58 years old, married, and has four children. Teresa divides her time between her daily activities and managing her craft business in which she sells decorative ceramics. She has a stand located in a showroom at the Plaza del Armas in Cusco. Teresa has been in this business for several years and enjoys what she does. With this business, she is able to provide a better quality of life for her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

Teresa is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía (tejidos) ella produce lo que son chompas hechas en alpaca y otro tipo de trabajos más, la socia vende en las ferias que se realizan los fines de semana por el centro de la ciudad este es un negocio que le gusta mucho ya que le brinda satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así poder tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcelina is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Marcelina divides her time between her daily activities and managing her business selling woven handicrafts. She produces sweaters made of alpaca wool and other types of creations. Marcelina sells at the fairs in the central part of the city on the weekends. She enjoys this business very much since it gives her financial as well as personal satisfaction. Marcelina is a cheerful individual who is eager to succeed on behalf of her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her business so that she can have more to offer to her customers.

Marcelina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell in her craft business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construcción como arena, piedras entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para así poder tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Sonia divides her time between her daily activities and managing her construction materials business. She buys and sells sand, stones, and other products. Sonia has been in this business for several years and works with her husband. She is a cheerful person and has tremendous desire to succeed. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

Sonia is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alex Geovanny

texts.es:
Alex de 34 años, comenzó su papelería con una vitrina vendiendo hojas por unidad. Ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación para tener una papelería surtida. Trabaja con ayuda de su mama todos los días atendiendo la papelería.  

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería para su local. En el futuro quiere incrementa la mercadería de su local y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alex, age 34, started a stationery shop with a display cabinet from which he sells paper by the sheet. He works with effort and dedication to keep his business stocked. Alex has the help of his mother and they both manage the stationery shop every day.

He has many aspirations for his business, so he wants to use this loan to buy stationery for his store. In the future, he wants to increase the inventory in his shop and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: To purchase stationery.

loans.name: Melchi Susana

texts.es:
la señora Melchi Susana R. P. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian y le ayudan en la limpieza de la casa, su esposo es policia preventivo
 
Melchi se dedica a la comercializacion de productos plasticos como ser: pailas, baldes, picheles, vasos, panas, termos para agua, tasas plasticas y mucho mas.

este negocio lo realiza desde hace varios años, Melchi tiene casa propia, ahorita la esta reparando.
tambien se dedica a vender mantequilla, queso y quesillo.

doña Melchi es muy trabajadora, viaja en bus para vender sus productos.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos fabricados de plastico.
su sueño es que sus hijos se graduen, Melchi es cristiana y muy alegre!!!
texts.en:
Sra. Melchi Susana R. P. is 35 years old, married, and has two children in school who help her with cleaning the house. Her husband works as a patrol officer.

Melchi sells products made of plastic such as basins, buckets, pitchers, cups, wash bowls, water bottles, cups, and other items. She has managed this business for several years. Melchi owns her home and is currently making repairs. She also sells butter and cheeses. Doña Melchi is an extremely hard worker who must travel by bus to sell her products.

This loan will be used to buy plastic goods. Her dream is to see her children graduate. Melchi is a Christian who is very happy.

loans.use: To acquire plastic goods such as basins, buckets, pitchers, cups, wash bowls, water bottles, cups, and other items.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo ya está en el 5 ciclo del programa, ellos utilizan el crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios para cada uno de sus negocios, este grupo se formó el 22 de mayo del 2008, y hasta la fecha siguen siendo parte del programa  de Comité Mujeres Rurales.
La sra. Ermelinda G. es ciega y aun así se dedica a la cría de animales para su posterior venta, ella dice que gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya pudo iniciar su micro-empresa, ya que en otros lugares fue discriminada por su discapacidad visual.
Las integrantes del comité trabajan juntas los fines de semana para ayudarse mutuamente.
texts.en:
This group is in its fifth loan cycle within the program. The members have used their loans to buy the necessary materials for each of their businesses. This group was established on May 22, 2008. Since that time, they have continued their participation in the Rural Women’s Committee Program.

Sra. Ermelinda G. is blind and raises animals for eventual resale. She expresses her thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for helping her start her small business since other institutions discriminated against her because of her visual disability.

The committee members work together on the weekends in order to help one another.

loans.use: To purchase animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.en:
Juan Alberto is married and has two children. He works as a tailor in the highland region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has been working in the business for the past 15 years. He started out in this line of work as a sewing machine operator. His wife currently works at home raising their children and caring for their home. 

Juan is requesting a loan to purchase sewing machines to help grow his business. He hopes that these machines will allow him to sew more clothing and increase his revenues. He hopes to one day run a larger business which will help his family live a better life. This is Juan´s first loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: purchase sewing machines for tailoring business.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Jose, ya está en el 2 ciclo del programa, este comité se formó el 10 de agosto  del 2010.
La sra. Agueda tiene problemas de visión y aun así se dedica a la venta de harina de maíz, ella dice que gracias al crédito que solicita podrá comprar un molino manual y así podrá aumentar su producción.
Es de muy pocos recursos económicos la sra. Agueda pero posee ganas de progresar y superarse, ayudando también a su familia, pues la vida ha sido muy dura para ella, al igual que para las demás integrantes de este comité.
Todas esperan poder contar con el apoyo financiero de los inversionistas que facilitan los préstamos mediante Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is called San Jose and in its second loan cycle within the program. The committee was established on August 10, 2010.

Sra. Agueda has vision problems, yet she has a business selling cornmeal. She says that thanks to the loan she requested, she will be able to purchase a manual grinder to help increase her production. Despite having limited financial resources, Sra. Agueda has the desire to make progress and succeed in order to help her family. Life has been very hard for her as well as the other members of this committee.

They all hope to have the financial support of the lenders who fund the loans through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a manual grinder.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria P. B.   es vecina  de  Cartagena en Guanacaste, ella es conocida por ser una mujer emprendedora y de mucho carácter.
 En este momento el necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una Tanqueta de miel necesaria para iniciar su proyecto de venta de una miel conocida como melaza, esta sirve de alimento para el ganado  y se ha convertido en un gran negocio para la comunidad.
El forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena, una de una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
María P. B. lives in Cartagena in Guanacaste.  She is known for being a strong-willed, enterprising woman.

She needs a ₡500 000 (five-hundred thousand colones) loan to buy a storage tank to start a business selling syrup known as melaza (derived from sugar cane) that’s used as cattle feed and has become a business for the community.

She is part of the Cartagena communal bank, one of EDESA’s 100 organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy a tank for syrup.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Marta E. D. P. tiene un taller D. costura, donD. confecciona uniformes para colegios, posee un local en su domicilio desD. hace un cierto tiempo y solicita el préstamo para comprar más telas y seguir trabajando D. forma independiente en su local, ya que posee mucha demanda D. ropas para esta época D. colegio.
La  señora agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias a ella anteriormente pudo aumentar más su stock D. telas para satisfacer la demanda D. los clientes y ahora espera recibir la misma ayuda económica D. Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Marta E. D. P. has a sewing workshop where she produces school uniforms. This business has occupied a space in her home for some time. Maria is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics so that she can continue working independently in her shop. There is great demand for clothes for the school season.

Sra. Maria is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because her previous loans were used to increase her inventory of fabrics so that she could meet the demand of her customers. Now she hopes to receive the same financial support from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Vicenta Fermina

texts.en:
Vicenta is 20 years old and is not married. She has one child who is currently is school, and a partner who is currently working in the United States to help support the family. Vicenta works in clothing manufacturing and has been doing so for the past nine years. She started out in this business operating a sewing machine. 

Vicenta is requesting a loan to purchase more raw materials for her clothing making business. She hopes to one day run a large and successful operation. This loan is Vicenta´s third loan through ASDIR, and the past two loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: to purchase materials for apparel manufacturing business.

loans.name: Manuela Oxlaj

texts.en:
Manuela is 31 years old and married. She has three children and two are currently in school. Her husband is currently working in the United States to help support the family. 

Manuela works as a tailor in a highland town in the region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing materials so that she may increase her sales as a tailor. She has five years of experience in the clothing business and started out as a machine operator. She hopes to one day own her own machines and run a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: purchase clothing materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso 4 Group

texts.en:
Deyanira is the group coordinator for the "Esperanza y Progreso 4" (Hope and Progress) in San Pedro de Macoris. They are five members that are requesting their second or third loan; all of them have been in this group for one year or more. Deyanira is receiving her third loan, after having successfully repaid and invested every loan in her business. 

Deyanira lives with her long-term partner. She is a young woman and her business is selling clothes. She will use this loan to purchase more varieties. Her dream is to have a wholesale store and to live well and safe in her own house. Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
Julia Beatriz  C. C. tiene 52 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Julia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la educación a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

Le gusta que los créditos hayan servido para comprar lo necesario y que sigan apoyando de esta manera.
texts.en:
Julia Beatriz C. C. is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Calzado Solidario” gather in the precinct of Calzado in the canton of San Miguel, which is located thirty minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of twelve members who grow short cycle crops such as corn, potatoes, and beans, as well as raise poultry and cattle.

Julia is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, beans, and raises poultry. She buys her supplies at the market in San Miguel each week and then sells at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays.

Julia is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting crops and feed for her animals. The support from this loan will help her financially so that she can acquire what she needs. Her challenges are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. She dreams of providing her children with an education so that they can become professionals.

Julia likes the fact that the loans have helped her buy necessities and continue supporting her in this manner.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Jorge Edgardo

texts.es:
Jorge Edgardo C. G. tiene 79 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero para que a los hijos no les falte nada.

Le gusta que el monto de los créditos sea mas alto para comprar mas insumos para la producción.
texts.en:
Jorge Edgardo C. G. is 79, is married and lives with his wife and five children in the province of Bolívar.

The members of V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO live nearby in the town of el Calzado, Cantón San Miguel; these 12 farmers grow corn, potatos, beans and raise domestic animals.

Jorge makes his living from agriculture and grows corn, potatoes, beans and has farm animals as well. He buys products in the market of San Miguel each week and brings his products for sale on Thursdays in the same market.

Jorge requests a loan in order to buy crop seed and feed for farm animals. This credit will help him economically to meet expenses, and to confront difficulties such as insects, disease and climate unpredictability. He hopes to be able to continue working and provide for the needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy crop seed and feed for farm animals

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Jose esta ubicado en el Barrio San Jose de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, el grupo esta integrado por 3 personas, dos mujeres y un hombre, todos ellos tienen bastante tiempo de conocerse y trabajar juntos, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
la señora Dania C. A. esta casada y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, y es notable que lo a sabido administrar, luce bien ordenado y surtido.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que los precios de venta son accesibles para los habitantes de dicho barrio.

la joven Seydi Xiomara L. C. esta soltera y se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de perro, tajaditas de platano fritas y almuezos.
Seydi es una mujer luchadora y eficaz en sus negociaciones, es muy astuta y siempre cumple sus espectativas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas.

el señor Alex Adan C. A. esta soltero y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, desempeña esta actividad desde ya hace 4 años y tiene su clientela ya establecida.
el señor Alex utilizara el credito para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.

los integrantes de este grupo tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante con sus negocios y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The San Jose group is located in San José neighborhood, in the city of San Lorenzo.  The group has three members: two women and one man.  They have all known each other and worked together for quite a long time.  We will now describe the different business activities that they pursue.

Dania C. A. is married and her business is selling essential food products.  She has a grocery store in her home and it is clear that she has known how to run it.  It is well ordered and stocked.  Her customers prefer her store since her prices are affordable for locals in the neighborhood.

Seydi Xiomara L. C. is a young, single woman.  Her business is selling snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, slices of fried plantain and lunches.  Seydi is a determined woman and efficient in her negotiations.  She is very shrewd and always fulfils her expectations.  She will use her loan to buy supplies for making her snacks.

Alex Adan C. A. is single and his business is selling essential food products.  He has a grocery store located in his home.  He has been in this business for 4 years and has an established customer base  He will use his loan to buy groceries to stock his business.

The members of this group have a great desire to get ahead in their businesses and provide their families with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, chicken, potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, green chilis, garlic, lemons, salt, beans, rice, corn, soft drinks, toilet paper, butter, margarine, oil, soap, milk, bananas, cabbage, tomato sauce, juice, candies, cheese, condiments, sausages, bread, coffee and cookies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Silvia Zoila G. M. is 50 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children. 

The 'Calzado Solidario' community bank is located in El Calzado, in San Miguel canton.  The bank, which has 12 members, is located half an hour from our offices.  Its members work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, potatoes and beans.  They also raise farmyard animals and cattle.

Silvia is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes and beans, and raises farmyard animals.  She buys her products in San Miguel market every week and sells her products in San Miguel market on Thursdays.

Silvia is requesting this loan to buy seeds and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own business.

Silvia likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and feed for her animals

The members of V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO live nearby in the town of el Calzado, Cantón San Miguel; these 12 farmers grow corn, potatoes, beans and raise domestic animals.

Francisca makes a living from farming, she grows corn, potatoes and beans and raises animals.  She buys her products at the San Miguel market every week and sells her production at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays.

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds for her crops and feed for her animals.  The loan will help her cover her expenses, and be able to meet the challenges such as pests, diseases and the varied climate.  Her dream is to work and have money to build a house.

She likes to clean her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her crops and feed for the animals.

C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Le gusta salir a pasear con la familia los domingos por la tarde y bailar en las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Eduardo Urive M. G. is 63 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his wife and children in the Bolivar province. He has 5 children.  

The members of the CALZADO SOLIDARIO community bank are located in the township of Calzado, San Miguel canton, a half hour from the 12 member bank's office. It is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, potatoes, beans, and raising penned animals and cattle.   

Eduardo works in agriculture. He plants corn, potatoes, beans and raises penned animals. He buys his materials in the San Miguel market every week and sells his products in the Thursday market in San Miguel.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds for his crops and to buy feed for the animals. The support of the loan will help him to meet his financial needs and face challenges such as pests and disease and changes in the weather. His dream is to grow his business of produce and raising animals. 

He enjoys going out walking with his family on Sunday afternoons and dancing at the community's parties.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his crops and to buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Hilaria Bienvenida

texts.es:
Hilaria es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda de vivieres en la parte delantera de su casa. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido surtir su local con víveres y ha podido mantener su hogar. 

En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su hija desde las 07h00am todos los días. Vende en su tienda arroz por libra, azúcar, aceites, enlatados etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite y otros víveres de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a hardworking woman who has a small grocery store in the back part of her house. With effort and dedication she has been able to supply her store with groceries and support her home.  

At present, she works with her daughter's help starting at 7:00 a.m. every day. In her store, she sells rice by the pound, sugar, oils, canned goods, etc. She has a lot of dreams for her business and that is why she wants the loan to buy rice, oil, and other basic neccesity products.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods and beverages.

Le gustaría que cada año incremente el valor de los productos para tener mas utilidad.

Vicente Rigael B. is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in San Miguel, province of Bolívar. He has no children.  

The members of the CALZADO SOLIDARIO community bank are located in the community of Calzado, which belongs to the San Miguel canton, a half hour from this 12 member bank's office. It is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, potatoes, beans, and the raising of small animals and cattle.  

Vicente works in agriculture. He plants corn, potatoes, beans and raises small animals. He buys his materials in San Miguel every week and sells his products in the Thursday market in San Miguel.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds for his crops and to buy feed for his animals. The support of the loan will help to meet his needs financially and face challenges such as pests and disease and weather variation. His dream is to increase his productino and buy a car. 

He would like his products to increase in value every year so that they are more useful.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his crops and to buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: La señora Jacqueline tiene como actividad la venta de cosméticos desde hace 2 años atrás, actualmente es una de las directoras de venta y maneja un grupo de vendedoras, recién instalo su oficina en el centro de la ciudad  de la Paz, donde ofrecerá todo tipo de  cosméticos,  que queda a cuatro cuadras de la plaza san Francisco. El crédito que solicito fue para la equipar la oficina con estantes  y mostradores  y así poder exponer mejor los productos además de tener un lugar para poder  capacitar a las nuevas  vendedoras. La señora vive en la zona de Miraflores en la casa de su madre junto a sus 2 hijos quienes aun están estudiando en colegio, la señora Jacqueline ayuda con los gastos de la casa, su deseo de la señora es el de comprar su propia casa y que sus hijos  obtengan el titulo profesional, es una persona dinámica,  Emprendedora con muchas ganas de superación, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jacqueline's work, which she started 2 years ago, is selling cosmetics. She is currently one of the sales directors, and she manages a group of salespeople. She recently set up an office in the downtown area of La Paz, where she will offer all types of cosmetics. Her office is four blocks from the San Francisco Plaza. The loan she is requesting is to equip her office with shelves and showcases, so that she can display her products more effectively, in addition to having a place where she can train new salespeople. Jacqueline lives in her mother's house in the Miraflores neighborhood, together with her 2 children, who are still in school. Jacqueline helps with the household expenses, and her desire is to buy her own house and to see her children earn professional degrees. She is a dynamic and enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead. She is grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy showcases to equip her office

loans.name: El Jordan Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Jordan esta integrado por tres mujeres muy unidas y amigas de hace mucho tiempo que trabajan juntas para sacar adelante sus negocios. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Maria Regina N. M. es soltera y se dedica a la venta de golosinas en su casa de habitacion.
la señora Maria vende tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de perro, tajadas de platano fritas, almuerzos, tortillas con quesillo, cenas y desayunos; al igual tambien vende tortillas al por mayor a algunos restaurantes de la cominudad de Pespire.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de la ricas golosinas.

la señora Esterlinda O. F. es soltera y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, cosmeticos, sandalias, zapatos, bolsos y entre otros, hace sus ventas de manera ambulante.
la señora esterlinda vende sus productos en las comunidades y aldeas aledañas de Pespire.

la joven Kary Magali N. M. esta casada y se dedica a la venta de lazos para hamacas, los productores de hamacas de la comunidad de pespire le hacen los pedidos de los lazos y como es un lugar en donde pasa mucho turista las hamacas se venden muy bien.
Kary se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 1 año.
Kary es una joven muy conocida en la comunidad de Pespire.

el anhelo de las tres integrantes es lograr que sus negocios crezcan cada vez mas.
texts.en:
The group "El Jordan" is made up of three women who have been friends for a long time and are very united. They are working together to advance their businesses. The following gives the details of the various activities that they carrying out:

Señora Maria Regina N. M. is single and sells candies from her home. She also sells tacos, enchiladas, meat empanadas (known locally as "pastelitos de perro"), sliced fried plantains, lunches, tortillas with cheese, dinners, and breakfasts. She also sells tortillas wholesale to several restaurants in the community of Perpire. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make her delicious snacks.

Señora Esterlinda O. F. is single and sells new and used clothing, cosmetics, sandals, shoes, and purses, among other items. She makes her sales as a walking vendor and sells her products in the communities and villages that border Pespire.

The young Kary Magali N. M. is married and sells ties for hammocks. The people in the community of Pespire who make hammocks give her orders, and since it is an area where there are many tourists, hammocks sell very well. Kary has been working in this business for a year. She is a young woman who is well known in the community of Pespire.

The goal of the three members of the group is to have their businesses grow more and more.

loans.use: to buy corn, tortillas, pork, beef, chicken, vegetables, and churros.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 7 Group

texts.en:
Marta is one of the members of her group "Mujeres en Desarrollo 7" (Women in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with two of her three children.

Marta is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown in her business and her loan amount. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling vegetaB.. She operates a vegetaB. and fruit stall where she sells many sorts, especially plantains,  cassava, oranges, bananas and other tropical produce. Her loan will be used to expand this inventory. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing shoes and clothes and to save toward her long-term goal of having an improved business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 38 años, es una mujer valiente que vive al lado de sus 2 hijos en una casa que cuida de unos familiares. Desde su niñez esta muy ligada a las actividades agrícolas y durante varios años vivió la injusticia de los bajos precios, por lo que no lograba recuperar la inversión de sus productos ya cosechados, no compensaban además el gran esfuerzo físico, muchas veces los cambios climáticos fueron muy drásticos perjudicando totalmente toda la producción. Ante esta situación que atravesaba, optó por buscar cultivos alternativos que mejoraran su producción y su economía, fue así que empezó a sembrar granos como: trigo, maíz, cebada y quinua entre otros granos, que luego de cosechados son procesados para luego comercializarlos. Dándole así el valor agregado de sus productos que los envasa por sacos y los vende al por mayor y menor en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad mas cercana a su comunidad. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas. Por tanto se siente muy contenta por esa buena decisión y  ahora espera adquirir más terrenos para sembrar estos granos pero en mayores cantidades. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual y muy responsable en las tareas  que le encomendaron en su banco comunal, de la que tiene gratas experiencias de solidaridad y compañerismo por lo que continua siendo una socia activa de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para seguir sembrando, en esta ocasión quinua y maíz.
texts.en: Sonia is 38 years old. She is a courageous woman who lives alongside her two children in a house that she takes care of for some relatives. Since her childhood, she has been very much tied to agricultural activities, and for a number of years she suffered the injustice of low prices, because of which she was not able to recoup her investment in the products that she harvested. Furthermore, she was not compensated for her physical effort. Often the climate changes were very drastic, completely damaging her entire production. In the face of this situation that she was going through, she chose to look for alternative crops that would improve her production and her finances. It was thus that she began to plant grains such as wheat, corn, barley, and quinoa, among others, which after harvest are processed before they are sold. This gives an added value to her products, which she bags in sacks and sells wholesale and retail in the public market in the city closest to her community. In parallel with this activity, she raises and sells sheep. She thus feels very happy with this good decision, and now she hopes to acquire more land to plant these grains in larger quantities. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and during this time she has shown that she is punctual and responsible in her work, so she is well recommended in her communal bank, where she has had pleasant experiences of solidarity and good fellowship, and for that reason she continues to be an active member of her communal bank. She will use the loan she is applying for to buy sacks of fertilizer so that she can continue planting, at this time, quinoa and corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es:
Algunos problemas de salud hicieron que Amparo de Jesús Loaiza T. se viera obligada a dejar su trabajo en una fabrica de arepas, situación que la impulsó a crear su propio negocio ya que es madre cabeza de familia y ella junto con su hijo son quienes cubren los gastos del hogar. 

Desde entonces y con la pujanza característica de una mujer emprendedora, Amparo empezó con una miscelanea en la que vende productos diversos, pues es ésta la oportunidad no sólo para vender sino para realizar diferentes manualidades para aprovechar sus habilidades y así ofrecer otros productos. 

Actualmente, Amparo necesita de un préstamo para comprar alguna mercancía y así tratar de recuperarse, puesto que su cartera ha aumentado y ello le ha generado descapitalización. 

En el futuro Amparo sueña con tener un negocio amplio y con gran variedad de surtido y así generar empleo para otras mujeres que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Due to various health problems, Amparo de Jesús Loaiza T. needed to leave her job in an "arepas" factory.  (Arepas are kind of local corn bread).  Her health situation drove her to create her own business.  She is a mother and the head of her household.  Together, she and her son cover the household expenses. 

With the characteristic strength of an enterprising woman, Amparo opened a small general store in which she sells various products.  This created an opportunity for her to not only make sales but to also take advantage of her skill in making different handicrafts, which allows her to offer other products in her store. 

Currnetly, Amparo needs a loan to purchase some merchandise to try to recover her business.  Her client list has increased, but that has generated a loss of capital.  

In the future, Amparo hopes to have a bigger store with a large assortment of merchandise, which she hopes will generate jobs for other women who need work.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of merchandise.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es: La Sra.
