loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Battsetseg is tailor who used to work for different clothes factories as a seemstress.  In July 2010, she opened her own tailoring business. At the moment, she rents a small workroom and works alone. She started with one sewing machine. She is planning to extend her business by buying another sewing machine with more capability and employing someone else.

Her husband works as a taxi driver. Mrs.Battsetseg is a self-motivated, hard working woman who dreams of having better living conditions and a successful business. She wants to use the loan as a part payment to buy a $520USD sewing machine with more capability.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine with more capability

loans.name: Rosiel

texts.en:
Rosiel B. is from the village of Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Rosiel is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Rosiel owns & operates a business running a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes from tending a "turo-turo" canteen (cooked food counter). Rosiel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Rosiel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosiel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients to cook more food to sell . Rosiel is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Rosiel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Gulayon.  She is 61 years old.  Aida is widowed and has four children.  To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling native nito products to local businesses and community members.  Aida has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional raw materials for her nito weaving business.  This loan will be Aida's seventh loan from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of the family

loans.use: To purchase materials for her nito weaving business.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a married woman who lives in the island of Palawan. She earns her living by selling dried fish and providing tricycle transport service. Her husband Martin, who is 60 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 12 children who are between 13 and 39 years old. 

Demetria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Demetria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy more stock of dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her business. Demetria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mwalungo

texts.en:
Mwalungo M., a 56-year-old resident of Shanzu, is married to Salama Kadzo and they have been blessed with six children. For the past 10 years, Mwalungo has run a retail shop whose profits have enabled him to provide for his family’s needs.

He has now applied for his second loan from KADET with which he plans to purchase sugar, paraffin, rice and cooking oil for his shop. He will direct the anticipated profits to his children’s education. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, paraffin, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Kandida

texts.en: Kandida M. is a 36-year-old lady and a single mother of three children. Kandida runs a grocery shop in Kiembeni, Mombasa and has been in this business for the last three years. She joined KADET a while back and this marks her second loan which she plans to use to increase stock by purchasing more vegetables and fruits for her grocery shop. She anticipates profits which she will redirect into her children’s education. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo T. is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is 50 years old. Consejo is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Consejo owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Consejo has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Consejo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consejo is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Consejo from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Juanita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juanita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating fishing and fish vending businesses.  She lives in the island of Palawan. 

Sally has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Sally is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase fishing gear and equipment.   This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Sally aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her husband is a police officer and he supports his family's basic needs. For the past 2 years, she has operated a business of making natural juice for sale from a nearby school to her neighbours and school going children. 

Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy winter season the supply of fruits in the market for making soft drinks is high, while during the dry hot season the supply of fruits is low in the market. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a cooler machine and start another business of frying potatoes for sale. She joined Yehu because of the availability of financial services to small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler machine and start another business of frying potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en: Mary has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 40 years. She is 61 years old, married to Joseph K. and they have three children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time, and she plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Del Norte. She is 46 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman who lives in the island of Palawan. She earns her living by operating fishing/fish vending and nipa making (palm leaves) businesses. Her husband Amado, who is 50 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 7 and 14 years old. 

Perla joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Perla has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy some materials for fishing so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and for home repairs. Perla is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: Luanda B.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Sheria, âgée de 45 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants. Son  mari fut décédé suite à une mort inopinée. La  cliente  Luanda B. fait  le petit commerce de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le quartier périphérique de Kiziba II. Il ya environs 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  En plus, elle vend également des boissons (Primus, Fanta, coca, etc.) à son domicile.  En 2005, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits brassicoles (13 casiers de Primus, 4 casiers de boissons Aigle, 7 casiers de Fanta).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise et construire confortablement  sa maison. La cliente Luanda B.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Sheria est constitué de 14 membres, certains habillées confortablement en uniforme de la journée internationale de la femme du 8 mars 2011.
texts.en:
Luanda B. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group Sheria. She is 45 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children. Her husband had died unexpectedly. Our client, Luanda B., has a small-scale business involving a variety of goods. She sets up her merchandise in the outlying district of Kiziba II. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. In addition, she sells drinks (Primus, Fanta, colas, etc.) out of her home. 

In 2005, she received her first loan from the micro-finance institution Hekima in the amount of $50 for bolstering her working capital. She must use this new loan to stock up on new brewery products (13 cases of Primus, 4 cases of Aigle, 7 cases of Fanta). She also has the ambition to make her enterprise sustainable and to build a house easily.

Our client Luanda B. thanks the micro-finance institution Hekima for its efforts dedicated to poor women who are excluded from traditional banks.

The group Sheria comprises 14 members, some of whom are comfortably dressed in the uniform of International Women’s Day, on March 8, 2011.

loans.use: to buy 13 cases of Primus, 4 of Aigle drinks, and 7 of Fanta

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is married to a mason with two children. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees. 

For the past 3 years, she has operated a dumplings sales business from home to the local residents. Priscilla faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to buy sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and charcoal for cooking. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, bundles of wheat flour, and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda R. is from the village of Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Belinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Belinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Belinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the village of Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 61 years old. Yolanda is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling organic salted eggs to the local community. She preserves her salted eggs in a container full of mud. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino G. is 43 years old and a farmer. She lives with her 21-year-old son.  Nino’s son serves as a contractor in the Georgian army.  They live in the village of Sartichala, Kartli Region. Five years ago Nino started a farming business. She cultivates land and sows Lucerne (alfalfa). At the same time the family owns 2 milch cows. Nino sells the dairy products locally in the village. Her average monthly income is GEL 310. 

With the borrowed 2,000 GEL Nino will cultivate her parcel and sow Lucerne. Nino plans to sell 75% of the harvested Lucerne on the market and, taking into account the current market price, she will earn GEL 1300. The reminding 25% of the Lucerne will be used for feeding her own cows. The income will be used for improvement of the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: seed of Lucerne (alfalfa seeds)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives with her husband who is a gardener by profession. They do not have children, and they live at a rental house. Her business is fresh water supply, which she has had for 3 years. She sells water from home to her local residents.

She is requesting a loan because she needs to start another vegetable stall business, and purchase vegetables, fruits, potatoes and onions for sale. This loan will help her expand her business and earn more profits to enable her to meet her family's needs.

Her plan for the future is to use the income from the business to be able to stabilize her financial condition. She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: to start a vegetable stall and to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg is 47 years old, and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a rented flat. Her only son Davgaragchaa, 16, studies in secondary school. Munkhtsetseg used to work as a nurse in the hospital but lost her job due to job cuts in the late 90s.

She started running an office supply retail business at an outdoor market. She rents two separate stalls in the market and now she wants to extend her business by renting one more stall. She is one of our VIP clients and each time we do the loan assessment we see that her business is growing steadily. She employs two salespersons as well. The loan she is taking will be used to buy more stationery and office supply to sell at the third stall.

loans.use: to buy more stationery and office supplies to sell on the third stall.

loans.name: Yohanis

texts.en:
Yohanis is a 48 year old man who runs a cattle business. Yohanis lives with his parents and a sister in Baumata Village – Kupang District. Yohanis is responsible for his parents and meeting their daily needs. From the cattle business Yohanis can finance their living. Yohanis’ parents have a plot of land to farm, so now he is engaged in farming by taking care of the land. Yohanis cultivates corns, bananas, cassavas, beans, and yellow pumpkins. During the running of the cattle business, Yohanis has never had any difficulties feeding the cattle as he has the cattle food available at the farm. He just needs to cut the leaves and provide them to the cattle.

He usually spends the days on the farm and taking care of his cattle. Yohanis dreams of improving his income by increasing the number of cattle to fatten. He is requesting a loan of IDR 7,000,000. With the loan, Yohanis plans to purchase more cattle to fatten.

Yohanis recognized that the more cattle that he has to fatten, the more income that he could generate. He also believes that the loan will be a support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married to a businessman. They have one child who attends school, and they rent a house they live in. Her business is a store, which she has had for 4 years, where she sells basic needs items.

She is requesting a Kshs 35,000 loan because she needs to stock the business, and she does not have the resources to do so. She will buy products like oil, rice, beans, detergent, and soap. This loan will help her a great deal in order to resolve this situation and to keep her business in better condition.

Her plan for the future is to use the income from the business to be able to stabilize her financial condition. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, beans, detergent, and soap.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband in the village of Sartichala, Kartli Region. She is 56 years old. She works in local polyclinics as a family doctor. At the same time, Ana is actively involved in agricultural activities. Ana’s husband is a pensioner. Ana has adult children, who are already of full age and live separately. Ana and her husband have a greenhouse where they grow tomatoes. At the same time they have 3 milch cows and sales of dairy products (traditional homemade Georgian cheese) are another source of income for their family. 

Ana and her husband built their greenhouse 2 years ago. It has an area of appx. 200 sq. meters. Tomatoes harvested in the greenhouse are sold locally in the village among the villagers.  The main part of the requested loan will be used for renovation of the greenhouse – old cellophane needs to be exchanged for new one. With the new cellophane, the temperature in the greenhouse will become stable and this will increase the quality and the quantity of the tomatoes grown. 

A small part of the loan will be used for start-up costs for another micro-business – trade with combined food for domestic animals. 

With the additional income received as a result of the loan, Ana plans to assist her children. Also another part of the profit will be used for extension of the newly started trading business.

loans.use: to renovate her greenhouse.

loans.name: John Njuguna

texts.en:
John has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 16 years. He is 38 years old, married to Judy Wambui and they have 1 child.  

John was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy all the important musical equipments for his business

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives with her husband in Kisauni. They  have five children and live at a rental house. Her business is a retail shop, which she has had for years. She sells basic needs items.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she is requesting, she will buy more inventory like kitchen utensils like plates, bowls, jugs, mugs and also repair her sales kiosk. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future to stabilize her financial condition. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase plates, bowls, jugs, mugs to sell and repair her sales kiosk.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 47 years old and married with one child who is 14 years old. She is well known in the clothes business and this is her fourth successful year in this business.

Louise has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through adding different modern styles of clothing. With these additional styles for sale, she hopes to earn more profit than previously which, in turn, will allow her to continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting in her business for better progress.

loans.use: To add different modern styles of clothes to her store and a cow to raise at home

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen lives in Gujranwala, Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture. She resides with her family in a two-room brick house she moved to 13 years ago. She is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She has three children. Her eldest son is enrolled in a local school while the others are too young to attend school. Her husband's name is N. M. and he is a painter by profession who paints walls, buildings and houses. He receives orders and fulfills them within the set period of time to earn income for the family.  

Noreen’s father-in-law and brother-in-law also live with the family. Both of them contribute to the family financially by doing painting work. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes and paint brushes to provide better quality service to his clients. He has operated this business for the past 7 years and Noreen is confident that an investment will help him increase his orders and income. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah, applying for the first time. In the photo Noreen, in yellow, holds her Asasah passbook.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and brushes for painting business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a big shop and some new tools for his business of bicycle repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BARRA1 est créé en 2006. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Elles partagent le même centre d'intérêt qui est le développement de leur terroir. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR MBAR.

Madame DIARRA S. (à droite de la photo vêtue de rose avec une pochette rouge à la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des amis et proches.

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète les moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les engraisse pendant au moins quatre mois avant de les revendre. 

Son crédit de 100.000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter 04 moutons pour réaliser son projet d'embouce. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes surtout en nourriture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group  SOPE SERIGNE BARRA1 was created in 2006. The group is made up of 15 women who are from the same village. They came together as neighbors and friends. All of them share the same interest: developing their land. 

The group is part of the Keur Mbar banc villageois. Mrs. Diarra S. (on the right in the photo, dressed in pink holding a red purse) is the group's leader. She is 25 years old, married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of 2 other children entrusted to her by close friends and family. Mrs. S. fattens sheep. She buys sheep at the weekly market, then fattens them for at least four months before re-selling them. Her loan of 100,000 CFA francs will allow her to buy 4 sheep for fattening. Her goal is to support her husband in meeting daily expenses, especially for food.

loans.use: To buy 4 sheep

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: Kahambu Joséphine  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Changamuka, âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants.  Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat dans une entreprise publique  «  la REGIDESO ». La  cliente  Kahambu Joséphine est vendeuse des souliers usagers.  Elle installe ses marchandises au marché « CADECO » dans le centre ville de Goma. Il ya 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  En 2009, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (25 paires de souliers usagers).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise,  ouvrir  un dépôt de vente poissons salés. La cliente Kahambu Joséphine remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Changamuka est constitué de 33 membres.Cependant, une cliente détient son enfant sur cette photo et 2 autres clients, leurs figures demeurent invisibles sur cette photo de groupe.
texts.en: Joséphine  Kahambu is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Changamuka work group. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four. Her husband is a governmental employee in a public sector company named La Regideso.  Joséphine  Kahambu sells used  shoes. She sets up her wares at the Cadeco market in the center of town of Goma. She has been in this business for 10 years. In 2009, she obtained her first loan of $50 from IMF Hekima in order to increase her working capital. This new loan will allow her to replenish her stock with additional goods (25 pairs of used shoes). In addition,sher goal and to open a store selling salted fish. As a client of IMF Hekima, Joséphine  Kahambu is grateful for its actions oriented towards poor women who do not have access to traditional banking. The Changamuka group is composed of 33 members. However, one of the client also has her child in the photo, and there are two other clients whose faces can’t be seen on this group photo.

loans.use: to purchase 25 pairs of used shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Thien's Group

texts.en:
Thien T. D. is 37 years old  and has one child  who is attending high school.  Being a farmer,  her main activities focus on growing rice and vegetables and  raising chickens.  After divorcing in 2008, she has to work more in order to provide a good education for her  child. She has increased the numbers of paddies to grow more kinds of vegetables so that she  can earn a stable income to manage her family life. Participating in SEDA's credit program since 2006, she has repaid her loans on time and used the loans effectively to develop her farming. She is requesting a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and fertilizer for rice.

Dui T. N. is 35 years old and has two children. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She is requesting a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy food for them,

Loan T. D. is 45 years old and has three children. She is raising 100 chickens for eggs. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: To purchase food  for chickens and fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: For the past five years Emmanuel, 27 years old and single, has owned a motorcycle transport business that is open daily from 6am to 10pm. Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of buying a new motorcycle, and plans to reinvest additional profits into his business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: Madame Irène est mariée avec un enfant à charge. Elle a  33 ans et habite quartier Anfamé.   Elle fait comme activité la décoration. Elle achète les matériaux de décoration au Ghana à Accra et au grand marché de Lomé. Elle compte 11 d’expérience et a son atelier à côté du feu rouge Bè en face de la station totale. Elle demande  un prêt pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire plusieurs clients.
texts.en: Mrs. Irène is married and has one child to support. She's 33 years old and lives in the Anfamé neighborhood. Her business consists in selling decorative materials. She purchases her supplies in Accra, Ghana, as well as at the Grand Market in Lomé. She has 11 years of experience, and her workshop is located next to the Bè traffic light, opposite the Total gas station. She's seeking a loan to resupply and satisfy several customers.

loans.use: to buy decorative materials

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong T. T., 42 years old with 3 children, lives in Xuan Trach village.  She has had a shop that sells fresh fruits in the local market for 5 years. Her shop has many kinds of fruits which come from the southern province of Vietnam.  It attracts many customers and creates considerable revenue to manage family life.  During the time she has participated in the Seda credit project, she has been a good group leader and has received larger loans cycle after cycle.  Now she is planning to enlarge  the shop, and she wants a loan of 8,502,000 VND for that. She said  our credit program is very suitable for her business.

loans.use: to enlarge  the shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sonk Sounou Serigne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SONK SOUNOU SERIGNE est créé en 2006. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Elles sont très solidaire et ont pratiquement la même vocation qui est de développer de leur localié. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR MBAR.

Madame YACINE D. (à droite de la photo vêtue de vêtements rouges bordeaux) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle achète les bœufs dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les engraisse pendant au moins cinq mois avant de les revendre. Elle est soutenue par son mari dans son activité

Son crédit de 250.000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter une paire de bœufs pour réaliser son projet d'embouce. 

Son objectif est d'aider son mari a supporter les charges familiales comme la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SONK SOUNOU SERIGNE was founded in 2006.  It is made up of 15 women from the same village.  The group has come together as neighbors and friends.  They support each other very much and share the same calling to develop their village. The group is a part of the Banc Villageois of KEUR MBAR.

Mrs. YACINE D. (on the right, in dark red) is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. 

She grazes cattle. She buys cattle at the weekly markets and grazes them for at least five months before selling them.  Her husband supports her in the business.

The loan of 250,000 CFA francs will allow her to purchase two cattle and carry out her grazing project. 

Her goal is to help her husband with the family expenses such as food, health care and their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a yoke of oxen

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 30 years old and is married, with one child who is 3 years old. For 3 years he has owned a small store which sells various goods, such as cosmetics, sugar, rice, etc. His business is open from 7am until 7pm every day except on Saturday, and he currently employs one person to help him.

Anastase has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase additional cosmetics, sugar and rice.  With profits, he expects to buy new goods like clothes and shoes for men. He hopes to be able to buy a plot to build a house.

loans.use: to buy various goods to sell, such as cosmetics, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira and her husband live in the village of Sartichala, Kartli Region. She is 56 years old. She works as a cook in a local shelter for the homeless and old persons. Her husband works as a car painter. Besides their jobs, the family has small farming business. They have two milch cows. With the milk Zaira regularly produces cheese and sells it to cheese retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is appx. 400 GEL. 

This is Zaira’s third loan from Credo. The previous loan was used for house renovation. Now Zaira requests 1700 GEL, the biggest part of which will be used to purchase an additional milch cow. A small part will be used for covering of the previous loan. This will allow Zaira to produce more cheese and increase their income. Zaira hopes that she will use the increased income to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milch cow.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 27 years old and is a widow, with two children between the ages of 1 and 3 years. Her business is well-organized.  Joseline sells bread in her market, and she employs three people in her business. Joseline runs her business from 6am until 7pm every day, and she has two years experience.

Joseline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more bread to sell.  With a profit, she will reinvest in her business and save in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some new tools and wood for her son's carpentry business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. 

For the past four years, she has operated a second-hand sales business as wholesale, retail and from door-to-door, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Esther faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two bundles of second-hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kokou Jean Martin

texts.fr: Monsieur Martin  est marié et a 5 enfants. Il a 36 ans. Il a reçu de Wages un crédit qu’il a parfaitement remboursé. Il est Cameraman et Reporteur. Il a débuté cette activité en 1998 et à le siège de son activité à ablogamé à côté de la pharmacie des oliviers. Il s’approvisionne à la société NEACOMPS. Il sollicite un prêt pour acheter un ordinateur et une photocopieuse.
texts.en: Mr. Martin is married and has 5 children.  He is 36 years old.  He received a loan from WAGES, which he paid back in full.  He is a cameraman and reporter.  He began this job in 1998 and his business is based in Ablogamé, next to the Olive Trees Pharmacy.  He gets his supplies from the company Neacomps.  He is asking for a loan to buy a computer and a photocopier.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and photocopier

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BARRA2 est créé en 2006. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Le groupe est né par liens de cohabitation et de parenté. Leur union est également soutenu par une conscience mutuelle dans l'entre-aide et la solidarité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR MBAR. (nb. Khady B. n'apparaissant bien sur la photo est considérée comme absente)   

Madame ADAMA F. (à l'extrême droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 02 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des amis et proches. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète des moutons à engraisser pendant au moins quatre mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter deux moutons pour réaliser son projet d'embouche

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité des enfants
texts.en: The Sope Serigne Barra2 solidarity group was created in 2006.  It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood.  The group was born through cohabitational and parental ties.  Their union is also supported by a common belief in mutual aid and solidarity.  The group is a part of the Keur Mbar Banc Villageois (note. Khady B., who does not appear in the photo, was considered absent).  Madame Adame F. (at the extreme right of the photo) is the leader of the group.  She is 32 years old.  She is married and the mother of 3 children.  She also cares for 2 other children who have been entrusted to her by her close friends and family members.  She fattens sheep.  She buys the sheep to fatten at least four months before re-selling them in the monthly markets.  This new loan will allow her to purchase two sheep in order to fulfill her fattening project.  Her objective is to participate in paying for the daily expenses of her family in food, clothing, and education for the children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Abahuzangufu Group

texts.fr: Protais Ntawukwanga est agriculteur du riz dans le secteur de Bugesera, et membre du groupe Abahuzangufu.  Il a 39 ans, il est marie, ne a Rwanda, et il a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 13 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école, et Protais a fini 3 ans d’école primaire.  Il est membre d’ACB depuis 2010, ce crédit est son 2eme cycle, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat de NPK, urée, et main d’œuvre pour l’agriculture du riz.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer son activité de l’agriculture du riz.  Il voudrait devenir grossiste, payer les frais médicaux, et payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Protais Ntawukwanga is a rice farmer in the Bugesera sector, and a member of the Abahuzangufu group.  He is 39 years old, married, was born in Rwanda, and has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 13.  One of his children goes to school, and Protais finished 3 years of primary school.  He has been a member of ACB since 2010.  This is his second loan and he has a good repayment history.  He is going to use this loan to purchase NPK and urea fertilizers and labor for the rice farming.  His strategy for the growth of his job is to improve his rice farming trade.  He would like to become a wholesaler, pay medical costs, and pay his children's educational costs.

loans.use: to purchase NPK and urea fertilizers and labor

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Monsieur Komlan  a 30 avec 2 enfants à charge.  Il est marié et habite quartier Bè Kpota.  Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il fait la vente de pièces détachées  tout près de la  pharmacie Mathilda. Il achète les pièces au port autonome de Lomé et cumule 4 ans dans cette activité.  IL espère accroître son commerce et sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Mr. Komlan is 30 years old and has two children to support. He's married and lives in the Bè Kpota neighborhood. In order to take care of his children, he sells spare parts next to the Mathilda pharmacy. He gets his supplies at the Autonomous Port of Lomé, and has four years of experience in this business. He's seeking a loan in hopes of bolstering his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 20 logs of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Goussi Afi Mawussé

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Madame Afi est mariée et a un enfant.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de céréales. Elle a commencé  en 2005 cette activité et s’approvisionne au marché local d’akodessewa. Ensuite elle revend à son domicile. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter  5 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs  de mil et 3 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en: Mrs. Afi is 38 years old and married with one child. To help meet household needs, she sells cereals. She started this business in 2005, and gets her supplies at the local market in Akodessewa. She then resells at her home. She's seeking a loan to purchase 5 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of millet, and 3 sacks of bean.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of millet, and 3 sacks of bean

loans.name: Mélégan

texts.fr: Madame Mélégan est mariée et a 31 ans. Elle a en charge 2 enfants. Pour aider son mari au foyer, elle vend les sacs en détail  au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle a commencé son activité  en 2003 et s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Lomé. Elle espère augmenter son commerce et sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Mrs. Mélégan, age 31, is married and has two children to support. To help her husband meet the household expenses, she retails bags at the Grand Market in Lomé. She started this business in 2003, and gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. She's seeking a loan in hopes of bolstering her business.

loans.use: to buy bags

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar Sangaré est un homme marié de 30 ans qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, il décida tôt de mener une activité génératrice de revenus pour subvenir à ses besoins. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités à  Sikasso, mais sans succès, alors il rentre au bercail, à Bougouni, pour apprendre la menuiserie bois auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de plus 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité et fabrique des meubles, chaises etc.
Pour obtenir un fonds, monsieur Boubacar Sangaré décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 30  planches de bois, 10 boites de colles, 20 kilo de pointes.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni, à Manankoro et en Côte d’Ivoire.  Tous les prêt précédents de Boubacar ont été correctement remboursés.
Il  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar Sangaré, age 30, is married and lives with his wife and his child in a nuclear family at the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. Having never attended school, he decided early on to work and earn money to provide for himself.

For many years, he tried various businesses in Sikasso, but with no success. He then went back to Bougouni, his hometown, to learn furniture making from a friend. After ten years of experience, he masters his trade and manufactures furniture, chairs, etc.

To obtain funding to buy 30 wood planks, 10 boxes of glue, and 20 kg of nails, Mr. Boubacar Sangaré is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  He gets his supplies in Bougouni, Manankoro, and in Côte d'Ivoire.

All his previous loans were repaid without problems. He intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 65'000 (ca US$ 135), to be used to improve his workshop.

loans.use: to buy 30 wood planks, 10 boxes of glue, and 20 kg of nails

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new camera and a new printer for his photography shop.

loans.name: Nouhoum

texts.fr:
Monsieur Nouhoum Koné est un homme marié de 39 ans et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant à Bougouni dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après l’école coranique, il est resté longtemps sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’après mûre réflexion, il décida d’apprendre auprès de son ami la commercialisation des bœufs.
Après avoir eu un petit fonds de roulement il décide de mener seul ses activités. Avec 9 années d’expériences, il maîtrise son activité.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter des bœufs à Bougouni et dans ses villages environnants. Sa clientèle est composé surtout de bouchers. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Nouhoum Koné is a 39-year-old married man and a father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in Bougouni, in the Hérémakono Nord district. After Koran school, he remained without a job for a long time. And so, after careful consideration, he decided to learn from his friend how to market cattle. With a bit of working capital, he decided to go into business by himself. With nine years of experience, he has a command of his business.

With regard to bolstering his business, he decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, he plans on buying cattle in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages. His customer base is composed of butchers in particular. With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
El Señor Samuel V. tiene una carnicería en el mercado municipal Nro. 1, posee un local muy bien surtido desde hace un cierto tiempo y solicitó el préstamo para comprar más variedades de carnes, pollos y embutidos en su negocio ya que posee mucha demanda de mercaderías.
El es muy sacrificado y comenzó con muy pocos productos hace 11 años en el rubro, sin embargo, hoy día posee un puesto de venta de carne muy bien surtido, pero necesita del préstamo para adquirir mayor variedad y calidad de las carnes que ofrece.
El Sr. Samuel no sólo desea ampliar su negocio en cuanto a ganancias sino que busca el progreso económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Samuel V. has a butcher shop in Municipal Market #1.  He has had a very well stocked locale for some time now and asked for the loan to buy a greater assortment of meats, chicken and cured meats for the business since demand for such merchandise is high.

He is very dedicated and started out with just a few items 11 years ago.  However, today he has a meat stand that is very well stocked but he needs the loan to acquire meats in greater variety and of better quality to sell.  

Samuel doesn’t only want to expand the business with respect to profits but also seeks his family’s economic progress.

loans.use: to buy meats.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata Sangaré est une veuve de 43 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants dans la concession de son défunt époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
C’est suite au décès de son époux ,  qu’elle décide de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des pagnes afin de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa sœur. Avec une expérience de 6 ans, elle maitrise son activité. 
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, elle décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des pagnes. Elle est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de femmes. La vente se fait dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni, généralement en ambulant et à crédit payable journalièrement, hebdomadairement ou mensuellement.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA. Elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata Sangaré is a 43 year old window, and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her children in her late husband's house in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni.

It was after her husband's death that she decided to take up income-producing activities, in particular, buying and selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) in order to meet her needs and those of the children.  She learnt the business from her sister. With 6 years of experience, she knows the business well. 

To have a steady amount of working capital, she decided to take a loan with Soro Yiriwaso to buy "pagnes." This is her first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. She obtains her supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Her customers are women. Mrs. Sangaré sells her merchandise in different areas of Bougouni, usually on foot and on credit payable by the day, the week or month. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs, and plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes' (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married to a businessman and they have one child who attends school. Agnes operates a food stall, selling different kinds of foods like cooked beans, chapati, and cooked rice to her neighbors and to her close friends. She has operated a food stall business for the past one year. 

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her food stall. She needs this purchase to supplement her inventory especially for the foods that are in high demand, such as beans, maize flour, cooking oil and coconuts. These food are eaten on a daily basis in the stall. With this investment she wants to satisfy her clients. She also wants to add to the line of products that she offers to better satisfy the needs of her clients.

Agnes’s objective is to have a strong business that is profitable and that is supported by many clients. She hopes to expand her business to enable her to start another business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of beans, maize flour, cooking oil and coconuts.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth C., 23 years old, is married to Vincent Tuwei. Ruth runs a retail shop and her husband assists her. She has been in this business for 3 years and she earns a monthly income of KES 4,000. 

For her second loan from KADET LTD, Ruth has borrowed KES 15,000, having repaid her first loan successfully. She hopes to use the money to purchase the following: 3 bales of wheat flour for KES 8,000; 2 bags of sugar for KES 3,660, one box of cooking fat for KES 2,340; and one carton of washing bar soap for KES 1,000. The anticipated profits will be used to improve her business inventory and her family's welfare. Ruth's future dream is to own a large well stocked shop.

loans.use: to purchase business stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase good quality seed for his land.

loans.name: Jorobay

texts.en:
Jorobay K. is a 59-year-old farmer who lives in Chimgen village. He has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1984. He began this business with the initial capital of only 2,000 KGS and managed to develop a farm with monthly profit of 5,000 KGS. With the revenue, Jorobay was able to provide his family with all they need and now his grown sons are the main helpers for him. 

Today his farm with five cows and sheep still needs to be developed. For this reason Jorobay has applied for the loan of 75,000 KGS. With the revenue, he plans to broaden his activities for further growth of their family business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah C., a 30-year-old married mother of three children who are all in primary school, has operated a beauty salon in the town of Eldoret for the past six years; she earns a monthly income of 7,000 shillings.

This will be Ednah's second loan with KADET LTD after having repaid her first one. She plans to use it to boost her business by buying new hair products, hair shampoo, a hair dryer, etc. In the future, Ednah would like to build a house with her husband and educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxer, shampoo and a hair dryer for her business

loans.name: Patrick Mariga

texts.en:
Patrick Mariga O. is a 28-years-old single man from Bamburi; Mombasa. He is a poultry farmer. Patrick has been running his poultry business for the last five years and the business is doing well with good income. 

This marks his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy medicine and feed for his poultry. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business. His dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy medicine and feed for his poultry.

loans.name: Harrison Ayugi

texts.en: Harrison has worked in quarries in Naivasha town for the last 11 years. He is 54 years old, married to Mary Auma and they have four school-going children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time, and he plans to use this loan to buy another quarry site. In the future, Harrison hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport stones to different places.

loans.use: to buy another quarry site.

loans.name: Paul Kariuki

texts.en: Paul has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 40 years. He is 70 years old, married to Zipporah Muthoni and they have four children. He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time and he plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladys Njeri

texts.en:
Gladys has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. She is 34 years old and married to David Nganga. They have 3 children.

Gladys was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Gladys hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvina es comerciante desde hace más de 5 años, tiene una despensa bien surtida en el barrio 1º de Marzo en Coronel Oviedo.
Ella está casada con el Sr. Anibal desde hace 18 años y tienen tres hijos, ella comenta que la mejor manera de salir adelante es respetarse y ayudarse mutuamente en la familia, juntos administran su propio negocio: la Sra. Silvina su despensa general y el Sr. Anibal su pequeño hotel, pero cuando se presenta cualquier problema tratan de solucionar juntos.
La Sra. Silvina agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en su persona y la oportunidad de apoyo crediticio que le está brindando, asegura que invertirá bien su préstamo comprando comestibles (azúcar, fideos, huevos, panificados, lácteos, etc) y artículos de librería, así obtendrá mayores ganancias con mayor producción y podrá devolver el crédito en tiempo y forma, para poder seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Silvina has been a merchant for over 5 years.  She has a well stocked store in Coronel Oviedo’s 1 de Marzo neighborhood.

She’s been married to Aníbal for 18 years and they have three children.  She comments that the best way to get ahead is to respect yourself and help each other in the family.  Together they run their own businesses:  Silvina her small general store and Aníbal his small hotel.  However, whenever a problem arises they try to solve it together.

Silvina is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the trust it’s placed in her and the opportunity for credit support it’s providing.  She assures that she will invest her loan well buying food items (sugar, noodles, eggs, baked goods, dairy products, etc.) and stationery shop items in order to obtain better profits with more production and be able to repay the loan in a timely fashion thus being able to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy food items (sugar, noodles, eggs, baked goods, etc.) and stationery shop items.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard S. C. is a man who is 30 years old. He is married to Susan Yariwo and together they have three beautiful children. He runs a matatu (van) transportation business in the Kitale area. This has been his business for three years now. He gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be Bernard's first loan with KADET LTD and he wants to buy new seat covers for his matatu (van). He hopes that sprucing up of the van will attract more customers and thus also more profits, which he will use to repay the loan. In the future he wants to improve his services and also educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy new accessories for the matatu (van)

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix B., tiene  32 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Leda González hace cuatro años, tienen un hijo juntos  de un año, vive en el Barrio Capitan Roa de la Ciudad Coronel Oviedo.
El Sr. Felix  tiene su local de Gomería en el centro de la ciudad, es gomero de profesión, aprendió el oficio de su difunto padre.
Comenta que le gusta su profesión, más aún porque es legado de su padre, a quien ayudó en la crianza de todos sus hermanos, siempre trabajó con su padre y después de su fallecimiento heredó el negocio, hace más de tres años.
Lo gerencia con todo orgullo, porque es una profesión en donde pone toda su energía todos los días.
Se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya con el objetivo de recibir ayuda crediticia que le ayude a salir adelante. Y desde ya agradece a la institución por la oportunidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Felix B., is 32 years old, and has been married to Leda González for four years, they have a one year old son, and live in the Capitan Roa suburb of Coronel Oviedo city.
Felix has his tire shop in the city center, he repairs tires as a profession, he learnt this skill from his late father.
He says that he likes his profession, even more so as it is a legacy from his father, who he helped in raising all his siblings. He always worked with his father and after his death he inherited the business, more than three years ago.
He manages it with a lot of pride, because it is a profession that he can put all his energy into every day.
He approached the "Fundación Paraguaya" for the purpose of receiving financial support to help him get ahead. And he is grateful to the institution for the opportunity that it has offered him.

loans.use: To buy car tires

loans.name: Cecilia Gakenia

texts.en:
Cecilia has practiced both crop and animal farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 9 years.  She is 47 years old and married to Benson K.. They have 2 children.  

Cecilia was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Cecilia hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jack Kamau

texts.en:
Jack has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 3 years.  He is 28 years old and married to Margaret Waitherero. They have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Jack hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati G. M. is 25 years old. She is married to Finno and they have one child. Bahati runs a greengrocery and has been in this business for the last two years. Her business is getting good returns.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, carrots and spinach for her greengrocery business. The anticipated profits will be invested back into the business.

Her dream is to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes, carrots and spinach

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. K. is a forty-year-old married man with three children. He runs a retail shop in the Kitale area and has been in this business for twenty years. 

This will be Joseph's first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to buy a water tank. Since the area has water problems, with the tank he can store water and sell it. He anticipates some profits which he plans to use to add stock to his retail shop.

In the future he wants to educate his children and also expand his business and own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 54 years old, married and a mother of four.  She runs a retail shop where she mainly sells wedding gifts and drinks.  She has been engaged in the business since 2002.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business hence improving her standard of living.  She has requested 40,000 Kes to buy more wedding gifts for resale.

loans.use: To buy more wedding gifts for resale.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
El Sr. Denis R. V. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la Calle Arroz de la Ciudad Coronel Oviedo.
Denis es un joven emprendedor, tiene su establo en las afueras de la ciudad, se dedica a la cría de vacas desde muy pequeño con sus padres. Comenta que el oficio es muy sacrificado ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para la recolección de la leche, limpieza de utensilios para el ordeñamiento y luego debe salir a repartir su leche en la ciudad, en un motocarro.
Manifiesta también que es muy satisfactorio valerse por sí mismo, tener su propia empresa y de esta manera poder ayudar a toda su familia.
Se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya en busca de apoyo y está muy contento con la institución por haber podido ofrecerle un crédito, de esa forma podría mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis Román V., 23, is single living in the city of Coronel Oviedo.  He’s a young entrepreneur.  He has a stable outside the city where he has raised cattle with his parents since he was very young.  He comments that the work is very hard because he has to get up very early to milk the cows, clean the milking equipment and then go out to deliver the milk in the city in a motor vehicle.

He states that it is very satisfying to fend for himself, to have his own business and to be able to help all his family this way.

He called on Fundación Paraguaya seeking help and is very happy with the institution because it offered him a loan which will allow him to improve service to his customers.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 46 years old, married and with four children.  For seven years, he has been selling furniture so as to earn a living.  He has employed two people in his business.   He also rents out houses to earn extra income.  He was previously employed as a teacher.  He hopes to own a real estate business in the future.  He has requested 60,000 Kes to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 45 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 9 and 24.  He does tailoring so as to earn his daily bread.  He has been in the business for twenty years.  He has employed two people to help him in his tasks.  He also does farming to supplement his income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to buy a piece of land and grow his business.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is 34 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child.  He runs Softmax Computer Centre so as to earn a living.  He has been in the business for seven years.  He started the business after finishing his college studies.  He hopes to open a computer training school in the future.  He also dreams of opening other outlets for his business.  He has requested 80,000 KES to buy a video camera and repair some computers.

loans.use: To buy a video camera and repair some computers.

loans.name: Datuni

texts.en:
Datuni I. is 57 years old. He lives in the village of Tsereteli, Marneuli District with his family – wife and son. Datuni works in local poultry factory. Datuni’s wife works as a cook and his 22-year-old son is a wrestler. Besides their main jobs, all family members are involved in family agricultural activities: They have two milch cows and dairy products are sold to local retailers. Also the family owns a plot of land where Lucerne (alfalfa) is grown, which is used for feeding their own cows. Total average monthly income of the family is up to GEL 850. 

With the requested amount Datuni plans to renovate/launch a traditional Georgian bread bakery, which is located in the building of his house. The bakery isn’t functional at the moment. After the bakery is renovated and launched, Datuni will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it in the nearby villages. It will increase the income of the family. 

Datuni hopes that he will reinvest part of the bakery’s profit in the same business, to expand it. With the other part of the profit he wants to buy a car for family use.

loans.use: to renovate a bread bakery.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, está casado con la sra. Liz Gonzalez desde hace 2 años, tienen una hija juntos de 6 meses, viven en Villa Virgen del Carmen de la Ciudad Coronel Oviedo.
El Sr. Carlos es fotógrafo, realiza fotos y filmaciones de todo tipo de eventos, también realiza fotos tipo carnet al instante, se dedica a ese rubro desde hace más de veinte años pero hace cuatro años se independizó.
Es un trabajo que a él le gusta porque realza su creatividad, capta momentos felices que viven las personas, lo cual disfruta mucho.
Comenzó desde muy pequeño con un tío en Ciudad del Este. Aprendió bastante de esta profesión y al tener la oportunidad de obtener sus propias herramientas se independizó.
Comenta que para este rubro es muy importante la innovación, porque la tecnología es la base del éxito. Se acercó a la Fundación para solicitar apoyo y agradece la confianza que han puesto en su persona y en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32, has been married to Liz González for two years; they have a 6-month-old little girl.  They live in the city of Coronel Oviedo’s Villa Virgen del Carmen sector.

Carlos is a Photographer.  He takes pictures at and films all kinds of events.  He also takes instant I.D. card-type photos.  He’s been in this line of work for over 20 years but became independent at it four years ago.

This is work that he enjoys because it highlights his creativity; he captures happy moments in the lives of people which he enjoys doing very much.

He started while still very little with an uncle in Ciudad del Este.  He learned quite a bit about this profession and when he got the opportunity to acquire his own work tools he became independent.

He comments that innovation is very important in this line of work because technology is the basis for success.  He approached the Fundación to request support and he is grateful for the trust placed in him and in his work.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine S. is 46 years old and a widow. Heghine lives in Yerevan with her son and daughter-in-law. For about two years, Hegine has been running a women’s clothes trading business in one of Yerevan's trading centers. She sells blouses, sweaters, suits and outerwear at a rented stall. Heghine buys clothes from Georgia once a month and from Turkey once every two months. Thanks to her business’s income, Heghine is able for the most part to provide for her family’s needs.

This is Heghine’s second loan from Nor Horizon, and now she is asking for a loan of $3,000 to buy clothes for the spring season to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the spring season to resell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 39 years old, married, and a father of three. He has been doing carpentry for 12 years now. His previous work was supplying bread to earn his living. As a member of Faulu Kenya, he has benefited from their training in financial management. This has helped him run his business well. He hopes to become the leading supplier of furniture in his local area. With this loan of 40,000 Kes, he will buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil received from Credo a loan in the amount of GEL 2,000.  He lives in the village of Tsereteli, Kartli Region. He lives with his wife and his parents. His wife works as an office cleaner. Micheil’s parents are pensioners. The main source of income of the family comes from agricultural activities: six milch cows and a 2.5-hectare plot of land. The family produces cheese and Georgian yogurt and sells their products to local dairy products retailers. The family also cultivate their land and grow corn and beans. The harvested corn and beans are sold on the local market.

With the requested loan amount, Mikheil plans to cultivate the land and prepare it for sowing corn and beans. Mikheil hopes that he will have a good harvest season and with the profits he will be able to renovate his house as well as reinvest part of the profit in their agricultural activities.

loans.use: to prepare his land for sowing corn and beans.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is 43 years old and a single mother of one. She sells construction materials to earn her daily bread. She also does dairy farming to supplement her income. She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has managed to expand her business and improve her standard of living. Being the single mother of a 16-year-old child, she works hard in her business so that she can educate her child. Her desire is to become a successful farmer in the future. She has requested a loan of 35,000 Kes to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó a través de la Sra. Maria Lidia S. y la Sra. Alicia D., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más acerca del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 23 (veintitrés) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Ellas  son independientes en sus labores, por ejemplo: la sra. Rafaela se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, y necesita el crédito para aumentar la producción de sus comestibles, comprando huevos, fideos, azúcar, harina, entre otros ingredientes, y así también mejorar la calidad de lo que ofrece a sus clientes.
Ella sólo sueña con poder prosperar y tener un negocio amplio donde pueda incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Maria Lidia S. and Alicia D. who had come to the office of the Fundación Paraguaya  (Paraguayan Foundation) to find out more about the program of the Entrepreneurial Women’s Committee.  They invited their friends and acquaintances from the neighborhood and decided to put their different businesses together to get ahead and improve their standards of living.  There are 23 (twenty-three) hardworking and humble women who need to make their living every day.
They are independent in their businesses, but Rafaela sells food and drinks and needs a loan to increase the production of her food, and also to improve the quality of what she offers her customers.  She dreams of being able to prosper and have a large business where she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, cheese, oil, rice, sugar, pasta, salt and yerba (an herb) and to buy meat (pork, beef, chicken).  To buy cassava, fruit and vegetables, drinks, sodas, soft drinks and sweets, etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a businessman who operates motorbike transport business to earn his living.  He also sells charcoal so as to boost his income.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  He has really learnt a lot about business management through the training offered by Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his charcoal-selling business into wholesale in the future.  He also plans to buy another motorbike so as to earn more income.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: C9605 Muyange I Group

texts.en:
Innocent is 31 years old and is married. He is the president of this group which is called "Muyange I". He is the first person on the left side, first row. The group has two women and five men.

Innocent has three years of experience and he employs 63 people to help him but there are casual staff who earn as per day worked, and don't work every day. Innocent and his group have the same business: cultivation of crops. His business is open from 6am until 6pm every day except on the weekend.

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fertilizer for his field. With any profits, Innocent will be able to reinvest in this business and he will be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer  for  his field.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old.  She is a business lady who runs a salon.  She has been in the business for almost nine years.  She has managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya hence improving her living standard.  She also does dairy farming for more income.
