Jane works hard in her business so as to help her husband with household expenses.  She aspires to become a successful business lady in the future.  She has requested 30,000 Kes to buy a hair dryer and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair oil.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old, married and with two children.  For five years, he has been doing tailoring for a living.  He has managed to grow his business through Faulu Kenya.  This has made him improve his standard of living.  He  aspires to become a major supplier of school uniforms.  He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Teodora R. y la Sra. Teresa V., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, invitaron a sus amigas y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para mejorar su estilo de vida, son 18 (Díez y Ocho) integrantes.
La sra. Teresa es una vendedora de frutas y verduras, y como se aproxima la estación de otoño necesita ampliar las variedades cítricas de sus productos ofertados, por ello solicita el crédito para poder comprar más frutas y verduras de esta clasificación.
Son mujeres muy humildes y todas desean superar la pobreza en la que se encuentran ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
This committee was formed after Sras. Teodora R. and Teresa V. visited the office of Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. They invited their friends who decided to join their work group so that they could improve their lifestyles. There are 18 members in this group.

Sra. Teresa is a fruit and vegetable vendor. Since the autumn season is approaching, she needs to expand the variety of citrus fruits that she offers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more fruits of this type as well as vegetables.

These women are extremely humble. They all want to rise above the poverty that they and their families are currently experiencing.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and citrus fruits.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo M. is 28 years old and lives in the village of Tsilkani, Kartli Region.  He lives together with his big extended family, consisting of himself, his wife, daughter, parents, brother and grandmother. The family has been running an agricultural farm for 15 years which now counts four cows, seven calves, nine goats and 27 chickens. 

The family produces cheese and sells it in a grocery shop in Tbilisi (capital of the country). They also sell eggs and goat's milk. Agriculture is the main source of income for Sergo’s family, along with the salary he gets for working as a policeman. Sergo’s parents work in the farm, and his wife is busy with their 1-year-old daughter. 

With the loan Sergo plans to add two milch cows to the farm. It will allow them to produce more cheese and increase the income of the family. Increased income will allow Sergo to spend more on family well-being and he also plans to put aside some savings to reinvest the funds in further development of the farm.

loans.use: to purchase two milch cows.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. Emmanuel sells shoes in his market and his business is well-organized. Emmanuel employs one person to help him and he starts from 7am until 9pm every day and he has three years' experience in his business.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes for sale. With his profits, Emmanuel will reinvest in his business, satisfy his customers and he will build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en: Jean Baptiste M. is 43 years old, married, and has four children. For five years, Jean Baptiste has sold food such as beans, bananas, and meat in his small restaurant. His business is open from 8 am to 8 pm every day except on the weekends.  He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional food and drinks such as rice, soft drinks, bananas, and cassava flour to sell in his restaurant.  Jean Baptiste hopes to earn more profits which will allow him to save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase food  for his restaurant

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne N. N. is a member of Royal Success group under Faulu Kenya.  She runs the Josan tailoring business and has been in the business for six years.  She was previously selling shoes.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to run her business.  In five years, she hopes to open a tailoring shop where she will be selling fabric, threads, and buttons.  She has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Akoth O. is 33 years old, single and has three children aged between 9 and 14 years old. Her business is located at Mtopanga estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, including the Indian Ocean white beaches. 

Mary has a tailoring shop in which she makes clothes for the local people. She has been in this business for 10 years now and has three employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 30,000 KES to buy materials to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and open a second one in the future. She also hopes to give her children a quality education. She describes herself as jovial.

loans.use: to purchase materials to grow her business

loans.name: Alba Nery

texts.es:
Al lado de su madre y su familia conformada por su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Alba Nery T. oriunda del municipio de Andes Colombia decidió emprender camino hacia Medellín con el fin de buscar un mejor futuro, fue entonces cuando con los pocos ahorros que tenía inició su propio negocio al que no pudo encontrarle un mejor nombre que “Tienda la Esperanza”, ya que éste se convirtió en la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y salir adelante. 

Alba necesita de un crédito para comprar surtido, lograr tener más inventario y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alba Nery T. is from a town in the Colombian Andes. Along with her mother, husband, and four children, she decided to move to Medellín in search of a better future. When she arrived, Alba used what little savings she had to start her own business. One could not find a better name for her shop, “Tienda La Esperanza” (Store of Hope). She has taken advantage of this opportunity to improve her quality of life and move forward.

Alba needs a loan to buy an assortment of merchandise so that she can have more inventory and offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 32-year-old lady who runs a green grocery business. She is also employed. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Rosemary has seen a lot of growth in her business. This is because she is able to save her money which she uses to boost her business. She dreams of expanding into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fruits, cereals and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy fruits, cereals and charcoal

loans.name: Maura Leticia

texts.es:
La señorita Maura Leticia es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañía Espartillar, tiene 19 años y vive con sus padres, es estudiante.
Manifiesta que desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar como tejedora, ya que es un trabajo que aprendió de su madre y con su esfuerzo y dedicación logra obtener su propio ingreso que le ayuda para solventar sus gastos.
Los trabajos de artesanía que realiza distribuye en las casas comerciales y a los macateros (vendedores ambulantes) para su venta.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada y promete cumplir con puntualidad con el pago de sus cuotas y la de sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Srta. Maura Leticia is from the neighborhood of Espartillar in the city of Carapeguá. She is a 19 year old student who lives with her parents.

Maura says that as a young girl she began working as a weaver. She learned this skill from her mother and, with effort and dedication, was able to generate her own income to help cover her expenses. Her creations are distributed to trading houses and traveling vendors for resale.

Maura appreciates Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity given to her, so she promises to complete her payments on time and accomplish her objectives.

loans.use: To purchase yarn and fabric.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia tiene 46 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable. Ella inicio este medio de vida por su Mama ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a este negocio, Maria se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena cliente ya que el pago de sus cuotas las realiza en tiempo y forma se encuentra muy contenta con este financiamiento que lo utilizara para la compra de telas, pantalones, camisas, shorts, faldas, calzado, cosméticos, tratamientos, pintura de uñas y maquillaje.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is 46 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. She is known for being a very responsible person. Maria started earning a living in this manner by working with her mother, who previously engaged in this type of business. She has proven that she is a good client since she submits her loan payments in a timely manner.

Maria is pleased to receive this loan because she will use the funds to buy fabrics, trousers, shirts, shorts, skirts, shoes, cosmetics, treatments, nail polish, and make-up.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, trousers, shirts, shorts, skirts, shoes, cosmetics, treatments, nail polish, and make-up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and fresh foods to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has run an electronics repair business for the past seven years. He started by repairing items as a vendor and then later opened his own workshop. He faces the challenge of customers not picking up their items after he has repaired them. In future, he wants to have at least four business outlets. He wants to take out this loan in order to buy reconditioned items like TVs, radios, and spare parts. 

Patrick and his wife have two children. The family lives in their own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. Patrick's goal is to build a permanent family house.

loans.use: to buy reconditioned items like TVs, radios, and spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance on his tractor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, age 38, has operated a bar business for the past seven years. She is unmarried and lives with her two children and one additional dependent in Hioma, Uganda. She is the sole breadwinner for the family. Her primary business challenges are customers defaulting on payments and bottles getting broken; nevertheless, she is confident in her work and wishes to operate a bar in the city. Mary has requested this loan to buy drinks such as beer to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as beer to offer for sale in her bar

loans.name: Antoliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Antoliana G. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Compañia Tajy Loma, tiene 58 años de edad, con dos hijos profesionales docentes.
Hace más de 10 años que trabaja como macatera (vendedora ambulante) en las zonas de Asunción y Lambaré, además de Carapeguá, manifiesta que con su sacrificio logró contar con una buena cantidad de clientela, quienes semanalmente realizan sus pagos, también cabe destacar que los productos que lleva son de buena aceptación por parte de sus clientes ya que son de buena calidad.
Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo crediticio constante que le brinda para aumentar su oportunidad de negocio.
Ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de colchas, hamacas, edredones y pantalones para su reventa.
Su máximo sueño es no depender de sus hijos y que no sea una carga a la sociedad por lo que se empeña en mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Antoliana G. is from the neighborhood of Tajy Loma in the city of Carapeguá. She is 58 years old and has two children who are teachers.

For more than ten years, Antoliana has worked as a traveling saleswoman in the areas of Asunción, Lambaré, as well as Carapeguá. She says that her sacrifice resulted in a large number of customers who pay her on a weekly basis. It should also be mentioned that her products are well-received by her customers since they are of good quality.

Antoliana appreciates Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the constant support they have provided so that she can increase her business opportunities. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of blankets, hammocks, quilts, and trousers for resale. Her greatest wish is not to depend on her children and become a burden on society, so she strives to improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, hammocks, quilts, and trousers for resale.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia, age 31, is a vendor of cassava flour, a business venture she has operated for seven years. She and her husband have four children, and the family lives in a house that they own in Kasese, Uganda. Scovia's primary business hardships are bad debtors and thieves. Her vision for the future is to set up a food store and to ensure the education of her children. Scovia has requested this loan in order to buy cassava flour to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 32, owns and operates a bar. He launched this business two years ago using the capital of 800,000 shillings, and he now has 1,500,000 shillings. His primary business hardship is clients breaking his bottles while inebriated. 

Joseph has requested this loan in order to buy bottles of beer to offer for sale in his bar. His vision for the future is to move into a more spacious bar and to ensure the education of his children. 

He and his wife have seven children. The family lives live in a house that he owns in Kasese, Uganda.

loans.use: to buy bottles of beer to offer for sale in his bar

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man and the father of four children. He is from Lebanon. He is the main income provider for his family. He has six years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2007. He cultivates all type of vegetables and fruits according to the season. He uses plastic tents to better monitor his products quality. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. In the future, he plans to further expand his business and increase his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene la 75 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de costura, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para limpiar, realizar las compras y empezar las diferentes prendas de vestir que tiene pendiente. Hace más de  50 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para hilos, tijeras, telas, botones, encajes, bordados, zipper y aceite para engrasar su máquina.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 75 years old and has goals to succeed in life and get ahead in her business. What is most important to her is that she continues generating a daily income for her family. Her business activity involves providing sewing services. Maria must wake up early to clean up, make her purchases, and begin creating different garments that have been ordered. She started this business more than 50 years ago because she needed to find work. Maria decided to establish a small business because she did not possess the necessary experience. As time passed, she acquired the ability to communicate with her customers.

This loan will be used to purchase thread, scissors, fabrics, buttons, lace, fringe, zippers, and oil to lubricate her sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase thread, scissors, fabrics, buttons, lace, fringe, zippers, and oil to lubricate her sewing machine.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Dalia is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in product for 2 years. She started by selling 4 bags of coffee per month and now sells 9 bags of coffee per month. Her challenge is high coffee prices. Her vision is setting up a coffee store. Dalia intends to use the loan to buy coffee.

loans.use: to buy coffee

loans.name: Beatriz Cecilia

texts.es:
Desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 p.m. la tienda de Beatriz Cecilia P. V. abre las puertas para sus vecinos que encuentran allí una amplia oferta de productos para la canasta familiar y aunque la jornada laboral de esta emprendedora es bastante larga afirma con gran seguridad que es esta dedicación la que le permite salir adelante con su hijo, pues el ser madre soltera la ha obligado a trabajar fuertemente para llevar los gastos del hogar. 

Beatriz necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas mejoras en su local y comprar más surtido con el fin de mejorar cada vez más su negocio y ampliarlo hasta convertirse en una tienda reconocida.
texts.en:
Beatriz Cecilia P. V. opens the doors of her store to her neighbors from 7am to 11pm and offers a wide range of everyday products. Even though the working day is long, this entrepreneur says with great certainty that her dedication allows her son to get ahead. Beatriz is a single mother who is obligated to work hard in order to cover the household expenses.

She needs a loan to make a few improvements to her store and buy more merchandise in hopes of improving her business each day. Beatriz also wants to expand her business so that it will become a well-known establishment.

loans.use: To make improvements to her store and purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El cliente Hilarion Q. S. de 68 años de edad vive junto a su esposa. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio de Huanaco. El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes junto a su esposa en su domicilio. Además recibe una pensión mensual por ser jubilado pensionista. Según nos comenta su sueño es poder incrementar su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Hilarion Q. S. is 68 years old and lives with his wife.  They have their own home in the village of Huanaco.  He and his wife sells groceries out of their home.  In addition, Hilarion receives a monthly pension since he is retired.  He says his dream is to grow his business and have a better quality of life.

Hilarion is grateful for the support that has been provided through this loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for his store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one school-age child. He has been working in grocery stores for 10 years; then he decided to open his own mini market in 2008. He sells different types of goods in addition to selling vegetables. With his business income, he is able to satisfy his family's needs. This will be his third Kiva loan. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income. He expects that his business will continue to grow in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Lidia Ruth

texts.es: Lidia Ruth se ha caracterizado, por ser una mujer luchadora y que disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que se encuentra muy contenta por mejorar su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de calzado, ropa en general, toallas, sabanas, tratamientos, cremas, bolsos entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que llega a su vivienda, pues sabe que tiene que salir todos los días para ofrecer sus productos y algunas veces ella vende ciertos productos en su vivienda, en donde ciertos clientes saben lo que ofrece.
texts.en:
Lidia Ruth is known for being a determined woman who enjoys interacting with her customers. This is not the first time she has received financing and she is very pleased that the loans have helped to improve her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, clothes, towels, bed sheets, treatments, crèmes, bags, and other items. Lidia begins works every day at 7am and returns home at 9pm. She knows that she must go out every day to offer her products. Sometimes she will sell certain products from her home since some customers know they can purchase them there.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, clothes, towels, bed sheets, treatments, crèmes, bags, and other items.

loans.name: Eleno

texts.es:
El Sr. Eleno tiene 41 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. María Lorenza de 40 años de edad, llevan 18 años juntos y tienen 2 hijos, uno en edad escolar y el otro ya mayor de edad.
El desde muy temprana edad viajó con su hermano que trabajaba como constructor en Argentina, para trabajar como ayudante, ahí es donde aprendió, después de mucho tiempo de trabajar como ayudante decidió trabajar por cuenta propia como  constructor. 
Hace 19  años, con el dinero que juntó trabajando en Argentina regresó a Paraguay y se compró todas la herramientas necesarias para trabajar por cuenta propia, hoy día prácticamente es el único constructor de obra dentro de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de implementos (herramientas) puesto que tiene muchos trabajos en esta época.
texts.en:
Sr. Eleno is 41 years old and married to Sra. María Lorenzo, age 40. They have been together for 18 years and raised two children. One child is of school age and the other is an adult.

At an early age, Eleno traveled with his brother to Argentina to work in construction as an assistant. He learned on the job while he was there. After a long time of working as an assistant, he decided to become independent and work as a builder.

When he was 19, Eleno returned to Paraguay with the money he earned while working in Argentina. He bought all the equipment he needed to work on his own. Today he is practically the only builder in the city of Carapeguá.

Eleno is requesting a loan to buy tools since has many jobs scheduled this season.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Appoline

texts.en:
Appoline is 38 years old and married with five children. Appoline's husband is a teacher. Appoline has a business selling various items such as juice, water, sugar, rice and so on. Her business is well-organized and she is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day. 

Appoline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc. With these additional goods for sale, Appoline hopes that her profits will increase and allow her to continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like cooking oil, juice, water, etc.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de sus cuatro hijos menores, con muchas ganas de salir adelante se esfuerzan a diario. Desde hace dos años, luego de dedicarse a la comercialización de diferentes productos, decidió empezar a vender zapatos y zapatillas, tanto para damas y caballeros. Dice que al principio no fue fácil, porque  sus clientes estaban acostumbrados a comprarle productos para el hogar y menaje, pero luego de usar el calzado que ofrecía, percibieron que éstos eran de calidad. En la actualidad compra variedad de calzado en la ciudad, y los ofrece a mayores precios a sus conocidos con la modalidad de pago a crédito, y el negocio es muy rentable, ya que le permite solventar los gastos de su  hogar sin problemas.  Afirma que le desagrada cuando sus clientes se demoran en cancelar, y esto atrasa la compra de  mayor cantidad de calzado, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, éstos inconvenientes no la detienen y para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar la mercadería de calzado que ofrece, pues desea instalar una pequeña tienda en algún mercado cerca del lugar donde vive. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de calzado y zapatillas, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes, sobretodo por campaña escolar  y espera cumplir con todos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Rocío is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her four young children.  They make a daily effort to get ahead in life.  Two years ago, after having worked selling different products, she decided to start selling shoes and sneakers for both men and women.  She says that it was not easy at the beginning because her customers were used to buying household items from her.  However, after using the shoes that she sold, they noticed that they were of good quality.  She currently buys a variety of shoes in the city and sells them to her acquaintances at higher prices on credit.  The business is very profitable, as it allows her to cover the household costs without any problem.  She says that she doesn’t like when her customers are late in paying because this delays her buying more shoes.  However, because she is an enterprising woman, these inconveniences do not stop her.  In the future, she plans to expand her shoe merchandise since she wants to set up a small store in a market close to her house.  This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time, as she does not want to leave a bad impression with the people that made this loan possible and will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  She plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a variety of shoes and sneakers since she has several outstanding requests, particularly for the school year.  She hopes to fill all of these orders and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes and sneakers to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Leonida

texts.es:
La Sra. Leonida L. tiene 54 años de edad, está casada  y vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Desde temprana edad empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar las colchas artesanales, de quién aprendió el oficio, también compra ropas en general para volver a venderlo.
Hoy en día ella misma lleva a  vender sus productos en la zona de la capital del país con la ayuda de su marido, gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa y brindar buena atención a sus hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, sábanas y hamacas, además de telas para confección artesanal.
texts.en:
Leonida L. is 54 years old, married, and lives in her own house in the city of Carapeguá. She has four children who are all adults.

She began to help her mother make artisanal bedspreads from an early age and learned the trade from her. She also buys general clothing to sell.

She now brings her products to the country’s capital area to sell with the help of her husband. Thanks to this job, she was able to build a decent house and take good care of her children. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of bedspreads, sheets and hammocks, in addition to fabrics for artisanal jobs.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc. as well as fabrics for artisanal jobs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children. He is from Lebanon. For the past 15 years, he has made his living as a professional home painter. He operates his business by taking private projects. Thanks to his income, he is able to offer good living conditions for his family. 

Today he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase scaffolding and renew his tools. He reports that these improvements will enable him to serve more customers. In the future, he is planning to more expand his business operation by taking bigger projects and building a good business reputation.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and renew his tools.

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es: Don Denis Antonio, vive en el barrio San José junto a su hijo y su esposa, el tiene 31 años de edad. Su actividad es la venta de madera hace más de 5 años, realiza su trabajo durante toda la semana de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la noche. El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de madera necesaria para su negocio como cedro, caoba, pochote entre otras. Este préstamo le ayudara a solventar esta situación ya que él no tiene los fondos suficientes para cubrir los pedidos necesarios que sus clientes le realizan. La aspiración de Denis es continuar trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia y poder preparar académicamente a su hijo.
texts.en: Denis Antonio lives in the San José neighborhood with his son and wife.  He is 31 years old and he has worked selling wood for more than five years.  He works throughout the entire week from 7:00am to 6:00pm.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of wood necessary for his business, such as cedar, mahogany and pochote, among others.  This loan will help him to cover this expense since he doesn’t have sufficient funds to cover the cost of the orders made by his customers.  Denis hopes to continue working to get his family ahead in life and educate his son.

loans.use: to buy cedar, mahogany, and pochote

loans.name: Beth

texts.es: Beth, de 20 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres: Celestino y Clavita. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Hace 2 años que se dedica a la agricultura. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y producirla. Ahora en el terreno que le heredó su padre, siembra papa de toda variedad, donde saca además semillas para comercializarlo al por mayor, en el mercado de Huasahuasi; conocido por la buena papa que produce sus tierras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder tener un tiempo libre para poder implementar un negocio. Pues sus planes son abrir la tienda de comestibles que existió en su casa. Sin embargo su principal dificultad, es obtener el capital de trabajo para este nuevo proyecto. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre juntos”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente dichosa por pertenecer a una asociación respetada. Beth, dará el primer paso en la apertura de su negocio, por ello comprará con una parte del crédito insumos para su tienda de comestibles. Y con el resto del dinero, comprará abono orgánico para esparcirlo en sus cultivos.
texts.en: Beth is 20 years old and is a hardworking young woman.  She lives with her parents, Celestino and Clavita, in their own house located in the rural settlement of Cayan.  She has worked in agriculture for two years.  Since she was very young, her parents taught her to work and cultivate the land.  Now, she grows all types of potatoes on the land she inherited from her father.  She also removes the seeds to sell at wholesale in the Huasahuasi market, known for the good potatoes produced by the land there.  What she likes most about her work is being able to have free time to set up her business, as her plan is to open a grocery store in her house.  However, her main difficulty is obtaining the working capital for this new project.  She belongs to the Siempre Juntos Communal Bank and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is happy to be part of a respected association.  Beth will take the first step in opening her business, which is why she will buy supplies for her grocery store with part of the loan.  With the rest of money, she will purchase organic manure to spread on her cropland.

loans.use: to buy products to set up her store and to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes, general clothing, cosmetics, medicines, and powders

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcial S. es de la ciudad de Carapegua – compañia Tajy Loma, tiene 32 años, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 3 hijos. Su cónyuge es tejedora de frazadas en su domicilio teniendo un ingreso de forma particular.
El Sr. Marcial se dedica al comercio ambulante (macatero) hace más de 10 años; se dedica a este trabajo desde muy joven viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y así manejarse por cuenta propia en la vida.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar y hoy día cuenta con más de 60 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías (colchas, sábanas, hamacas, ropas), para posterior venta y un mayor ingreso económico.
Desde ya agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad de solicitar un crédito que lo ayude a progresar.
texts.en:
Marcial S. lives in Tajy Loma residential development, in the city of Carapegua.  He is 32 years old, owns his own home, and has 3 children.  His wife knits blankets at home, making her own income.

Marcial has been a traveling salesman for more than 10 years.  He has been in this business since he was very young as he needed to make his own income and his own way in life.

This is how he started working and today he has more than 60 active customers which makes him a considerable weekly income.

Marcial is requesting this loan to buy merchandise (bedspreads, sheets, hammocks and clothes) to sell so that he can make more income.  He is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity they have given him to request a loan that will help him to make progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (bedspreads, sheets, hammocks and clothes)

loans.name: Naise

texts.es: Naise, de 19 años, trabaja arduamente por apoyar a sus padres: Oscar y Luz. A quienes ama mucho, además de sus hermano Lenin. Con quienes vive en armonía familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. A pesar de su corta edad, supo adquirir no solo la experiencia necesaria para obtener buenos frutos, también sus propios terrenos agrícolas, en donde siembra papa, maíz y arveja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder trabajar en beneficio suyo. Asimismo tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, leche, huevo y demás alimentos. Según menciona, vende un promedio de S/. 60 nuevos soles cada día. Su principal dificultad es el capital de trabajo, pues para que obtenga ganancias inmediatas tiene que surtir en productos diversos para su tienda, ya que en la agricultura invierte la mayor parte de sus ingresos. Los sueños de Naise, es crear una tienda grande y surtida para los pobladores de su localidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre juntos”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le dieron para poder concretizar sus proyectos. Naise, se está preparando para la cosecha de sus sembríos de maíz en los primeros días de Marzo, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono; con los que espera obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Naise is 19 years old.  She works hard to support her parents Oscar and Luz who she loves very much, and also her brother Lenin.  They live together peacefully as a family in their own home which is located in the village of Cayan.  In spite of her young age, Naise has managed to acquire not only the experience she needs to ensure good harvests but also her own farmland where she grows potatoes, corn and peas.  What she most likes about her work is being able to work for herself.

Naise also owns a grocery store where she sells essentials such as sugar, milk, eggs and other food products.  She tells us that she sells an average of 60 Peruvian soles' worth of goods every day.  The main difficulty she faces in her business is that of working capital since, in order to make immediate profits, she has to stock her store with a range of products.  Most of her money is tied up in her farming.

Naise's dream is to create a big, well-stocked store for the residents of her village.  She belongs to the "Siempre Juntos" (Always Together) community bank and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity that they have given her to carry out her plans.  Naise is getting prepared for the harvesting of her corn crop at the beginning of March.  She will use her loan to buy several sacks of manure which she hopes will allow her to obtain good profits.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 49 years old and is married with three children. Jacqueline earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. This is her 15th successful year in this business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8am until 7pm every day.

Jacqueline needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more cloth for sewing. By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Jacqueline hopes to earn more profits, and she will save for her future. Thus, she will create another job for the people in her community.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for sewing

loans.name: Tomas Andres

texts.es:
El señor Tomas C. tiene 32 años, vive en la compañía Potrero de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es muy activo, se dedica a la compra y empaquetamiento de especias, condimentos y plantas medicinales en general. Esta actividad lo está realizando desde el año 1997, pues le había ayudado un amigo al principio y luego con el apoyo de sus padres había montado su propio negocio. Hoy día cuenta con mucha clientela y tiene visión de crecimiento.
Él tiene varios créditos cancelados con buen promedio de pagos y según comentó su demanda había crecido pero no tiene la capacidad suficiente para abastecer el mercado, razón por la cual solicita el apoyo crediticio.
Gracias a su esfuerzo ya tiene casa propia y su expectativa se orienta en mejorar su calidad de vida  y por ende la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas C. is 32 years old and lives in Potrero in the city of Carapeguá. He is very active and works selling and packaging spices, condiments, and medicinal plants. He has done this work since 1997 after a friend helped him get started and his parents later helped him start his own business. He currently has a lot of customers and foresees a lot of growth.

He has repaid many loans at a good rate and shared that his demand has been increasing but he does not have enough merchandise to meet demand and for this reason is asking for loan support. Thanks to his hard work he already has his own house and expects to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Buy anise, dill, borage, and other spices and medicinal plants

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 53 years-old and married with four grown children and four grandchildren. Every week, Felicitas travels six hours from Ayacucho to the jungle town of San Francisco to sell regional vegetables and fruits in her market stand there. Felicitas is asking for a loan of 2,000 PEN in order to buy potatoes, squash, tomatoes, mangoes, and grapes in bulk from Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho. She will also use part of her loan to pay the cost of transportation from Ayacucho to San Francisco. 

She says business has been a bit slow lately but she expects it to pick up as the new school year begins. Felicitas is a long time member of Kiva partner FINCA Peru and says she particularly likes the ease in which they lend money and help her save. She has sent all of her children to school using her savings with FINCA Peru. Her goal right now is to keep saving in order to complete construction on the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, squash, tomatoes, mangoes and grapes

loans.name: La Unión 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Amarilis is one of the members of the “La Unión 1 y 2” (The Union 1 & 2) Group. They are micro enterpriser's dedicated to clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoe sales, teaching, food sales, etc., in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s most rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture.

Amarilis is the mother of four children, who she has raised with many sacrifices and much effort together with her long-term partner. She will save her profits to invest in her house's concrete block structure. She started building a short time ago, while they are living in part of the house that is still with the old structure. Her favorite pastime is cooking and her main challenge is to finish building her house. 

She currently sells bed and bathroom linens. Amarillis is planning to invest the money from her new loan in purchasing bedding sets, curtains and bathroom carpets. She has been collaborating with Kiva's partner, Esperanza, for five years now and is getting her tenth loan. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has maD. some good investments. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: to buy bedding sets

loans.name: Ndekezi

texts.en: E. is 34 years old. He is married with five children aged between 1 and 9 years old. E. owns a business selling breads. His business is open from 6am to 10pm every day. He has 5 years of experience in this business and currently employs 5 people to help him. E. has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing his business by purchasing more breads to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to purchase more breads to sell

loans.name: Rocio Fernanda

texts.es:
Roció de 22 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene en la parte delantera de su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres. Vende arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su tienda de víveres. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Vende los víveres a un precio muy económico para sus clientes. Quiere seguir con su tienda por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar etc. En el futuro quiere darle un buen futuro a sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Roció is 22 years old. She is a young entrepreneur who has a small grocery store in the front part of her house. She sells rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, etc. 

She has great aspirations for her business, and she would like to continue operating her grocery store. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day. She sells her products at prices that are very affordable for her customers. She would like to continue with her store, and for this reason she would like a loan to buy beverages, rice, sugar, etc. In the future, she would like to provide a good future for her four children.

loans.use: to buy beverages, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es: El señor José Gregorio está pidiendo un crédito para poder comprar cedro, caoba, herramientas y otros materiales para su trabajo el cual es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. El tiene 10 años con este negocio, ha sido de gran provecho para su familia, ya que es por medio del servicio que el brinda es que ha podido mantener a su familia. Este oficio lo aprendió de su papa, actualmente el ya no puede trabajar y le ofreció el negocio a Gregorio.  El sueño de él es agrandar su taller con maquinarias más modernas.
texts.en: José Gregorio is requesting a loan to buy cedar, mahogany, tools and other materials for his work, which is the main source of income for his family. He has operated this business for 10 years, and it has been very beneficial to his family, since through the service he provides he has been able to support his family. He learned this profession from his father, who now cannot work anymore and offered the business to Gregorio.  Gregorio's dream is to expand his workshop with more modern equipment.

loans.use: to buy cedar, mahogany, tools and other materials

loans.name: Emille

texts.en:
Emille, age 31, earns his living as a motorbike taxi driver. He has been engaged in this business for 3 years and his business is well-organized. He gets up at 5am and works until 9pm every day, transporting people from their workplaces. He and his wife have three children.

Emile has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy essential materials for his motorbike. His goal is to send all his siblings to school, pay fees for his children, and to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for his motorcycle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa S. es de la ciudad de Carapegua – compañía Potrero, tiene 38 años y cuenta con casa propia, tiene pareja y 5 hijos.
La Sra. Blanca se dedica al comercio ambulante (macatera) desde hace más de 5 años; se dedica a este trabajo desde muy joven tejiendo frazadas en su domicilio para otras personas quienes llevaban a vender por las ciudades vecinas, pero viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso mayor decidió vender ella misma sus productos.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar como macatera y hoy día cuenta con más de 50 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Comercializa sus productos por Carapegua y Gran Asunción.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de hilos y telas.
texts.en:
Teresa S. lives in Potrero neighborhood, in the city of Carapegua.  She is 38 years old and lives with her partner and 5 children.  She owns her own home.

Teresa has been working as a traveling saleswoman for more than 5 years.  She started out in her line of work when she was very young, weaving blankets at home for other people who would take them and sell them in neighboring towns.  However, as she needed to make more income, she decided to start selling her products herself.  Teresa started working as a traveling saleswoman and she currently has more than 50 active customers which makes her a considerable weekly income.  She sells her products in Carapegua and Gran Asunción.

Teresa is requesting this loan to buy threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy threads and fabrics

loans.name: Theopiste

texts.en:
Theopiste, age 24, sells such items as breads, biscuits, and cooking oil from her general store. Her business is open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. and she currently employs one person to help her. Theopiste is married and has one child.

Theopiste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business by purchasing additional goods to offer for sale such as toilet paper, lotions, additional bread items, and biscuits. Expanding her inventory in this way will help her to attract more customers and to attain a good profit. With this profit, she will be able to save in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes T. R. tiene 51 años, Es Soltera vive un hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable y lograr una buena economía.

Le gusta salir a pasear en el pueblo y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes T. R. is 51 years old.  She is single and lives with her child in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat, and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

María is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed from 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in Guaranda's 'Feria de los Jueves' market.

María is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to have a stable business and to reach a good financial position.

María enjoys going for walks around the village and celebrating fiestas.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals, feed supplies and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Nakaggwa

texts.en:
B. Nakaggwa has owned and operated a tailoring business for seven years, and she works six days a week. She also sells medicines as an additional source of income. B. has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cloth and materials to make school uniforms for several local schools. Her primary business challenge is seasonality.

B. is the single mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Hes goal is to improve the quality of life for herself and her children. She owns her own home in Kampala, Uganda, but the family does not have access to electricity or to piped water. Her primary monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and materials to make school uniforms for several local schools

loans.name: San Pedro Sur 3 Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Pedro Sur esta ubicado en el Barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de Choluteca, esta integrado por 3 mujeres, las cuales son muy unidas, trabajan duro para salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Emerita H. es una mujer que se dedica a la venta de leña, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion. tiene muchos clientes ya que la leña en esta zona es usada para las estufas y hornos, la mayoria de las casas cocinan con este tipo de estufas.

Emerita es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica vender la leña en otros lugares.
Emerita en sus tiempos libres se dedica  a visitar la iglesia.
 
doña Nixa G. se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero en su casa de habitacion, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, tiene mucha experiencia en la elaboracion de pan, todos los dias  se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para elaborar su rico pan que lo vende en la ciudad de Choluteca.
Nixa cuenta con la ayuda de un hermano para la distribucion del pan.
en sus tiempos libres visita a sus familiares.

la joven Kenia Suyen M. se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
Kenia es madre soltera y tiene la ayuda de su madre para el cuidado de sus hijos mientras esta elaborando y vendiendo las tortillas.

sus tiempos libres lo dedica para visitar la iglesia.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Sur Group is located in the Barrio San Pedro in the city of Choluteca. It is made up of three women who are very united. They work hard to get ahead. Here are the different activities they do:

Mrs. Emerita H. is a woman who works selling firewood. She has her business in her home. She has many customers since they use firewood in this zone for stoves and ovens. The majority of the houses cook with this type of stove.

Emerita is the mother of three children. Her husband works selling firewood in other places. In her free time, Emerita visits the church.

Mrs. Nixa G. works making bread in her home. She has been doing this for many years. She has a lot of experience in making bread. Every day she gets up at 4:00 am to make her tasty bread that she sells in the city of Choluteca. Nixa shares that her brother helps her distribute the bread. In her free time she visits her relatives.

Kenia Suyen M. is a young woman who works making and selling tortillas. She has done this work for four years. Her business is located in her home. Kenia is a single mother who has the help of her mother to care for her children while she is making and selling tortillas. In her free time she goes to church.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime, water, sugar, eggs, lard, baking powder, seasonings, margarine, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Maria Joaquina

texts.es:
Maria Joaquina T. R. tiene 47 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica y dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta trabajar, descansar, salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Joaquina T. R. is 47 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and her unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children.

The 'Grupo Emanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

María is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in Guaranda's 'Feria de los Jueves' market.

María is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve her financial situation and provide her children with an education.

María enjoys working, resting and going out for walks with her family.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals, animal feed and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Hammer

texts.es: Hammer, de 18 años es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Ninfa, su padre Roly y su hermano menor Renzo, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Las aspiraciones de este ambicioso hombre son grandes, su seriedad y coraje le ayudan a trabajar 3 veces a la semana en sus terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra toda variedad de papa. Asimismo su proyecto es prepararse para postular a una universidad del estado peruano, con lo que podrá brindar a sus cultivos el nivel de calidad que se propone. Ya tiene 2 años de experiencia sembrando en un terreno pequeño que heredó en “Hatunago”; donde le proporciona 20 sacos de papa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es limpiar la maleza que crece entre sus plantaciones. La principal dificultad de Hammer, son los gastos que requiere apoyar a su familia y hermano menor. Pero confía que con la ayuda de sus padres y su trabajo duro podrá obtener muchos logros. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre juntos”, y este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le ofrecen. Hammer, cosechará dentro de un mes papa de la variedad “única”, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Hammer, aged 18, is a hard-working single man.  He lives with his mother Ninfa, his father Roly, and his minor brother Renzo, in his own house, located in the settlement of Cayan.

Hammer's aspirations are great.  His seriousness and courage motivate him to work 3 times a week in his agricultural terrain, where he sows all varieties of potatoes.  In addition, one of his projects is to prepare himself to apply for entry into a Peruvian state university, which could help him to give his crops the level of quality that he intends.  Hammer has 2 years experience sowing the small plot he inherited in Hatunago that produces 20 sacks of potatoes.  

What he likes most about his work is to clear the weeds that grow among his plantings.  Hammer's principle difficulty is the costs required to help his family and minor brother.  But he is confident that with his parent's help, and his hard work. he will achieve much.

Hammer belongs to the “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together) Communal Bank, and this is his first loan with MFP, where he appreciates the opportunity for progress they offer.  Within a month, Hammer will harvest potatoes of the “unique” variety.  For this, he intends to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: TO BUY SACKS OF ORGANIC FERTILIZER

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new tires & paint his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet, de 28 años. Es una mujer feliz, pues ama a su esposo Oscar con quien tiene una hija, Jatniel de 4 años, a la que educan en unión familia. En su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar. Para cuidar adecuadamente de su familia, dejó su trabajo de profesora de inicial; donde cuidaba a niños menores de 5 años. Asimismo su esposo trabaja en el gobierno local como ingeniero agrónomo, en proyectos de desarrollo rural. Consiente de los gastos que ocasionó dejar su trabajo. Ella abrió una pequeña librería en su casa, vendiendo papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos y demás útiles de escritorio. Pero la actividad que apasiona a Lizet y Oscar es la agricultura. En sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas siembra café, el cual cosecha una vez al año, vendiendo su grano a la cooperativa de la localidad de Sanchirio Palomar, por intermedio de su padre, que es uno de los socios de la cooperativa. Ahora ella desea mejorar su producción y seguir progresando con su negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura que concretará sus objetivos. Lizet, se está preparando para la campaña escolar y la cosecha de café; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar abono orgánico, útiles de escritorio, y con lo que resta pagará el salario de los peones que contratará para la recolección de los primeros granos de café.
texts.en: Lizet is 28 years old.  She is a happy person and she loves her husband, Oscar, with whom she has a 4-year-old daughter named Jatinel who they educate together.  They live in their own house located in Unión Palomar.  In order to properly care for her family, she left her job teaching pre-school, where she cared for children under 5 years old.  Her husband works for the local government as an agricultural engineer for rural development projects.  Aware of the expenses she caused in leaving her job, she opened a small bookstore in her house where she sells paper, pens, notebooks, and other desk supplies.  However, she is most passionate about farming.  She grows coffee, which she harvests once a year, on her four hectares of farmland and later sells the grains to the Sanchirio Palomar area cooperative through her father, who is one of the members of the cooperative.  Now she wants to improve her production and continue progressing with her business.  She belongs to the Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma Communal Bank and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is sure that she will meet her goals.  Lizet is getting ready for the school year and her coffee harvest.  For this reason, she plans to use the loan to purchase organic manure, office supplies, and use the rest to pay the farm workers that she will hire to collect the first coffee beans.

loans.use: to buy school items and materials to sell for the school year, as well as to hire workers to pick coffee beans

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor Martínez ofrece el servicio de litografía y publicidad, oficio que aprendió cuando trabajó como empleado de una empresa  muy importante en la ciudad de Barranquilla durante 8 años y su experiencia en la vida de negocios la inició posteriormente durante 4 años,  después de haber quedado sin empleo y se dedicó con su esposa a la preparación de hayacas y pasteles que distribuía entre amigos y familiares,  ingresos con los que garantizaron durante esta temporada el sustento de sus dos hijos que hoy están en las edades de 7 y 28 años; cuando esta actividad no   satisfizo a Nicanor porque no dejaba la rentabilidad esperada  pensó en su gran experiencias en las artes gráficas y así fue como nació el negocio de litografia y publicidad que ahora presenta. Nicanor ahora se siente más conectado con lo que hace  y muy feliz  porque ahora  ofrece un mayor  bienestar a su familia. 
El ha recibido 6 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ellos ha logrado ampliar su negocio y la cobertura de clientes con un mayor número de empresas,  que ahora forman parte de su lista de de compradores rentables;  en la actualidad está aplicando a  su primer credikiva con el cual comprará  papelería para formatos, facturas y publicidad en general, que requiere para popularizar aun mas su negocio. Su meta y gran desafío es mas adelante poder comprar una máquina litográfica GT046, para brindar mayor calidad en sus trabajos que requieren una mayor escala.
texts.en:
Nicanor Martínez offers a lithography and publicity service. He learned this trade when he worked for eight years for a very important company in the town of Barranquilla. For the following four years he got experience as a businessman, and then was out of work for a while. At that time he and his wife made hayacas (type of tamale) and pies and sold them to friends and relatives. The income from this work provided support for their two children aged 7 and 28.

When this job no longer satisfied Nicanor as it wasn’t profitable enough, he remembered his expertise in graphic arts, and thus his current lithography and publicity business was born. He now feels more connected to his work and happier too that he can offer a better standard of living to his family.

He has received six loans from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and used the money to expand his business and increase his customer base which now consists of a large number of profitable companies. 

Nicanor is now applying for his first loan with Kiva. He plans to use the money to buy paper for forms, receipts, and advertisements in general. This will make his business more popular than ever. His objective and greatest wish is to buy a GT046 lithography machine in the future so that he can do large-scale, high-quality work.

loans.use: to buy paper for forms, receipts, and advertisements

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es: Isabel Reyna de 53 años, reside en el barrio Ana Virgen Noble. Su núcleo familiar está conformado únicamente por su compañero de vida y dos hijos menores de edad. Ella posee su negocio que es venta de bolis lo cual comercializa refrescos artesanalaes, la cual le deja muy buenas ganancias, debido a que ofrece una buena calidad de sus productos y también gracias a su excelente ubicación la cual es estar ubicada en lugar donde es muy recorrido por clientes. Solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar bolsas para los bolis, gelatinas, hielo para mantenerlos refrigerados entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Isabel Reyna is 53 years old and lives in the Ana Virgen Noble neighborhood.  Her nuclear family consists of her life partner and two young children.  She runs a business selling “bolis”, which are artisanal soft drinks.  She earns very good income from this business due to the fact that she sells good-quality products and because of her business' excellent location in a place well frequented by customers.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy bags for the “bolis”, gelatins, and ice to keep them cold, among other items.

loans.use: to buy bags for the "bolis", gelatins, and ice

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es:
Maria Agustina R. R. tiene 37 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un terreno para seguir sembrando para que los ingresos aumenten para dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta trabajar, descansar, salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Agustina R. R. is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her single children in the Canton of Guaranda within the Province of Bolívar. She has six children.

The members of the Grupo Emanuel Communal Bank are located in the Precinct of San Juan, which belongs to the Canton of Guaranda. This bank has 17 members who work farming short-cycle crops like corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as raising animals like pigs and chickens.

Maria works in agriculture growing corn and raising pigs and chickens. She buys her products every weekend at Comercial Silva and the animal feed. She sells them at the Thursday market in the city of Guaranda.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals as well as food and farming supplies. The loan will help her financially to cover her needs. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases, as well as the change in weather. Her dream is to have a piece of land to continue farming so that her earnings increase and she can provide her children with an education.

She likes to work, rest, and go out with her family.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals as well as food and farming supplies

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya N. has owned and operated a business of selling second-hand clothes for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. She generates additional income through engaging in brick-laying work. Lukiya has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale. The main business challenges for Lukiya include defaulters and the difficulties of transportation. Lukiya's goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself.    

Lukiya and her husband have five children and also support some of their grandchildren. The family lives in a house that they own in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. The family has access to electricity and to piped water. Lukiya's major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY VEGETABLES, MEAT, SEA FOOD,SAUSAGES, AND DRINKS TO PREPARE MEALS TO SELL

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria Natividad M. Aguachela tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener buena situación economica.

Le gusta visitar a la familia y caminar.
texts.en:
Maria Natividad M. Aguachela is 33 years old, married and lives with her husband and unmarried children in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has 6 children.  

The members of the Enmanuel Group communal bank live in the San Juan area in the Guaranda canton.  This group has 17 members, like Maria, that work in agriculture planting short cycle crops like corn, wheat, large quantities of potatoes as well as raising animals like pigs and hens.  Maria goes every weekend to the Silva commercial market to buy animal feed and where she also buys products that she then sells at the Thursday market in the city of Guaranda. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, wheat, potatoes and animals as well as feed and farming supplies.  The loan will help her to  financially meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are pests, disease and weather variation.  Her dream is to improve her economic situation.  She likes to walk and visit with her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wheat and potatoes as well as feed and farming supplies.

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es:
doña Celmira es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su trabajo, Celmira se dedica a la venta de granos basicos, vende frijoles, arroz, azucar y maiz en su casa de habitacion.
Celmira tiene como meta montar una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Celmira es madre de 4 hijos,  los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.
Junto con su esposo trabajan duron para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en agricultura.
todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar a sus hijos para despacharlos a la escuela y luego atiende a sus clientes.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar la Iglesia.
texts.en:
Celmira is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her work, selling basic grains.  She sells beans, rice, sugar and corn from her home. 

Celmira's goal is to set up a grocery store in her home.  She has four children who all attend school in her community.  Together with her husband, Celmira works hard to get her children ahead in life.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Every day, Celmira gets up at 4.00am to get her children ready for school, then she serves her customers.  In her free time she goes to church.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans, corn, rice and sugar

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario R. S. tiene 39 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario R. S. is 39 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and her unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 7 children.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

María is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and she sells her products in Guaranda's 'Feria de los Jueves' market.

María is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve her home and provide her children with an education.

María enjoys celebrating local fiestas.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, putty and tools

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio, de 60 años. Es un hombre trabajador, se separó de su esposa hace algunos años; a pesar de ello sigue adelante cuidando de sus 4 hijos, quienes juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). “El trabajo constante”, es su lema; ya que hace 40 años viene dedicándose tenazmente a la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de plátanos y café, productos que cuida, fertiliza y limpia constantemente. Como la cosecha de café es una vez al año; Eugenio contratará personal para que le apoyen en la extracción del grano. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el empeño y esfuerzo que le da y se ve reflejado cuando cosecha y comercializa en su totalidad. Hace poco con las ganancias obtenidas abrió una tienda de comestibles, donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad obteniendo ganancias diarias. Ahora desea incrementar sus ingresos con la mejora de sus cultivos; pues desea brindar un mejor futuro a su menor hijo Juan y su nieta Araceli, quienes son aún niños. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece la confianza recibida. Eugenio, se está preparando para la cosecha de sus granos de café. Por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono asimismo comprará productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 60 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has been separated from his wife for some years.  In spite of this, he continues to get ahead in life and care for his 4 children who live in their own home in the town of Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  "Constant work" is Eugenio's motto since he has been working tenaciously in the field of agriculture for 40 years.  His main crops are bananas and coffee, products that he cares for, fertilizes and weeds constantly.  As his coffee harvest takes place once a year, Eugenio hires staff to support him in extracting his beans.  What he most likes about his work is the determination and effort that he puts in which is clearly reflected when he harvests and sells all of his crops.  A little while ago, he used his profits to open a grocery store where he sells essentials.  This makes him daily profits.  He would currently like to increase his income by improving his crops so that he can provide his younger son Juan and his granddaughter Areceli with a better future (they are both still children).

Eugenio is a member of the "Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma" community bank and this is the first loan that he has had from MFP.  He is grateful for the trust that has been placed in him.  Eugenio is preparing to harvest his coffee crop.  He is planning to use this loan to buy several sacks of manure.  He will also buy essentials to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure and also products to stock his store

loans.name: Blanca Morayma

texts.es:
Blanca Morayma R. R. tiene 32 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la vivienda para vivir mejor.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Morayma R. R. is 32 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 4 children.
