The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

Blanca is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in the 'Feria de los Jueves' market in Guaranda.

Blanca is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to fix up her home so that she can live better.

Blanca likes to go out for walks with her family.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Almira

texts.es:
La señora Almira, es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Son dos años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la elaboración de bocaditos como rosquitas, ñutos, suspiros, bizcochuelos, panes, sus hijos le ayudan en la elaboración y también en el asado del ambiente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará un saco de almidón, 1 caja de manteca, 1 galón de aceite, 1 kilo de levadura, ½ saco de azúcar, 7 doc. de huevos.
Su trabajo lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con un horno artesanal que le es muy económico por que no tiene que gastar en energía eléctrica.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que brinda dando las charlas educativas a las socias para que puedan manejar con mucha responsabilidad su dinero.
texts.en:
Almira is a member of Las Luchadoras (The Fighters), a communal bank located in Campo Verde, a district of the Ucayali department. She is 38 years old, she is married and she has 4 children.
She has been receiving loans by Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She engages in preparing snacks such as rosquitas, ñutos, suspiros (typical Peruvian pastries), cookies, breads. Her children help her preparing the snacks as well as caring for the cleanliness of the shop.
With this new loan of 1,000.00 PEN she will buy one bag of starch, one box of lard, one gallon of oil, one kilo of yeast, half a bag of sugar and 7 dozens of eggs.
She works in her house, as she can count on a crafts oven that is very cheap for her, as she does not have to waste electricity.
She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the help provided through the educational lectures, held for the members to teach them how to responsibly manage their money.

loans.use: To buy starch, lard, oil, yeast, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. has been the owner of a retail store business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Grace sells her products from her home. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cans of cooking oil. The main business challenges for Grace include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of commodities. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at the wholesale level.    

Grace and her husband own a home in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. The have four children, all of whom are in school. The family has access to electricity and to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cans of cooking oil

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca R. R. tiene 27 años, Es divorciada vive con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del cantón.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca R. R. is 27 years old. She is divorced, she ha s3 children and she lives with her single children in Guaranda, a canton of the Bolívar province.

She is a member of the V.R.C. Grupo Enmanuel, a village bank located in San Juan, a precinct of the Guaranda canton. This bank has 17 members who work as farmers engaging in cultivating short cycle varieties of maize, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as in breeding of animals such as pigs and hens.

Maria engages in agriculture, growing maize and breeding pigs and hens. She buys the products to feed his animals in the Comercial Silva every week-end, and he sells his animals every Thursday in the Guarada fair.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies. The loan will economically help her fulfilling her needs, facing challenges such as pests, plant illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of owning a house.

She enjoys taking part in the canton’s celebrations.

loans.use: To sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa Aurora M. M. tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ingresos estables.

Le gusta salir a las fiestas.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurora M. M. is 33 years old. She is married, she has 3 children, and she lives with her husband and their single children in Guaranda, a canton of the Bolívar province.

She is a member of the V.R.C. Grupo Enmanuel, a village bank located in San Juan, a precinct of the Guaranda canton. This bank has 17 members who work as farmers engaging in cultivating short cycle varieties of maize, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as in breeding of animals such as pigs and hens.

Rosa engages in agriculture, growing maize and breeding pigs and hens. She buys the products to feed his animals in the Comercial Silva every week-end, and he sells his animals every Thursday in the Guarada fair.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies. The loan will economically help her fulfilling her needs, facing challenges such as pests, plant illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of having a fixed income.

She likes going to parties.

loans.use: To sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies.

loans.name: Nora Marita

texts.es:
La señora Nora, es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito de Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Recién lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, ropa que vende por los caseríos y amigos.  Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 pantalones, 20 polos, 5 vestidos para niñas, 10 pantalones para niños, 5 chompitas para niños, 10 faldas para damas, 3 vestidos, 10 blusas, 10 camisas manga larga,  2 doc. de ropas interiores para damas, 2 doc. de calzoncillos para caballeros, 1 doc., de calzoncillos para niños.
Con este negocio puede ayudar en los gastos del hogar, porque si  sus clientes no tienen dinero le pagan con animales de corral (patos, gallinas, cuy)  y los recibe  para luego venderlos en el mercado. 
En este tiempo ha podido aportar con algo a su hogar, está contenta porque el negocio va muy bien.
texts.en:
Señora Nora is a member of the communal bank Las Luchadoras (The Fighting Women) in the district of Campo Verde of the department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of six children.

It is just one year ago that she took out her first loan from Manuela Ramos. She sells second-hand clothes to villagers in the hamlets nearby and to her friends. Her husband is a farmer.

She will use her new loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy 15 pairs of pants, 20 polo shirts, 5 dresses for girls, 10 pairs of pants for boys, 5 sweaters for children, 10 skirts for women, 3 suits, 10 blouses, 10 long-sleeved shirts, 24 items of underwear for women, 24 underpants for men and 12 underpants for boys.

This business enables her to help with household expenses, because when her customers have no money she barters her merchandise for small farm animals (ducks, chickens or guinea pigs) and sells them at the market. Recently she was able to improve her home. She is happy because her business is doing fine.

loans.use: to buy clothes, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
Maria Laura M. R. tiene 30 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ingresos estables.

Le gusta salir a las fiestas.
texts.en:
Maria Laura M. R. is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her single children in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar. She has 2 kids. 

The members of the V.R.C. ENMANUEL group are located in the San Juan area near the Guaranda canton. The group is made of up 17 members who are dedicated to farming. They work in short cycles of planting corn, wheat, large quantities of potatoes, and the breeding of animals such as pigs and chickens. 

Maria is dedicated to farming to grow corn and raise hogs and chickens. She buys her products every weekend from the Comercial Silva (local commercial business) for animal food and sells every Thursday at the fair in the city of Gauranda. 

She is requesting a loan to plant corn, wheat, potatoes, purchase animals and also to buy food for feeding and inputs (such as fertilizer) for her crops. The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as the plague, sicknesses, and the varying climate. Her dream is to have a stable income. 

She enjoys going to festivals.

loans.use: To plant corn, wheat, potatoes and purchase animals.

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Angel Segundo R. A. tiene 30 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

ANGEL  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ingresos estables.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Segundo R. A. is 30 years old, married, and he lives with his wife and with the unmarried children in the community of Guaranda of the Bolivar province. He has 4 children. 

The members of the group named Enmanuel live in the district of San Juan, belonging to the community of Guaranda. This group is made up of 17 members and they are dedicated to short-cycle agriculture including the cultivation of corn, wheat, and potatoes in large quantities, and they also raise livestock such as pigs and poultry. 

Angel is an agriculturist who plants corn and he raises pigs and poultry. He purchases feed for his livestock from the Silva commerce center every weekend. He sells the livestock at the fairs on Thursdays in the city of Guaranda. 

He requests a loan to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes and to purchase more livestock and their feed. With the support of this loan he will be able to meet his financial needs and he will be able to face challenges such as plagues and blights and the changing weather. His dream is to have a steady income. 

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat, potatoes and to acquire livestock

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
don Rene C. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Obraje Namasigue Choluteca, Rene es señor trabajador y muy dedicado a su negocio, Rene se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Rene es padre de 4 hijos, los cuales los tiene en la escuela de la comunidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su
esposa cuando el no esta en la casa.
don Rene se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para atender su clientela.
su tiempo libre lo dedica ala crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
la meta de Rene es que sus hijos se graduen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene C. is 45 years old and he lives in the community of Obraje Namsique Choluteca. Rene is a hardworking man who is very dedicated to his business. Rene sells every day products from a small store located in his house. 

Rene is the father of 4 children, who all attend the community school. He is able to depend on his wife for support when he is not at home. 

Rene starts his day every day at 5 in the morning in order to attend to his clientele.  In his spare time he raises poultry and chickens.  The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to stock his grocery store. Rene's goal is to see his children graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase general store merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Llurlith Lluiza

texts.es:
La señorita Llurlith es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito de Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera.
Lleva 2 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un multiservicio donde vende utiles escolares y artículos de bazar, entre otros.
Con su nuevo prestamos de S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara; ½ millar de cuadernos,  5 cajas de lapiceros, 1 caja de lápiz, 1 caja de borrador, 3 doc. de colores, 2 doc. de juego de reglas, 3 doc. de cuaderno de dibujo, 3 doc. de caligrafía.
Con esto implementará un poco más el negocio ya que se encuentrean en campaña escolar, aprovechando que es soltera trabaja hasta los días domingos, porque son los días que sale la gente de la chacra para hacer sus compras.
Ella agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, gracias a los préstamos su negocio está creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Llurlith is a member of the communal bank named "The Fighters" which is located in the district of Campo Verde in the Department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and she is single. 

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) through two loan cycles. She has a general store from where she sells school supplies, house-hold articles, and others.

With her new loan of S/1000 nuevos soles she will purchase 500 notebooks, 5 boxes of pens, 1  box of pencils, 1 box of erasers, 3 dozen colored pencils, 2 dozen sets of rulers, 3 dozen  drawing books, and 3 dozen calligraphy sets. 

With these items she will supplement her business inventory to get ready for the new school year. Taking advantage of the fact that she is single she is able to work even on Sundays. This is the day of the week that people leave their rural homes to make their purchases. 

She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement. It is thanks to these loans that her business has been growing steadily.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, and colored pencils

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. has operated a clothes-selling business for four years, and she works seven days a week. Fatuma sells her products from door to door. She also generates additional income by selling maize flour.

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothes to offer for sale. The main business challenges for Fatuma include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself.    

Fatuma and her husband own a home in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. They have five children, all of whom attend school. They also take care of some of their grandchildren. The family has access to electricity and to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace mas de 14 años que tiene este negocio. El negocio lo inicio por sus padres que son personas que anteriormente se dedicaban a este negocio, con el paso del tiempo lograron ofrecerle este medio de vida a Isabel para que le proporcionar a su familia ingresos para el hogar. Isabel quiere el financiamiento para la compra de melones, mangos, sandias, jocotes, naranjas, papaya, tomates y otras frutas.
texts.en: Isabel is 55 years old, married, and she has 4 children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past 14 years. She started this business because her parents used to have a similar business. With the passage of time they managed to provide Isabel with this means to earn a living and to support her family and earn an income for her household. Isabel requires this loan to purchase melons, mangoes, watermelons, berries, oranges, papayas, tomatoes, and other fruits.

loans.use: to purchase melons, mangoes, watermelons, oranges, papayas, and tomatoes

loans.name: Flor Elisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Flor tiene 24 años, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, ya tiene buen tiempo en este negocio y afirma que le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus clientes fijos, amigos del barrio, vecinos y moradores de otras calles aledañas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes en general cómo arroz y azúcar en sacos, leche en tarros, aceite en galones, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes aromas y parte del dinero lo invertirá en los productos de belleza que vende, esta actividad sirve de apoyo para solventar otros gastos menores.

Flor es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando porque le gusta lo que hace, su meta es continuar con el negocio, implementarlo más y que se haga más conocido aún. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir a su crecimiento y el de otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Flor is 24 years old and she lives in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martin.  She is a member of the Communal Bank named "Courageous Women II". She has one school-aged son. 

She sells general groceries and she has a good amount of time in the business. She affirms that it has been successful. The business is installed in her house where her steady clients, friends, neighbors, and passers-by shop from her every day. 

With this loan of S/2500 she will purchase grocery store merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, bottles of milk, cooking oil by the gallon, boxes of preserves, bathroom tissue, detergents, and soaps. Part of the loan will be invested in beauty products that she wells. This business helps her cover her minor expenses.

Flor is a hardworking woman who is charismatic and eager to keep working because she loves what she does. Her goal is to continue with her business and to have it well stocked so that it will become even more well-known. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for contributing to her development and to other women who are in need.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store

loans.name: Liberato

texts.es:
El señor Liberato C. tiene 38 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo. Se dedica a la gomería desde el año 1998, negocio que montó con un pequeño capital ahorrado.
El crédito solicitado quiere invertir en las compras de cubiertas usadas, pues le da un plus de ingreso, ya que muchos de sus clientes no tienen la capacidad de comprar una nueva cubierta y solicitan usadas.
Él sueña con un país mejor y manifiesta que la única forma de que se haga realidad es aportando trabajo en la sociedad, mejorar su negocio es la meta para poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Don C. es muy activo, emprendedor, responsable y honesto, es la tercera operación que viene cumpliendo a cabalidad.
Sus esfuerzos son para apoyar a su hijo ya sea en educación, salud y otros emprendimientos que quiera realizar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Liberato C. is 38 years old, married, and he has one son. He has had his tire shop since the year 1998. He started his business with a small capital funds that he had saved.

The loan he requests will be invested in the purchase of used tires because it is an added source of income. Many of his clients do not have the resources to purchase new tires and they request used ones. 

He dreams of seeing his country improve and he says that the only way that this will be possible is to create work opportunities in their society. Improving his business is his goal and he will be able to provide employment to others. 

Mr. C. is very active, enterprising, responsible and honest and it is the third loan he has because he has cancelled them on time. 

His efforts are all to support his son by means of an education, health and other business ventures he would want to do in the future.

loans.use: to purchase car tires

loans.name: Los Forjadores Group

texts.es:
Señora Lourdes Melecia S. Y., socia D. L. alcancia comunal "Los Forjadores" D. L. localidad D. Concepcion en Huancayo.
Lourdes S.; divorciada, tiene hijos mayores D. edad que ya tienen familia, elL. vive con uno D. ellos ya que no cuenta con vivienda propia.
L. señora Lourdes se dedica desD. su juventud a L. agricultura y a L. ganaderìa; elL. todos los dìas atienD. al ganado, llevàndolos al campo, donD. D. paso supervisa los cultivos D. sus chacras. Tambièn orD.ña su vaca para vender L. leche.
El crèdito que solicita serà para L. compra D. animales menores.
(En L. fotografìa, L. señora Lourdes esta vestida D. chompa color rojo, y es L. primera D. L. derecha)
texts.en:
Lourdes Melecia S. Y. is a member of the communal bank named "Los Forjadores” located in the community of Concepcion in Huancayo. 

Lourdes S. is divorced and she has grown children who have families of their own. She lives with one of them because she doesn't have a house of her own. 

Lourdes has been an agriculturist and farmer since her youth. She attends to her livestock every day, taking them to the fields. While she is there she also checks on her plantations on her land. She also milks cows in order to sell the milk. 

The loan will be used to purchase small livestock. 

(In the photograph, Lourdes is dressed in a red jacket and she is the first person on the right)

loans.use: to acquire livestock

loans.name: Trini

texts.en:
Trini is one of our women entrepreneurs. She is requesting an individual loan, her 3rd loan, a year and a half after she decided to start a business and came to Esperanza to take a small loan to invest in clothing sales in her community around Hato Mayor. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and invested them in her business. 

Trini is a young, single, businesswoman. She sells clothes and will use this loan to purchase more clothing varieties. Her dream is to finish her university studies and to have an improved business. She will use her business profits to save. She enjoys sharing time with her friends. She says "Thank you for supporting me."

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Mapit Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAPIT SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el ciclo número catorce en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora  Bertha, la  presidenta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Venta de coca, aceitera, tienda de barrio, comercio de fruta, venta de comida, novedades, guantes y ganchos.

La señora Bertha, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C. “MAPIT SARTASIÑANI” este ciclo y en la actualidad vende novedades (productos de la temporada) en las calles, ya que ella es ambulante (comerciante sin ubicación de puesto de comercio).  El crédito le servirá para comprar mercadería que los podrá vender en diferentes ferias.  

La señora Bertha es soltera y tiene tres hijos, como su negocio requiere de llevar la mercadería a las diferentes ferias día tras día recibe la ayuda de sus hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la amistad de las compañeras y todas las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Mapit Sartasinani" will be on its fourteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner), as a part of the central group German Busch. The group is made up of nine members. This communal organization is directed by a board of directors whose leader is Bertha, the group president. The members' businesses are varied and among them they are: coca leave sales, oil sales, convenience store, fruit sales, food stall, souvenir shop, gloves sales, and hooks sales.

Bertha is the president of the communal bank and she is part of the "Mapit Sartasinani" in this loan cycle. She sells souvenirs (products that are in accordance with the season) by traveling the streets, as she sells itinerantly (a merchant without a fixed sales location). The loan will be used to purchase merchandise that will be sold at the different fairs.

Bertha is single and she has three children. As her business requires her to transport the merchandise to the various fairs day after day she receives help from her kids. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the friendship with her colleagues and the orientation sessions.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina es socia del banco comunal Perlas de Pucallpa, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene una niña.
Su negocio es la compra y venta de madera por lote, lleve en este negocio 6 años lo cual le ha servido para salir adelante y poder criar a su hija.
Con este nuevo préstamo de s/. 3,000.00 comprará un nuevo lote de 2000 mil pies de madera  para luego revenderlo, el negocio es al instante, compra y vende.
Ser madre le ayudó a madurar y ver la vida de otra manera, sabe que tiene que trabajar  mucho para poder criar y educar a su hija, por un lado tiene la ayuda de su mamá que la cuida a su hija mientras se va a trabajar, es un trabajo pesado porque no tiene horario. 
Manuela Ramos es parte de su vida, el apoyo económico le abrió las puertas a un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the communal bank named "Perlas de Pucallpa" of the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and she is a single mother. She has one daughter. 

Her business is the buying and selling of wood by the lot. She has 6 years in the business and it has helped her to get ahead and to support her daughter.

With this new loan of S/3000 she will purchase a new lot of 2000 feet of wood to resell. The business concludes instantly, the buying and reselling.

Being a mother has helped her mature and to look at life from another point of view. She knows that she needs to work hard to raise her daughter and to send her to school.  On one side she has her mother's support because she takes care of her daughter while she is at work. It is difficult work because there is no set schedule.

Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is part of her life and the financial support opened many doors for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase 2000 feet of timber

loans.name: Santos Balbina

texts.es:
doña Santos Balbina A. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el caseriio El Obraje y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tiene muchos clientes ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico en donde pasan muchas personas.
Santos es madre de un niño de 3 años.
Santos esta casada y junto con su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante, su esposo trabaja en el rubro de la agricultura.
Santos tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Balbina A. is 32 years old and she lives in the community of El Obraje. She sells every day goods from a store installed in her house. She has many clients because her business is located in a strategic location where there are many passers-by. 

Santos is the mother of a 3-year old boy. 

She is married and together with her husband they work hard to get ahead. Her husband works in the field of agriculture.

Santos also raises poultry and pigs.

Her goal is to make her business grow and to provide her son with a better quality of life. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise in wholesale to supply her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply her general store

loans.name: Carmen Isaura

texts.es:
Carmen Isaura L. M. tiene 37 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Carmen  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ingresos estables.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Carmen Isaura L. M. is 37 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 4 children.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

Carmen is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in the 'Feria de los Jueves' market in Guaranda.

Carmen is requesting this loan to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to have a stable income.

Carmen enjoys celebrating carnival festivities.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Maria Zoila

texts.es:
Maria Zoila R. S. tiene 32 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

María  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Maria Zoila R. S. is 32 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 4 children.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

María is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in Guaranda's 'Feria de los Jueves' market.

María is requesting this loan to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home.

María enjoys celebrating carnival festivities.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Salis Candelaria

texts.es: Salís C. M. es una mujer casada que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 15 y 17 años, ella es la propietaria de una sala de belleza donde realiza corte de cabellos, desrizados, manicure pedicure y vende también productos de belleza  especialmente de limpieza facial. Salis  inició este negocio hace 12 años, durante los cuales ha ido capacitándose para lograr cambios significativos en la imagen y belleza de sus clientes.  Ella inició y aun  estaba estudiando licenciatura en sociales y económicas en la Universidad, pero  se le dio por estudiar peluquería por dos años y   aprendió muy bien las técnicas de este oficio logrando un gran entusiasmo  para crear su negocio, fue así como compró sus primeras herramientas básicas y con ello y su perseverancia ha ido ampliando su espectro, lo que la llevó a  estudiar cosmetología, estética facial y corporal, logrando poner en practica todo lo aprendido. Este es el  financiamiento # 11 de Salis, con su credikiva adecuará su local y ampliará el espacio para perfeccionar la pequeña venta de helados y convertirla en una heladería. Su sueño es tener una clínica de estética y belleza y asesorar a sus clientes ofreciendole productos que realmente necesitan, para resaltar su imagen personal y profesional.
texts.en:
Salís C. M. is a married woman who has two children aged 15 and 17.  She owns a beauty salon where she offers haircuts, hair straightenings, manicures and pedicures.  She also sells beauty products, especially facial cleansers.

Salis started out in her business 12 years ago.  Over the years she has learned how to make significant changes in the image and beauty of her customers.  She started out when she was still studying for a degree in social and economic sciences at university but she gave this up and studied hairdressing for two years.  She did a good job of learning the techniques of the trade and was really enthusiastic about setting up her own business.  She bought her first basic tools and, with a lot of perseverance, she managed to expand her range of offerings.  She studied cosmetology, and facial and body aesthetics, and put into practice everything that she learned. 

This is Salis' 11th loan.  She will use her Kiva loan to adapt her premises and expand her space so that she can adapt the small space from which she sells iced treats and turn it into an ice-cream parlor.  Her dream is to own an aesthetics and beauty clinic, and to advise her customers, offering them products that they really need, to highlight their personal and professional image.

loans.use: to make some structural changes to her business

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Angel Segundo A. M. tiene 47 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Angel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa y terreno.

Le gusta bailar en carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel Segundo A. M. is 47 years old.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and his single children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolivar province.  He has 5 children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Grupo Enmanuel" are located in Recinto San Juan, which is part of the canton of Guaranda.  This communal bank has 17 members who work as farmers cultivating short cycle varieties of corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities; they also raise animals such as pigs and chickens.

Angel is a farmer who cultivates corn and raises pigs and hens.  He buys his animal feed products in the Silva store every weekend, and he sells his products in the Thursday markets that are held in the city of Guaranda.

He requests this loan to cultivate more wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals, feed, and farming supplies.  The support of this loan will help him financially to get the supplies he needs.  He must deal with challenges such as the pests, diseases and weather changes that affect his crops.  His dream is to have his own house and land.

He enjoys dancing at the carnival.

loans.use: to plant more corn, wheat and potatoes and to purchase animals.

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Dolores Del Carmen, cuenta con 55 años, posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Que está ubicado en el barrio de Guadalupe en Chinandega, en el vende golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, jugos, sodas. Vive en compañía de su esposo y un hijo, su esposo se dedica a brindar el servicio de sastre, por lo que sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos de prendas de vestir Dolores recibe el apoyo de su familia para con su negocio. Dolores está Solicitando un crédito para surtir de productos demandados y ofrecer una mayor variedad de golosinas y bebidas.
texts.en: Dolores Del Carmen is 55 year old, and she has a general store in her home.  This store is located in the Guadalupe neighborhood in Chinandega, and there she sells candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juice and soda.  She lives with her husband and her son.  Her husband provides tailoring services; his customers request different types of garments from him.  Dolores receives support from her family for her business.  Dolores is requesting a loan to stock her store with products that are in demand, so that she can offer a greater variety of candies and drinks for sale.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juice and soda for her store.

loans.name: Maribel Alejandra

texts.es:
Maribel de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que elabora y vende sandalias a un precio muy económico. Comenzó hace 13 años atrás con ayuda de su ex esposo elaborando sandalias. 

Poco a poco ha mejorado sus ingresos ya que la han conocido como vendedora de sandalias. En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de dos personas que confeccionan las sandalias desde las 08h30am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar plantillas, suelas, pegamentos. En el futuro quiere incrementar mas la producción de las sandalias para mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Maribel, 31, is a hardworking woman who makes and sells sandals at a very affordable price.  She started this business making sandals 13 years ago with the help of her ex-husband.

Gradually, her income has improved, since she has become known as a sandal seller.  Now she works with the help of 2 employees who make sandals from 8:30am until 7pm every day.  She has a lot of ambition for her business, and so she wants a loan to buy insoles, soles and adhesives.  In the future, she wants to increase her production of sandals so that she can have higher sales.

loans.use: to buy insoles, soles and adhesives

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité, tuvo la iniciativa la Señora Francisca A. domiciliada en Calixto de la Ciudad de Carapegua.
El comité se llama “Kuña Rory” y actualmente se encuentra en la décima etapa con 16 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras.
Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primer negocio.
Las mujeres agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella lograron desarrollar bastante su capacidad de trabajo.
La Sra. Dionicia,  quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de leche, se levanta muy temprano a ordeñar  su vaca para salir a vender. La venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Carapegua, donde tiene un puesto de venta de verduras también.
La Sra. Dionicia agradece de manera especial a la Fundación porque mediante el apoyo brindado ella pudo adquirir más capital y espera poder seguir contando con ese apoyo financiero para agrandar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con mas mercaderías, así también espera contar con una congeladora.
texts.en:
Mrs Francisca A. set up this committee.  Francisca lives in Calitxo, in the city of Carapegua.  The committee is called “Kuña Rory” and it is currently entering its tenth loan cycle with 16 members.  This is a group of very responsible and hard-working women.

Some of these ladies already had work before they became members of the committee of enterprising women and joined in order to improve their businesses.  Others, however, are starting out in their first business.

These women are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this initiative since it has helped them to develop their capacity for work.

Dionicia has been selling milk for several years.  She gets up very early to milk her cow and then goes out to sell the milk.  She makes her sales in the city of Carapegua where she also has a vegetable stall.

Dionicia is especially grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because, through the support they have given her, she has been able to acquire more capital.  She hopes to be able to continue relying on their financial support to expand her business because she now has more merchandise.  She also hopes to be able to acquire a freezer.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and expand her business

loans.name: Dixia Dinora

texts.es:
la joven Dixia tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la caserio el Obraje y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. tiene muchos clientes fijos que le compran todos los dias, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar con la produccion del dia.
su producto lo reparte en varias casas y pulperias cercanas a su casa de habitacion.

Dixia es casada pero no tiene hijos y en sus tiempos libres cria gallinas.
su meta es hacer su negocio mas grande para que le genere mas ganancias.
su deseo es tener hijos y una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Young Dixia is 22 years old and lives in the hamlet of Obraje, where she is engaged in the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her home, and she has many regular customers who buy from her daily.  She gets up at 4 am every day to begin the day's production.  Her products are distributed to several houses and small stores near her home.

Dixie is married but has no children, and in her spare time she breeds chickens.  Her goal is to make her business bigger so that it will generate increased profits.  Her wish is to have children and a beautiful family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, lime and water

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Samuel Antonio es un señor trabajador que cuenta con un negocio de que es ofrecer el servicio de nintendo, en donde él tiene una gran variedad de juegos que sus pequeños clientes le solicitan. Desde hace 17 años que se mantiene en este medio de vida. Este negocio lo atiende el a pesar de tener ciertos problemas, porque alguna veces no tiene energía eléctrica no se desanima para seguir adelante. El motivo por el cual realiza este financiamiento es para la compra de controles, discos y reparar un televisor que está en mal estado. Samuel quiere comprar mercancía para ofrecer un buen servicio y así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor Samuel Antonio is a hardworking man who runs a business renting Nintendo games. He has a wide variety of games that his young customers ask for. He’s had his business for 17 years, and in spite of having problems such as an occasional lack of electricity, he is keen to carry on.

Samuel is seeking a loan to buy controls, DVDs, and to repair a TV screen which isn’t working properly. With this new merchandise he will be able to offer better service and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy controls, DVDs, and to repair a TV screen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, accessories, perfume

loans.name: Olatoutou

texts.fr: Madame Olatoutou est mariée avec à charge 4 enfants. Elle a 31 ans et habite quartier Akodessewa.  Elle vend les produits d’alimentation générale et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend les produits au marché local d’Akodessewa et compte 11 ans dans cette activité. Elle espère augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et sollicite un prêt pour acheter 2 paquets de savons, 5 cartons de spaghetti, 3 sacs de riz  et 2 bidons d’huile.
texts.en: Mrs Olatoutou is a 31 year-old married mother of four who lives in the Akodessewa quarter.   She sells general food products, sourcing her wares from Lomé's main market. She then sells her products at the local market in Akodessewa, and has worked in this field for eleven years. She aims to boost her profit margins and will use her loan to buy 2 packs of soap, 5 boxes of spaghetti, 3 bags of rice and 2 cans of oil.

loans.use: to purchase food items

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose Francisco A. T. tiene 46 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco A. T. is 46 years old. He is married, he has 5 children, and he lives with his wife and their single children in Guaranda, a canton of the Bolívar province.

He is a member of the V.R.C. Grupo Enmanuel, a village bank located in San Juan, a precinct of the Guaranda canton. This bank has 17 members who work as farmers engaging in cultivating short cycle varieties of maize, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as in breeding of animals such as pigs and hens.

Jose engages in agriculture, growing maize and breeding pigs and hens. He buys the products to feed his animals in the Comercial Silva every week-end, and he sells his animals every Thursday in the Guarada fair.

The loan he is requesting will be used to sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies. The loan will economically help him fulfilling his needs, facing challenges such as pests, plant illnesses and climate changes. He dreams of owing a house.

He likes practicing sports.

loans.use: To sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier tiene 32 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi. Hace más de 5 años, que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con esfuerzos propios, por lo que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, el se encarga de proporcionarle lo más necesario a toda su familia. Pues sus inicios fueron muy duros ya algunas veces como no tenía el capital suficiente su automóvil no presentaba las condiciones necesarias. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, batería entre otros artículos. El sueña con tener otro vehículo que presente mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Francisco Javier is 32 years old, and his activity is to offer taxi services. He has been engaging in this activity for more than 5 years; he started it by his own means as he has 1 child whom he is responsible for, and he takes care of providing his family with what they need the most. At the beginning it was very hard for him, as sometimes, not having enough money, he could not keep his car in the ideal conditions to work. This is why he is requesting a loan: he will use it to increase his working capital and to buy tires and a battery among other items. He dreams of owing another vehicle in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy tires, a battery and other items for his car.

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Afiwavi  a 27 ans  et mère d’un enfant. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de son enfant, elle fait la vente de maïs.  Elle a commencé cette activité en 2006 et s’approvisionne à Notsé.  Elle revend au marché d’Akodessewa. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs.
texts.en: Miss Afiwavi  is 27 years and has one child. She began selling corn for a living in 2006 in order to support her child. She sources her wares from Notsé and sells them at the market at Akodessewa. Miss Afiwavi is seeking a loan to purchase 10 bags of corn.

loans.use: to purchase corn

loans.name: Elupina

texts.en:
Elupina is one of our woman entrepreneurs and she is requesting an individual loan. This is her 11th loan, after being with us for seven years. She started her business with her Esperanza first loan, being part of a group that was created in her community and after many years and great investment, she was able to take her business to a next level, taking out the biggest loan amount. She operates a miscellaneous business, which is a small store where she sell clothes, shoes, accessories, and cosmetic products. She is located in a community near Hato Mayor.

Elupina will use this loan to buy men's and women's clothing, shoes, accessories and  cosmetic products. She will use her business profits to remodel her small local business venue next to her house and to save for make change in her house structure. She plans to rebuild some areas. She is the mother of five children and her dream is to see them to become professionals with stable lives.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing, shoes, accessories and  cosmetic products.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny, de 36 años es una valerosa madre soltera, que espera la llegada de su pequeña hija a la que todavía no le puso un nombre, pero dentro de estos días nacerá y ya está preparando su cuarto en su casa alquilada; ubicada en la comunidad de Pampa Silva (selva central peruana). Su esfuerzo y constancias le permitieron obtener en todo estos 20 años, que se dedica a la agricultura, sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Donde acondicionó una pequeña casa, para poder así cuidar y velar del desarrollo de sus plantaciones de cítricos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de cosecha pues brinda trabajo a las personas de su localidad, quienes le ayudan en la extracción de los frutos maduros; que vende 2 veces a la semana en el mercado de la ciudad de Santa Ana. Ahora sus proyectos son invertir en la compra de más injertos de naranja y tangelo, para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues ahora tiene que pensar en los gastos del cuidado, alimentación y vestimenta de su hija. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los soñadores”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente tranquila, pues la apoyan siempre en el logro de sus objetivos. Jenny, comenzará su cosecha de “tangelo” (fruta cítrica), en el mes de abril, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos en su cultivos y de está manera estén listos para la cosecha.
texts.en: Jenny is 36 years old. She is a brave single mother awaiting the arrival of her little gitl, whom she hasn't named yet. She will be born any day now and she is getting the room ready in her rented house in the community of Pampa Silva (central Peruvian jungle). Her hard work and reliability have allowed her to do all that she has done these past 20 years. She works in agriculture, on her own land where she fixed up a small house to be able to take care of and watch over her citrus plants. What she likes the most about her job are the harvest times because she offers work to the people in her community, who help her pick the ripe fruit. She sells it twice a week in the city market in Santa Ana. Now her projects are investing in buying more orange and tangelo grafts to be able to plant larger quantities, now that she has to think about the expenses of caring for, feeding and dressing her daughter. She belongs to the “Los Soñadores” [The Dreamers] community bank. This is her fourth loan with MFP, where she feels good, because they always support her attain her goals. Jenny will start harvesting the tangelo (a citrus fruit) in April. Because of this, she is planning on buying several bags of fertilizer to spread on her crops and in this way get them ready for harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Angel Domingo

texts.es:
Angel Domingo R. A. tiene 46 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Angel Domingo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terreno para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Angel Domingo R. A. is 64 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their three single children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  He has five children.  

The members of the Grupo Enmanuel Community Bank can be found in the San Juan precinct, which is in the Guaranda canton.  This bank has 17 members, farmers who grow large quantities of short cycle corn, wheat, and potatoes.  They also raise animals and sell them on Thursdays at the fair in the city of Guaranda.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes.  He will also buy animals and supplies to feed the animals and for his crops.  The support of the loan would financially help supply him with the necessities.

The challenges he faces are pest infestation, diseases, and climate change.

His dream is to have a field to sow.

He likes playing sports and going out with his family.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla tiene la edad de 34 años de edad, madre de un hijo, vive junto a sus padres en un barrio de la capital de Managua.
Hoy en día labora como cocinera en un hospital, en donde lleva cuatro años laborando. Como objetivo es la construcción de un cuarto para lograr privacidad con su hija, en donde comprara materiales de construcción como: , arena, cemento, hierro, ya que tiene una parte comprado con ahorros de su salario, lo que desea avanzar más rápido, en la construcción para poder gozar de un techo digno, en donde Afodenic, está siendo posible esta mejora por medio del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Karla is 34 years old and she is the mother of one child. She lives with her parents in a neighborhood in the city of Managua. 

She currently works as a cook in a hospital and she has been there for four years. Her goal is to build a room to give her daughter some privacy, for which she will purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and steel. She has a part of the purchases already made with the savings from her wages but she wants to speed up the construction progress and to enjoy a dignified roof over their head. Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has made this renovation possible thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a room for her daughter

loans.name: Julio Moises

texts.es:
Julio Moises M. M. tiene 22 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Julio  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terreno para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Julio Moises M. M. is 22 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their single children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  He has five children.  

The members of the Grupo Enmanuel Community Bank can be found in the San Juan precinct, which is in the Guaranda canton.  This bank has 17 members, farmers who grow large quantities of short cycle corn, wheat, and potatoes.  They also raise animals like pigs and chickens.

He buys his products at Comercial Silva every week end.  He buys food for the animals, and he sells them on Thursdays at the fair in the city of Guaranda.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes.  He will also buy animals and supplies to feed the animals and for his crops.  The support of the loan would financially help supply him with the necessities.

The challenges he faces are pest infestation, diseases, and climate change.

His dream is to have a field to sow.

He likes playing sports and going out with his family.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Katiuska Giomar

texts.es:
Katiuska de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de bocaditos y venta de tortas. Con ayuda de sus hijos ha incrementado sus ventas ya que venden los bocaditos en una estación de buses. 

La mayoría de sus clientes son cristianos evangélicos  ya que les vende bocaditos y tortas para sus eventos. Trabaja desde la mañana hasta que termine la elaboración de todos sus productos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar harina, huevos, materia prima para tener un volumen de ventas mayor.
texts.en:
Katiuska is 32 years old. She is a hard-working woman who runs a snacks and cake sale activity. With the help of her children she has increased her sales, as she sells the snacks in a bus station.

The majority of her customers are Evangelical Christians, because she sells them snacks and cakes for their celebrations. She starts working in the morning and she goes on until she has finished preparing her products. She has many ambitions for her activity, and fort this reason she will use this loan to buy flour, eggs and other basic ingredients in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs and other basic ingredients for her activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a supplies for both businesses.  She will buy more wood and glue to upholster ordered furniture, fabric, runners, and accessories for making her products.

loans.name: María Marleny

texts.es:
María Marleny G. F. es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que a pesar de  haberse desempeñado como operaria en algunas fábricas de Medellín, un día motivada por sacar adelante algo propio decidió poner un punto de venta para aportar con el cubrimiento de los gastos familiares. 

María Marleny quien trabaja desde las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche necesita de un préstamo para remodelar su punto de venta y comprar más surtido con el fin de incrementar sus ventas. 

En el futuro y como ella misma lo expresa, espera que Dios la escuche para poder comprar su casa.
texts.en:
María Marleny G. F. is an enterprising and tenacious woman who used to work as an employee in some factories in Medellin.  One day, motivated by a desire to get ahead, she decided to set up her own sales post so that she could help to cover the household expenses.  

Maria Marleny works from 4 in the morning until 7 in the evening.  She needs a loan so that she can remodel her sales post, and so she can buy more products so that she can increase her sales.

In the future, as she states, she hopes that God listens to her so that she can buy her own house.

loans.use: to remodel her sales post and to buy products

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es: La Sra. Ludith S. D.
texts.en: Ludith S. D.

loans.use: to buy fabric of different sizes and colors, different colored thread, and parts for her sewing machine

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Monsefú, una zona comercial y turística conocida como capital de las Flores que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 3 años, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su esposo  en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Carmen desea adquirir más productos y así ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido. Para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 29, is married and lives with her husband and their two children in the Monsefú district, a commercial and tourist area known as the capital of Las Flores in Lambayeque Province, forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 3 years, she has been engaged in the catalog sales of cosmetics. She sells these products to her neighbors and friends. Every day, she strives to gain more customers since the more orders the business obtains the greater her income. The business helps her to meet her personal expenses and support her husband in sustaining the family economy.

Carmen wishes to acquire more cosmetic products and, thus, enlarge her business by installing a cosmetics shop in her home. This will allow her customers to have products at hand, and they will not have to wait until the end of the month for their orders to arrive. This is why she needs to acquire more products, and, in order to achieve her objective, she decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles.

loans.use: to acquire more products so that she can enlarge her business by selling them out of her home.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 25 años, tiene una hermosa relación de 7 años con su esposo Samuel, con el que tiene  un hijo, Tomy. Al que cuidan y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Perene (selva central peruana). En la comunidad de Manankiari, se encuentra su hectárea de terreno agrícola, donde siembra plátano, guanábana, tangelo y naranja. Pero consiente de su limitación; siembra también en sociedad con otras personas que tienen mayores terrenos agrícolas. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo obtuvo buenas ganancias, pues comercializa en el mercado de frutas de la capital del país, donde viaja constantemente. “El secreto es saber negociar las cargas de frutas”, afirma. Su principal dificultad, es la falta de terrenos amplios para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades, limitándose a asociarse con terceros. Por ello está juntando dinero para invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de tangüelo (fruta cítrica), en el mes de abril. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los soñadores”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada pues agradece al apoyo que obtuvo de su asociación en todo este tiempo. Judith, constantemente contrata peones para que le ayuden en la limpieza de sus cultivos. Por ello con el crédito pagará el salario semanal de las personas que le ayudan.
texts.en:
Judith, age 25, has been in a beautiful seven-year relationship with her husband Samuel. They have a son named Tomy who they care for and provide an education. Judith has her own home in the town of Perene, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. In the community of Manankiari, she has a hectare of farmland on which she grows bananas, guavas, tangelos, and oranges. However, she is aware of her limitations. She also works for other people who have larger plots of land. Judith has seven years of experience. Throughout this time, she has generated good earnings by traveling constantly to the fruit market in the national capital to sell her goods. “The secret is to know how to negotiate for loads of fruit,” Judith says. Her main difficulty is not having enough land to grow in large quantities, which is why she relies on other people. For this reason, she is accumulating money to invest in the purchase of more farmland. Now she is preparing for the tangelo harvest that takes place in April.

Judith is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Soñadores” (The Dreamers) and receiving her fourth loan from MFP. She is grateful for all the support she has received from her Communal Bank. Judith is always hiring workers to help with clearing her fields. For this reason, she will use this loan to pay the weekly salary of the workers who help her.

loans.use: To pay workers to clear her fields and remove weeds.

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Tavapygua Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de nombre "Kuña Kyre'y Tavapygua" se conformó el 20 de julio del 2007 con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, ya están en el décimo-primer ciclo.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también realizan actividades para fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar economicamente a sus familiares.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Petrona S., quien se dedica al comercio minorista, nos comenta que mediante el crédito y la asesoría recibida en ciclos anteriores pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y administración.
Ella posee un salón en su domicilio donde cuenta con gran variedad de mercaderías con precios muy accesibles, y que mediante esto la economía de su familia mejoró bastante, ya que actualmente poseen su ingreso y el ingreso de su marido, quien trabaja como albañil.
Según la Sra. Petrona las actividades que realizan con la Fundacion Paraguaya son muy importantes, ya que pueden desarrollar sus capacidades de trabajo, además de levantar la autoestima como madres trabajoras.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee named “Kuña Kyre'y Tavapygua" was established on July 20, 2007, through hard work and dedication. The members are already in their eleventh loan cycle. In addition to working in each of their independent businesses, the members also conduct fundraising activities so that the group can have capital, which helps them reach their goal of working to support their families financially.

One very moving story is that of Sra. Petrona S., who works as a small retailer. She says that the loans and advice she received in previous cycles have helped her with managing her business. Petrona has a room in her home where she has a wide variety of merchandise at affordable prices. Through this business, she has been able to improve her family’s finances. At the moment both she and her husband, who works as a mason, earn an income.

According to Sra. Petrona, the activities conducted by Fundación Paraguaya are very important since they have enabled the members to develop their work skills and raise their self-esteem as working mothers.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products.

loans.name: Nimina

texts.es:
La Sra. Nimia R. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Perlitas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 53 años y es madre de 01 hija, que aún dependen de ella.

Nimia lleva  buen tiempo dedicándose a la confección de todo tipo de vestidos, pantalones, blusas, para damas, caballeros y niños; poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura  que se encuentra ubicada en su casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes.

En la actualidad continúa con su negocio y cuenta con una fiel clientela que a diario acuden a su casa, para solicitar sus servicios, es ella quien personalmente los atiende con la amabilidad que la caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará telas por metros, blondas , de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones y grecas.

Nimia hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con muchas ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla con el negocio y por la ayuda que le brinda a mujeres como ella que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia R. Diaz is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Perlitas II” (The Little Pearls II) which in the District of Tarapoto in San Martín Province. She is 53 years old, single, and the mother of one daughter who is still dependent on her.

Nimia enjoys making all types of suits, trousers, and blouses for women, men, and children. Over time she generated her own income and accumulated savings. Nimia wants to keep operating her small sewing workshop, which is located in her home, and provide a well-kept environment to help her attend to her customers. She says that she is doing very well and works according to the orders she receives from her customers.

At the moment, she continues with her business and has loyal customers who come by her house on a daily basis to request her services. She attends to her customers with the friendliness for which she is known.

With this loan of 1000 PEN, Nimia will buy fabrics by the meter, different styles of lace, implements such as scissors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, buttons, and patterns.

Nimia feels that today she is an accomplished woman who has the desire to reach for her goals and make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her with her business and assisting women like her grow as entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics by the meter, different styles of lace, implements such as scissors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, buttons, and patterns.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. She lives in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband, where they raised three children.

Calixta is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her vegetables and fruit stall by purchasing potatoes, plantains, salad ingredients, and a lot of tropical fruit. She has had her business for around six years, after she received her first loan of $700 US. She enjoys working and taking care of her house. Her future plan is to become a successful businesswoman with an improved business. She will use the profit to save for her future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit and other goods.

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La Sra. Adith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara II”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 52 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.

Su gran habilidad para los negocios, su anhelo D. cumplir sus sueños y con la ayuda D. su esposo, empredió el negocio del comercio minorista, ofreciendo a su distinguida clientela desD. prendas D. vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, hasta libros y guías D. estudio. Nos cuenta que tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar.  En compañía D. su esposo, se trasladan por diferentes calles y avenidas a repartir y ofrecer sus productos, esta contenta y orgullosa por su trabajo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará mercadería como: Libros, cuadernos, ropa D. 1ra y 2da mano, entre otros.

Adith manifestó que se siente con muchas fuerzas y aliento D. seguir adelante, le gusta mucho trabajar  y está  muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven, tanto como mujeres y pequeñas empresarias.

En la foto la vemos junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Adith is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Bárbara II” in the District of Tarapoto in San Martín Province. She is 52 years old, married, and has two dependent children who are in school.

With her good business skills and the help of her husband, Adith started a small retail establishment so that she could fulfill her dreams. She offers her distinguished clientele everything from clothes for women, men, and children to books and study guides.
