Adith says that she has established customers who come by her house on a daily basis to shop. Along with her husband, she travels along different streets and avenues to deliver and sell her products. Adith is very happy and proud of her work.

With this loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy merchandise such as books, notebooks, new and used clothing, and other products. Adith says she has a great amount of strength and encouragement to move forward. She enjoys her work and expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop as both women and small entrepreneurs in the communities where they live. Both Adith and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase books, notebooks, new and used clothing, and other products.

loans.name: Foel

texts.es: Foel, de 32 años, es un trabajador padre soltero, que vive en compañía de sus hijos: Jonatan y Erick a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). A las afueras de la localidad se encuentran los sembríos de Foel, que consisten en café, plátanos y palta. Ya tiene 14 años de experiencia en está actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es negociar sus granos a los comerciantes de la ciudad de Villarica; púes ve gustosa el resultado de su esfuerzo. Pero consiente que la cosecha de café es una vez al año. También se dedica a trabajar como peón en una hacienda de café, donde le pagan semanalmente por fertilizar y limpiar los cultivos. Su principal dificultad es obtener el capital necesario para el mantenimiento anual de sus sembríos. Ahora se está preparando para la recolección de los primeros granos maduros de café. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad de progreso que le brindan. Foel, dará el primer paso para la apertura de un nuevo negocio que lo considera más rentable, por ello comprará varios ejemplares de cerdos, asimismo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Foel, age 32, is a hardworking single father who lives with his children, Jonathan and Erick, who he cares for and provides an education. He lives in his own home in the town of Unión Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle. Outside of the town, he has land on which he grows coffee, bananas, and avocados. Foel has fourteen years of farming experience. What he enjoys most about his job is negotiating the price of seeds with the merchants in the city of Villarica, and he is rewarded for his efforts. Foel is aware that he can only harvest coffee once a year, so he also works as a laborer on a coffee plantation. He is paid weekly to fertilize and remove weeds. His main difficulty is to obtain the necessary capital to pay for the annual maintenance of his crops. Now he is preparing to gather the first crop of ripe coffee beans.

Foel is a member of the Communal Bank “Desarrollando Para El Progreso de Prisma” (Developing for the Progress of Prisma). This is his first loan with MFP and he is grateful for being given the opportunity to make progress. Foel will be taking the first steps toward starting a new business that he considers to be more profitable. He will buy several pigs and invest in the purchase of school supplies for his children.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and acquire school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Luz es socia del banco comunal Perlas de Pucallpa, del Distrito Calleria y departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años de edad y 3 hijos mayores.
Son 7 años que lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (comida al paso) por las noches en la vereda de su casa y cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hijas.
Con su nuevo prestamos de S/. 3,000.00 se comprará una 2 juegos de mesa, 2 manteles, escurridor de papas, un balón de gas, un balde refresquero, 1 docena de vasos, 1 paquete de servilleta, 2 cientos de platitos descartables, 2 cientos de tenedores descartables y 2 galones de aceite.
Con ello podrá mejorar la atención de su cliente, va tener mejores ingresos y así podrá reunir el dinero para pagar las cuotas de su préstamo.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le ha brindado todos estos años para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Perlas de Pucallpa” (Pearls of Pucallpa) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 63 years old and has three grown children.

Luz has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for the past seven years. She sells sausages and fried potatoes (considered to be a fast food dish) at night on the sidewalk in front of her house. Luz has the help from one of her daughters.

With this new loan of 3000 PEN she will buy two dining tables, two tablecloths, a strainer for rinsing potatoes, a tank of gas, an ice chest, one dozen glasses, one packet of napkins, two hundred disposable plates, two hundred disposable forks, and two gallons of oil. By acquiring these supplies she will be able to improve the service to her customers, generate more income, and set aside money to repay her loan.

Luz is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support that has been provided over the years so that she could continue working.

loans.use: To purchase two dining tables, two tablecloths, a strainer for rinsing potatoes, a tank of gas, an ice chest, one dozen glasses, one packet of napkins, two hundred disposable plates, two hundred disposable forks, and two gallons of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise in bulk to restock her store.

loans.name: Teolith

texts.es:
La Sra. Teolith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto y Provincia de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 57 años y cuenta con estudios superiores en Costura, Corte y Confección.
Es madre de 02 hijos, ambos independientes.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante, Teolith emprendió su negocio de Costura,  poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida y ahora cuenta con  clientela que a diario acuden a su casa a pedirle sus servicio, nos cuenta que tiene bastante trabajo por la etapa escolar, también cose vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, pantalones de vestir y mucho más, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser, alfileres, y botones; así como también, invertirá en la compra de repuesto y mantenimiento de sus máquinas.
Teolith sueña con tener un local propio para su negocio, se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que siempre esperaba, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Teolith is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Courageous Women II) in the District of Tarapoto in San Martín Province. She is 57 years old, married, and has received higher education in sewing and dressmaking. Teolith is the mother of two children, both of whom are independent.

Due to her efforts and desire to succeed, Teolith started a sewing business. She gradually became well-known and now has customers who come by her house to request her services. Teolith says she receives enough work during the school year, but she also produces suits for women, men, and children, trousers, and other types of garments. Her business is located in her home.

With this loan of 2500 PEN, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, sewing implements such as scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, needles, pins, and buttons. Teolith will also invest in the repair and maintenance of her machines. She dreams of having her own shop for her business.

Teolith feels like she is an accomplished woman and has great desire to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity she always wanted and helping other women who want to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies and pay for repair and maintenance of her machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory to restock her store.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora Sara es socia del banco comunal Perlas de Pucallpa, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos.
Todos estos años desde que falleció su esposo tuvo que trabajar para poder criar a sus hijos, comenzó con el armado de un motocar que lo puso a trabajar, después de un tiempo reunió dinero para poder comprar un segundo motocar.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará un motocar nuevo, con lo cual ya serian 3 motocar de su propiedad, su meta es tener 5 motocar a corto plazo, con eso ya tiene para poder mantener su pequeña flota de taxis.  Estos motocar están siendo trabajados por sus 2 hijos y su yerno.
Todavía tiene un hijo que está cursando estudios superiores y todo los gastos salen de las ferias (alquiler) que recibe de sus vehículos.

Sara agradece a Manuela Ramos por los prestamos que han hecho posible parte de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the communal bank "Perlas de Pucallpa," in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and is the mother of 5 children.

During all the years since her husband died she had to work so that she could raise her children.  She started by assembling a motocar which she then put to work.  Then, over time, she gathered together enough money to buy a second motocar.  

With this new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy a new motocar, so that she will have a total of 3 vehicles.  Her goal is to have 5 motocars in the near term, and to be able to maintain her small fleet of taxis.  These motocars are being worked by her 2 sons and her son-in-law.

She has one son who is still taking college classes, and she covers all of the expenses with the rents that she receives from her vehicles.

Sara is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the loans that have made part of her dream possible.

loans.use: to buy a new mototaxi

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El comité D. mujeres "Emprendedoras D. Cerrito" es D. la ciudad del Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el décimo ciclo.
En su mayoría las clientes se dedican a la venta D. comestibles y artículos D. limpieza o lencería (despensa general), hay otras que sin embargo, están iniciando recién ahora sus negocios.
Gracias al apoyo concebido por la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva tienen el deseo D. superarse cada vez más, y seguir avanzando más.
La sra. Olga Idalina posee una despensa donD. principalmente venD. comestibles, bebidas, artículos D. limpieza y lencería, ella se encuentra en una zona donD. provee D. todos los productos D. primera necesidad a sus vecinos, y como desea poder abastecer y satisfacer esas necesidades, solicita el préstamo D. Kiva, D. modo a que pueda obtener la lealtad D. sus clientes y un mayor ingreso económico para su familia.
texts.en:
The group of women "Emprendedoras D. Cerrito" is from the city of Chaco.  They are currently in their 10th loan cycle.

Most of these women sell food, cleaning supplies or dry goods (general pantry), however, some are just starting businesses.  

Thanks to the support provided by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, they have a desire to excel and to continue to advance each day.

Olga Idalina has a store where she sells mainly food, drinks, cleaning supplies and dry goods.  She sells in an area where she provides all of the basic consumer goods to her neighbors.  Since she wants to be able to satisfy the needs of her customers, she requests a loan from Kiva, so that she can have the loyalty of her customers and a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store (meat, vegetables, fruit, condiments) and water, drinks, dry goods, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his inventory of jeans, shirts, shoes and buy passion fruit seeds and some agricultural tools.

loans.name: David Alfonso

texts.es:
David C. es un hombre de negocios que con su venta de bananos maduros al por mayor  desde hace 13 años,  ha logrado el sostenimiento de su hogar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos.  Aunque su primera experiencia fue el montaje de una tienda, decidió cambiarse a esta actividad para lograr mayores utilidades en menos tiempo de trabajo,  por eso se siente satisfecho desde que el mismo momento en que arrendó su local en el mercado de frutas y se dio a la tarea de conseguir la clientela, la que gradualmente ha aumentado agregándole nuevas  frutas. En la actualidad solicita su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual adicionará un nuevo capital que le sirve para aumentar el volumen de compras de contado en bananos y ganarse un adicional por aplicar este  sistema, además este capital en préstamo le ayudará a ampliar las posibilidades de nuevos clientes con productos a los cuales puede ofrecer y que son de mucha aceptación. 
Su sueño y máximo desafío es capitalizar el negocio sufrientemente, para que sus utilidades le permitan adecuar en excelentes condiciones la vivienda que recién ha adquirido con esfuerzo propio .
texts.en:
David C. is a businessman who has succeeded, with his 13-year-old business selling ripe bananas wholesale, at supporting his household made up of his wife and their two children. Although his first experience was in setting up a shop, he decided to switch to this business to be able to bring in better earnings with reduced working hours. Thus he has felt contented from the very first moment in which he rented his stand at the fruit market, setting about the task of acquiring customers and growing gradually by adding new fruits. 

Currently he is seeking his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by which he will add new capital in order to increase the volume of cash purchases of bananas and make additional earnings by applying this system. Furthermore this debt acquisition will help him open up the possibilities for enticing new customers by offering them some highly desirable products. His dream and major challenge is to capitalize his business to a level at which his income will allow him to handsomely adapt the housing that he recently acquired by his own efforts.

loans.use: to make cash purchases of bananas in greater quantity

loans.name: El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Varias señoras del barrio Julio Correa de la ciudad de Luque se juntaron y decidieron formar un nuevo grupo, después de que el comité "La Esperanza" del mismo barrio se disolvió.
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y está conformado por 17 integrantes quienes invierten en distintas actividades, todas del área de confección y costura.
La señora Exaltacion A. es la directora general del comité, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Decidió integrar este grupo para ampliar su negocio y también porque le gusta mucho trabajar con las demás integrantes y compartir con ellas.
La sra. Exaltacion invertiría el crédito en su taller de costura, comprando telas para aumentar la producción de ropas que luego vende a su clientela ya formada.
texts.en:
Several women from the Julio Correa suburb in the city of Luque joined together and decided to form a new group, after the "La Esperanza" comittee in the same neighborhood disbanded.
Currently the committee is in the fifith cycle of the "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras" program and is made up of 17 members who have invested in different businesses, all in the area of tailoring and dressmaking.
Exaltacion A. heads up the committee, she is married and has two children. She decided to become a member of this group to expand her business and also because she really likes to work with the other members and share with them.
Exaltacion will use the loan for her dressmaking workshop, buying fabric to increase the production of clothes which she will then sell to her pre-existing customers.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Nueva Asunción Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva, que tiene como presidenta la señora Palmeira.   

La señora Palmeira, indica que trabajo con Pro Mujer doce ciclos asumiendo la responsabilidad de la presidencia de la A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN” en esta ocación. Ella nos cuenta que inicio su negocio hace quince años, mediante la compra y venta de muebles usados, donde le ofrecieron la venta de películas por mayor; desde entonces trabaja con este negocio.

Con el crédito que ahora sacara piensa ampliar su mercadería de venta de películas, las que compra en el Desaguadero (región fronteriza entre Bolivia y Perú); estas películas las venderá en la feria de la 16 de Julio, los días jueves y domingo, todo el día. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda para apoyar a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos, dos de ellos son casados y aún vive con siete.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la enseñanza de manejo de dinero, no gastar y como aumentar el capital; también piensa que la atención del consultorio médico es buena

Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: Venta de fruta, trenzado de manta, venta de películas, inicio de negocio (venta de comida), compra de grifos en Oruro y venta de rellenos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Nueva Asunción” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors. Sra. Palmeira serves as its president.

Sra. Palmeira worked with Pro Mujer for twelve loan cycles prior to assuming her responsibilities as president of the “Nueva Asunción” Communal Association. She says that she started her business fifteen years ago. Palmeira buys and sells used furniture and is also a wholesale vendor of movies.

With this loan, she plans to expand her inventory of movies. She buys these products in Desaguadero (a region located on the border between Bolivia and Peru) and then sells them at the July 16th Fair on Thursdays and Sundays all day. This business enables her to support her family. Palmeira is married and has nine children, two of whom are married while the other seven live with her.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Palmeira said she enjoys learning how to manage her money, limit her spending, and increase her capital. She also believes that the care provided at the health clinic is good.

The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses. These include selling fruit, braiding rugs, selling movies, starting a food business, buying faucets from Oruro, and selling stuffed snacks.

loans.use: To purchase movies to sell.

loans.name: Dionisia Eulalia

texts.es: Dionisia Eulalia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 6 años en su negocio, por lo que ha sido una persona luchadora y que disfruta de su actividad. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues ha sido para invertir en su negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, ofreciendo muy buenos productos y ampliando el negocio. Con este crédito comprará bolsos, calzado, cremas, tratamientos, ropa en general. Ella se siente muy tranquila y feliz, agradece este crédito por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Dionisia Eulalia has been selling general merchandise for more than six years. She is a determined individual who enjoys what she does. This is not the first time she has requested a loan to invest in her business. Gradually over time Dionisia has become well-known among her customers by offering good products and expanding her business.

This loan will be used to buy bags, shoes, crèmes, treatments, and clothes. Dionisia feels happy and at peace. She is grateful that this loan will contribute toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To purchase bags, shoes, crèmes, treatments, and clothes.

loans.name: Oscar Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 51 años de edad es zapatero y está casado con la señora Lourdes de 41 años de edad, tienen  un  hijo de 5 años de edad.
La pareja se dedica a la zapatería desde hace más de 10 años, el señor Oscar había heredado el oficio de sus padres, actualmente es profesional y ya cuenta con su propia Marca de calzados "IVAN", el cual lo fue logrando con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su cónyuge.
Realiza calzados finos para damas, caballeros y para escolares.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de todo tipo de insumos básicos de zapatería como cuero, cuerina, pegamentos, caucho, goma cortada, diluyente y otros. Obteniendo todos estos insumos agilizaría la producción y estaría cumpliendo con todos sus clientes.
El mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar is 51 years old and works as a shoemaker. He is married to Sra. Lourdes, age 41, and they have a five year old son.

The couple has been managing a shoe store for more than ten years. Sr. Oscar learned this trade from his parents. He is now a professional shoemaker and produces his own brand of shoes called “IVAN”, which was launched with great effort and with the help of his wife. Oscar produces high-end shoes for women, men, and school children.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy all types of basic supplies for making shoes such as genuine leather, imitation leather, adhesives, rubber, solvents, and other items. Acquiring these supplies would speed up production and help him meet the demands of all his customers.

Oscar expresses his appreciation for the support from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase leather, adhesives, rubber, solvents, and other supplies for making shoes.

loans.name: Angel Adrian

texts.es: Ángel Adrian tiene 45 años. El es un hombre muy trabajador y tiene mucho tiempo. La actividad económica de Don Ángel es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio con muy pocos productos, pues no tenía el capital suficiente pues decide recurrir a los financiamientos los que son de mucho apoyo, además en esos momentos el no tenía trabajo y encontró este medio de vida, el ofrece sus productos en un pequeño termo en donde prepara sus deliciosos ceviches. El financiamiento está destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que podrá comprar conchas, camarones, pescados y termos. El siempre tiene el sueño de obtener su propio local.
texts.en:
Ángel Adrian is a 45 year old gentleman who has been working hard for a long time. He sells seafood and has been in business for more than 18 years. Don Ángel started out with very few products because he did not have sufficient capital. He decided to take advantage of the loans and they have been a great help. At the time he did not have a job and discovered that he could earn a living in this manner.

Ángel offers his products from a small cooler in which he prepares delicious “ceviches” (marinated seafood cocktails). This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase shellfish, shrimp, fish, and another cooler. He always dreams about getting his own shop.

loans.use: To purchase shellfish, shrimp, fish, and a cooler.

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es: Después de quedar desempleada Beatriz Eugenia P.
texts.en: After becoming unemployed, Beatriz Eugenia P.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora Ana D. 34 años D. edad es costurera y está casada con el señor Diego D. 31 años D. edad, tienen dos hijos: una nena D. 5 años y un varón D. 2 años D. edad.
La pareja se dedica a la confección desD. hace más D. 2 años con mucho esfuerzo, actualmente ya cuenta con un taller propio. Anteriormente la señora trabajaba para otros pero con ayuda D. su cónyuge supo sacar adelante la micro empresa familiar, ya que el mismo realiza los pedidos para la venta como uniformes escolares, camperas, conjuntos deportivos, etc.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra D. telas para confecciones D. uniformes escolares ya que es temporada alta para dicho rubro y así estaría cumpliendo con todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is 34 years old and works as a seamstress. She is married to Sr. Diego, age 31. They have two children, a five year old daughter and a two year old son.

This couple has been sewing for more than two years with great effort. They currently have their own workshop. Ana previously worked for other people, but with the help of her husband, she was able to move forward and start a family micro-enterprise. She receives orders for school uniforms, jackets, sportswear, and other items.

Ana is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy fabrics for producing school uniforms since demand is high during this season. This will enable her to satisfy all of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for producing school uniforms.

loans.name: Nuevas Raices Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS RAICES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva, que tiene como presidenta la señora Francisca.   

La señora Francisca, indica que es su primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ya que un equipo movil se aproximo a ella. Ella asume la responsabilidad de la presidencia de la A.C. “NUEVAS RAICES”. Nos cuenta que vende chompas y que aprendió el negocio de su prima. En la actualidad compra su mercadería en la feria de la mañana de la calle Tumusla (las mañaneras)

Con el crédito que ahora sacarà piensa abrir su propio taller y comprará una máquina para dibujar en las prendas. La apertura de este taller apoyara su trabajo, ya que elle apoya a su familia, que consta de su esposo y tres hijos, los que le ayudan en su negocio.

Con respecto a las integrantes de la asociación, podemos decir que ellas llevan adelante  variados tipos de negocios, los que son: Venta de hierbas, fajas de pollera, tienda carnicería, transportista, artesanía, producción de alfombras, costura de enaguas.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Nuevas Raices” (New Roots) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors with Sra. Francisca as its president.

Sra. Francisca says that she is working with Pro Mujer for the first time after she was approached by the mobile promotions team. She takes over the responsibilities as president of the “Nuevas Raices” Communal Association. Francisca sells sweaters and learned this trade from her cousin. She currently buys her merchandise at the morning fair on Tumusla Street (during the early hours).

With this loan, Francisca plans to open her own workshop and buy a machine for designing garments. Having a workshop will help her business and enable her to support her family, which consists of her husband and three children. Her family also helps with managing the business.

The other members of the Communal Association say that they engage in various types of businesses. These include selling herbs, manufacturing skirts, managing a butcher shop, providing transportation, producing handicrafts, making rugs, and sewing petticoats.

loans.use: To open a workshop for producing sweaters.

loans.name: Diega Ramona

texts.es:
La Señora Diega Ramona D. 50 años D. edad cuenta con un taller D. confecciones D. prendas D. Lienzo y Ao po'i, es separada, vive con 2 hijos mayores D. edad.
Se dedica hace mas D. 10 años a su rubro, actualmente cuenta con su propia marca "Creaciones Diega", que fue logrando con mucho esfuerzo.
Realiza camisas, blusas, aldeanas, pulóveres y otras prendas D. lienzo y ao po'i para damas, caballeros y niños.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra D. telas D. lienzo  y ao po'i. Al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Sra. Diega Ramona is 50 years old and has a sewing workshop where she produces garments maD. of linen and “ao po’i” (a fine cotton cloth that is unique to Paraguay). She is separated from her spouse and lives with her two grown children.

Diega has been sewing for more than ten years. At the moment, she has her own brand called “Creaciones Diega” (Diega’s Creations) which she launched with great effort. Diega produces shirts, blouses, traditional dresses, pullover sweaters, and other garments out of linen and “ao po’i” for women, men, and children.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy linen and “ao po’i”. Diega expresses her appreciation for the assistance provided by Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To purchase linen and “ao po’i” (a type of cotton cloth).

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
La Señorita  Maria Lorena de 23 años de edad es comerciante, pues se dedica a la venta de ropas, es soltera y tiene un  hijo varón de 2 años de edad. Es madre soltera.
Firma la solicitud de crédito con su tío, el señor Antonio Duarte, quien se dedica a la ganadería.
Es propietaria de una ropería bien surtida de ropas de temporada para damas caballeros y niños.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de todo tipo de prendas de la temporada otoño-invierno. Obteniendo todas estas mercaderías estaría cumpliendo satisfactoriamente con todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Srta. Maria Lorena is a 23 year old merchant who sells clothes. She is a single mother with a two year old son. Maria co-signed this loan application with her uncle, Sr. Antonio Duarte, who is a livestock breeder.

She is the owner of a boutique that is well-stocked with seasonal clothing for women, men, and children. Maria is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy all types of garments for the autumn and winter seasons. By obtaining this merchandise, she will be able to successfully fulfill the demands of all of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for the autumn and winter seasons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Natalicia Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora Natalicia D. 58 años D. edad es comerciante y está casada con el señor Ramón D. 60 años D. edad, tienen una hija D. 30 años D. edad.
La pareja se dedica a la librería desD. hace más D. 10 años, la señora Natalicia había dado apertura al negocio gracias al esfuerzo D. ambos. Realiza trabajos por computadora y fotocopias en su negocio.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra D. insumos para su librería como cuadernos, boligrafos, reglas, lapices, carpetas, hojas, cartucheras, merenderos, etc., ya que está en época alta por el inicio D. las actividades escolares.
texts.en:
Natalicia is 58 years old.  She is a saleswoman and is married to 60 year-old Ramón.  They have a 30 year-old daughter.

The couple have owned a stationery store for more than 10 years.  Natalicia was able to open the business thanks to their joint effort.  In her business she also uses a computer to do pieces of work for people and makes photocopies.

Natalicia is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy supplies for her stationery store such as exercise books, pens, rulers, pencils, folders, paper, pencil cases, lunch bags, etc. since it is currently a peak season as the school year is starting.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, paper, pens, pencil cases, lunch bags, pencils, rulers, folders, etc.

loans.name: Fatima Gabriela

texts.es:
Fatima Gabriela M. es una joven emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de ropa usada america, distribuye su producto a varias personas, le encargan todas las semanas de los lugares como Duyure, El Espino, San Francisco.
Tiene un gran numero de clientes, tambien vende en su casa de habitacion.
Fatima los fines de semana hace trabajos de modista, elabora blusas, faldas, pantalones etc.
estos trabajos los realiza a varias mujeres de su comunidad, tiene mucha demanda ya que hace la ropa a la medida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de fardo de ropa usada.
texts.en:
Fatima Gabriela M. is an enterprising young woman whose business is selling used, American clothes.  She distributes her products to a number of people who make orders with her every week from places such as Duyure, El Espino and San Francisco.  She has a large number of customers and also makes sales from her home.

On weekends, Fatima works as a dressmaker.  She makes blouses, skirts, pants, etc.  She does this work for women in her community and has a lot of demand because her clothes are custom-made.

Fatima will use her loan to buy a bundle of used clothing.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools such as electric shavers, shaving knives, scissors and barber's chairs

loans.name: Margina Lissette

texts.es:
Margina es una joven soltera, que habita junto a sus padres, en donde juntos han venido mejorando su vivienda.
Hoy en día labora en un banco de la capital, teniendo tres años estables en su puesto, lo que está contenta por tener la bendición de su trabajo. 
Afodenic ha dado el beneficio de poder hacer las mejora de infraestructura mediantes los financiamientos, en donde han avanzado mucho, siendo su cuarto ciclo, en donde comprara materiales para enverjar su ventana y su puerta ya que están inseguras. En donde comprara materiales de soldadura,  varillas entorchadas, platina,  tubos, pintura para pintar, cener, entre otros. Para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Margina is a young, single woman who lives with her parents.  Together they have been working to improve their home.

Margina works in a bank in the capital.  She has been in her post for three years and is happy to be blessed with having work.  Afodenic has helped Margina to improve the infrastructure of her home through their loans.  She has made a lot of progress and is on her fourth loan cycle.  She will buy materials to put grilles up at her windows and door as they are not safe.  She will buy welding materials, bars, disks, pipes, paint, etc. in order to start the job.

loans.use: to buy welding materials to make grilles for her windows and door

loans.name: Kuña Kuera Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Anisth Miryam V. D., que vive en la cuidad D. Villarrica.
Todas las integrantes, encantadas, aceptaron conformar el Comité D. Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité "Kuña Kuera Katupyry".
La sra. Maria Ediz se dedica a la venta D. ropas y cosméticos D. manera ambulante, ella desea prosperar en su comercio pues quiere superar la pobreza D. su familia, es una mujer muy sacrificada, trabaja mucho y sin descansos, como necesita aumentar las variedades D. sus productos solicitó el crédito D. Kiva, a fin D. equiparse con buena cantidad D. productos.
Con la ayuda que le ofreció la Fundación Paraguaya, este comité logro mejorar sus ingresos y  también mejorar sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
This committee was formes thanks to Mrs. Anisth Miryam V. D., who lives in the city of  Villarrica.
All of the members happily accepted to be a part of the committee of rural women, calling the committee "Kuña Kuera Katupyry".

Mrs. Maria Ediz sells clothes and cosmetics as a door to door vendor. She wants to prosper in her business and overcome her family's poverty. She is a hardworking woman who works a lot without rest. Since she needs to increase the variety of her products, she asked for a loan from Kiva so that she can equip herself with a good quantity of products. 

With the help offered by the Fundación Paraguaya, this committee was able to improve her income and also her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Carlos Adalberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 60 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene un negocio de ebanistería. Comenzó su negocio hace muchos años atrás con un oficial. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo mejorar su local de trabajo. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano con dos personas. No tiene dificultades en hacer las puertas de madera, armarios, closet etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar comprando con el préstamo materia prima como madera. En el futuro quiere tener mas ingresos para asegurar su futuro.
texts.en:
Carlos is 60 years old. He is a hardworking man who has a furniture making business. He started his business many years ago with an official. Little by little, with hard work and dedication he was able to improve his work locale.  

At present, he has no trouble making wood doors, dressers, closets, etc. He aspires to a lot of things with his business and because of this he wants to continue buying raw materials with the loan, such as wood. In the future he wants to have more income to ensure his future.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Vilma Lizet

texts.es:
la señora Vilma P. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a su familia y a su negocio.
Vilma vende ropa nueva para cama, su producto lo distribuye en su misma comunidad y en aldeas aledañas.
sus ventas son la mayoria al credito,  mantiene un gran numero de clientes que le hacen pedidos de lugares como el Corpus, El Espino y El Triunfo.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa para cama al por mayor y asi obtener mejores precios y mayores ganancias.
su deseo es darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Vilma tiene 45 años de edad y vive en la colonia 21 de septiembre en San Marcos de Colon.
texts.en:
Vilma P. is an enterprising woman who spends her time looking after her family and her business.  Vilma sells new bedclothes.  She distributes her products in her community and neighboring villages.  She makes most of her sales on credit.  She has a large number of customers who make orders with her from places such as El Corpus, El Espino and El Triunfo.

Vilma will use her loan to buy bedclothes wholesale and thereby obtain better prices and more profits.  Her wish is to provide her children with a good quality of life.  Vilma is 45 years old and lives in '21 de septiembre' neighborhood, in San Marcos de Colón.

loans.use: to buy bedclothes

loans.name: Nelly De Dios

texts.es:
Desde hace 9 años, Nelly de Dios M. I. inició su legumbrería en compañía de un amigo, es así como día a día se enfrentan con la competencia de otros 128 negocios que al igual que ellos se dedican a vender este tipo de productos, otro tipo de dificultad a la que se ven enfrentados es la temporada de invierno pues además de que disminuyen las ventas, los precios de los productos se incrementan. 

Actualmente Nelly necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía especialmente de cosecha y así abastecerse.
texts.en:
Nine years ago, Nelly de Dios M. I. set up her vegetable stall with a friend.  Every day they face competition from another 128 businesses who also sell this type of product.  Another difficulty that they have faced is the fact that during the winter season their sales fall and product prices increase.

Nelly currently needs a loan to buy merchandise, especially recently-harvested produce, so that she can stock her business.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, water, sugar, milk, fats, propane gas and bread trays

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Lucia P. tiene 48 años de edad, vive en la colonia 21 de Septiembre en San Marcos de Colon, Lucia es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y utiles escolares, Lucia vende sus productos en lugares como San Francisco, Orocuina, Yusguare.
lo distribuye en pulperias y tambien a personas que le encargan.
todas las semanas viaja a estos lugares a repartir su mercaderia.
tiene la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, juntos trabajan duro para sacar adelante el hogar y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de zapatos, camisetas, camisas, boxers, blusas, bikinis, libretas, cuadernos, lapices, colores, cuadernos unicos.
texts.en:
Lucia P. is 48 years old and lives in '21 de Septiembre' neighborhood, in San Marcos de Colón.  Lucia is a determined woman who sells new clothes and school supplies.  She sells her products in places such as San Francisco, Orocuina and Yusguare.  She distributes her goods to grocery stores and also to people who place orders with her.  She travels to these places every week to distribute her merchandise.  Her husband helps her to cover their household expenses.  Together they work hard to get their family ahead, so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.

Lucia will use her loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, shirts, boxer shorts, blouses, bikinis, notebooks, standard exercise books, pencils, colored pencils and special exercise books.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, shirts, boxer shorts, blouses, bikinis, notebooks, standard exercise books, pencils, colored pencils and special exercise books

loans.name: Alexi Ondina

texts.es:
doña Alexi A. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Centro de El Triunfo. Alexi se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, en estos momentos no tiene muy surtida su pulperia y desea invertirle para hacerla crecer un poco.
Alexi es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad,  ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Su esposo es conductor de buses.
doña  Alexi se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus hijos y despacharlos para la escuela y luego abre su pulperia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Alexi A. is 36 years old and lives in El Centro neighborhood, in El Triunfo.  Her business is selling essential food products.  She has a small grocery store located in her home.  Right now, her store isn't very well stocked and she would like to invest in order to grow her business a little.

Alexi has 4 children who are attending school in her community.  She has her husband's help in covering her household expenses.  Her husband is a bus driver.

Alexi gets up every day at 5.00am to get her children ready for school and then she opens her grocery store.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise so that she can stock her store.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, butter, oil, beans, milk, soups, pasta, sauces, salt, condiments, cookies, juice, chilis and toilet paper

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emilia Simeona

texts.es: Doña Emilia Simeona T. C., es una señor casada, 45 años de esda, cursos el sexto año de educación primaria,, se dedica a la artesania, tejido de cortes típicos, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con al apoyo de su conyugue, quien se dedica a la misma actividad, iniciaron su negocio, siendo operacios, quieren ampliar su capital de trabajo, por lo que solicitarion un préstamo a ASDIR para compra de materia prima en este caso mas hilo que es uno de los materiales utilzados par elaborar este trabajo, esperan mejorar su producción, sus ventas y sus ingresos con la inversion del prestamo.
texts.en: Emilia Simeona T. C. is 45 years old and married.  She studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  Emilia makes handicrafts.  She weaves traditional skirts and has 15 years experience in this line of work.  She has the support of her husband who is in the same business.  They would like to increase their working capital and so requested a loan from ASDIR to buy raw materials.  They will buy more fabric which they use to make their products.  They hope to improve their production, their sales and their income with the investment of this loan.

loans.use: to buy material for her weaving business

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Teofila L. D. A., que vive en la cuidad D. Villarrica.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité D. Mujeres Rurales nombrando al grupo "Sagrada Familia".
La sra. Mariela Lujan es vendedora ambulante, ella se dedica a comerciar con la venta D. ropas, desD. hace varios años se dedica a este rubro pero como posee muchos clientes desea poder complacerlos más D. acuerdo a sus gustos particulares y necesidades, por ello solicita el crédito, para poder comprar más ropas (shorts, remeras, pantalones, camisas, etc.) a modo D. tener variedades sobre las cuales puedan escoger las distintas personas que compran D. ella.
Todas las integrantes del comité desean progresar con la ayuda económica que puedan obtener D. Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
texts.en:
Teofila L. D. A., who lives in the town of Villarrica, formed this committee.  The group were delighted to join the 'Comité D. Mujeres Rurales' (Committee of Rural Women) program, naming their group "Sagrada Familia" (Sacred Family).

Mariela Lujan is an itinerant sales vendor who sells clothes.  She has been in this line of work for several years.  As she has many customers, she would like to be able to cater to their individual tastes and needs.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan, so that she can buy more fashionable clothes (shorts, t-shirts, pants, shirts, etc.) and have a wider range of merchandise so that her customers have more items to choose from.

All the members of this committee are keen to make progress with the financial help that they receive from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Ligia Melchora

texts.es:
La señora Ligia es socia del banco comunal Perlas de Pucallpa del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 56 años de edad y 3 hijos ya mayores de edad.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y en ocasiones sale a reparto porque también trabaja con pedidos. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 pantalones de niña, ½ doc.  de polos, ½ doc. de blusas, 3 vestidos, ½ faldas de niña, 6 pantalones para damas, ½ doc. de polos para damas, 3 shores para damas, una vitrina pequeña.
Ligia nos comenta que el negocio, por estos meses, está bien bajo y no quería deber mucho para que pueda pagar sin ningún problema sus cuotas a Manuela Ramos, por ello solo ha solicitado 1,000 soles.
Como mujer sola, ha tenido que ver por sus hijos mientras estaban a su cargo, ahora sus hijos ya tiene familia y está más tranquila, puede dedicarse a su  negocio y ver por su tranquilidad
texts.en:
Ligia is a member of the 'Perlas de Pucalipa' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 56 years old and has three grown-up children.

Ligia's business is selling new clothes.  She makes her sales from her home and sometimes goes out and makes deliveries because she also works to order.  She will use her loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy 5 pairs of girls' pants, half a dozen polo shirts, half a dozen blouses, 3 dresses, half a dozen girls' skirts, 6 pairs of ladies' pants, half a dozen ladies' polo shirts, 3 pairs of ladies' shorts and a small display case.

Ligia tells us that her business is slow right now and she didn't want to borrow too much because she wants to be able to make her repayments to Manuela Ramos without difficulty.  For this reason, she has only requested 1,000 soles.  As a single woman, Ligia had to look after her children while they were in her care.  Now that her children have their own families she is more relaxed.  She is able to concentrate on her business and look after herself.

loans.use: to buy 5 pairs of girls' pants, half a dozen polo shirts, half a dozen blouses, 3 dresses, half a dozen girls' skirts, 6 pairs of ladies' pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as: tomatoes, chilies, onions, and potatoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 48 años, está casada hace 29 años con Marcelo; con quien tiene 4 hijos. Pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Perene (selva central peruana). Como madre dedicada al progreso de sus hijos. Desde hace 10 se dedica a la venta de tamales, como también a la siembra de productos de pan llevar como: plátanos, yuca. Según afirma ya es conocida por su trabajo, pues ella misma prepara los tamales que vende de casa en casa a los habitantes de su localidad, vendiendo un promedio de 50 unidades diarias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, son los halagos que recibe por su exquisita sazón. Mientras que por las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos, los cuales le ayudan a solventar algunos gastos extra, ya que los mismos compradores llegan a sus terrenos a comercializar su cosecha. Su principal  dificultad es solventar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Ahora está invirtiendo en la culminación de los estudios de mecánica de uno de ellos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los soñadores”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe de parte de los integrantes de su asociación. Esther, está pensando renovar sus cultivos, por ello con el crédito comprará varias plantitas de toda variedad de cítricos con los cuales hará injertos para que obtenga variedad en sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Esther is 48 years old and has been married to Marcelo for 29 years.  They have 4 children but only live with 2 of them.  They live in their own home which is located in the town of Perene (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Esther is a mother who is committed to the progress of her children.  For 10 years she has been selling tamales.  She also grows crops such as bananas and cassava.  She tells us that she is well known for her work since she prepares the tamales that she sells door to door to local people herself.  She sells, on average, 50 units a day.  What Esther most likes about her work is the praise that she receives for her delicious seasoning. 

In the mornings, Esther takes care of her crops which help her to cover some extra expenses.  Her purchasers come to her to buy her harvested crops.  Her main difficulty is paying for her children's university studies.  She is currently paying for the end of a degree course in mechanics for one of her children.

Esther is a member of the 'Los Soñadores' (The Dreamers) community bank and this is her third loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the support that she receives from the members of her association.  Esther is planning to renew her crops.  She will use her loan to buy several small plants of different varieties of citrus fruits which she will graft so that she can obtain variety in her plantings.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Mayte

texts.es:
La señora Mayte es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito de Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad y tres hijos.
Es reingresarte en el banquito  y lleva 3 ciclos.  Mayte tiene una bodega que funciona en su propia casa, sus hijos la ayudan con la atención y su esposo se desempeña como maestro panadero.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 paquete de fideos, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de lava vajillas, 1 caja de leche, 10 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 paquete de fideos para sopa, 5 kilos de menestras, 2 kilos de chuño, 2 kilos de harina, 1 caja de conservas.

"Con Manuela Ramos las mujeres han aprendido que también pueden generar sus propios ingresos, para poder aportar a su hogar algo de dinero, no es mucho pero es de gran ayuda para sus esposos".
texts.en:
Mayte is a member of the "Las Luchadoras" community bank which is located in Campo Verde district, in Ucayli department.  She is 41 years old and has three children.

Mayte has rejoined her bank and been a member for 3 loan cycles.  She has a grocery store which is located in her own home.  Her children help her to serve her customers and her husband works as a master baker.

Mayte will use this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 pack of noodles, 1 sack of sugar, 1 crate of oil, 1 crate of dishwashing liquid, 1 crate of milk, 10 packs of toilet paper, 1 pack of soup noodles, 5 kilos of mixed veg, 2 kilos of 'chuño' (dried potato product), 2 kilos of flour and 1 crate of canned food.

"Through Manuela Ramos, women have learned that they can make their own income to help contribute money to their households.  It isn't much but it is a great help to their husbands".

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, mixed veg and canned food

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Ana, es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos pero solo uno está a su cargo.
Tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa, la misma que viene implementando cada vez que saca un préstamo,  lleva recién 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo prestamos de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará; ½ caja de leche, 1 saco de sal, ½ saco de azúcar, ½ saco de arroz, 2 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 bolsa de legía, ½ caja de jabón en barra, 3 jabas de gaseosa, 1 paquete de agua.
Es poco lo que puede comprar con el préstamo que saca pero, pero es la capacidad de pago que tiene por el momento, mas adelante subirá su crédito para ampliar su negocio.
Esta tranquila porque con lo que trabaja le alcanza para pagar los estudios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the 'Las Luchadoras' community bank which is located in Campo Verde district, in Ucayali department.  She is 59 years old and has 7 children, only one of whom is still in her care.

Ana has a small grocery store in her home.  She stocks her store every time she takes out a loan.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years.

Ana will use her new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy half a crate of milk, 1 sack of salt, half a sack of sugar, half a sack of rice, 2 packs of toilet paper, 1 bag of bleach, half a box of bars of soap, three 3 crates of soda and 1 packet of water.

Ana cannot buy much with the loan that she is taking but it is in accordance with the payment capacity that she has right now.  Later she will raise her loan amount in order to expand her business.  She is happy because the money she makes through her work is enough to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soap, toilet paper and bleach

loans.name: Alexis Javier

texts.es:
el sr. Alexis S. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la colonia Izaguirre de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Alexis en estos momentos va a remodelar una parte de su casa, va a cambiar el techo por loza, Alexis trabaja como vigilante en la Cruz Roja Hondureña tiene 3 años de trabajar en dicho lugar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales de construccion para cambiar el techo por loza, esto lo esta haciendo para mejorar su casa y asi darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Alexis nos comento que se siente feliz ya que poco a poco va construyendo su casa y en algun momento la va a terminar.
texts.en:
Alexis S. is 39 years old and lives in Izaguirre neighborhood, in the city of Tegucigalpa.  He is going to remodel part of his home, replacing his existing roof with tiles.  

Alexis works as a security guard for the Honduran Red Cross.  He has been working there for 3 years.  He will use his loan to buy building supplies so that he can replace his existing roof with tiles.  He is doing this in order to improve his home and provide his family with a better quality of life.

Alexis tells us that he feels happy because he is gradually building his house and at some point will finish it.

loans.use: to buy wood, metal sheets, cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Jose Lizandro

texts.es:
Jose de 35 años, tiene una pequeña tienda hace 6 años atrás. Poco a poco ha comenzado a surtir su negocio con víveres y papelería. En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su esposa. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso siempre quiere surtirlo con víveres y papelería como cuadernos, plumas, bebidas, snack etc. Tiene con su esposa tres hijos de 8, 5 y 2 años de edad por eso quiere el préstamo para tener mas ingresos y darle una mejor vida. Con el préstamo quiere comprar snack, bebidas, cuadernos etc.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and has owned a small store for 6 years.  He has gradually stocked his business with food and stationery products.  His wife currently helps him in his work.

José has many aspirations for his business.  For this reason, he always wants to keep it stocked with food and stationery products such as exercise books, pens, drinks, snacks, etc.  He and his wife have three children aged 8, 5 and 2.  He would like this loan so that he can make more income and provide his children with a better life.  He will use his money to buy snacks, drinks, exercise books, etc.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks and exercise books

loans.name: Estrellas Brillantes 1 Group

texts.en:
Alicia is part of the group named "Estrellas Brillante" 1 (Brilliant Stars), she is the representative of this group and has proven to be a very hard-working woman. She said she has to work hard because she has four young children that she needs to take care of and feed.

She has a small business selling food in her area and also she breed pigs, to be sold after 3-5 months. She said it's her goal to put all her kids through high school, and hopefully they will be able to go to college someday. After she has run her small restaurant and invested in it over almost four years, she decided to start selling pigs, so this loan will be used to buy pigs. 

This is a group of five people trying to receive loans to increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
la sra. Felicita G. C. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la colonia Buenos Aires de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Felicita se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Felicita alquila un local enfrente de la Calle principal en la Colonia La Travesía, anteriormente lo tenia en su casa de habitacion pero no es un lugar estrategico para dicho negocio.
Cerca de su negocio esta ubicada una Escuela y esto hace mas afluencia de personas y sus ventas son mayores.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de fardos de ropa.
texts.en:
Ms. Felicita G. C. is 42 years old and lives in Buenos Aires in the city of Tegucigalpa. For 4 years Felicita has been selling used clothing. 

Felicita rents a room facing the main street in the colony of La Tracesía. Previously she had her store in her home but it is not a strategic place for doing business.

There is a school near her business and this creates more influx of people and thus her sales are higher. She will use the loan to buy bundles of clothing.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: Juana Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa familiar, tiene 2 hijos menores, se dedica al servicio de transporte ya que alquila su mototaxi, eligio dedicarse a esta actividad ya que su conyuge tambien es chofer alquila una movilidad la señora tiene la meta de tener otra unidad de transporte para alquilarla y asi obtener mayores ingresos, y cumplir con sus sueños y objetivos, Juana Rosa invertira el dinero en comprar accesorios para mejorar su movilidad
texts.en: Juana Rosa is 25 years old, is in a domestic partnership and lives in her parents home. She has two small children. She works in the transport service industry renting out a mototaxi. She chose to pursue this line of work since her partner also rents a vehicle. Her goal is to have another vehicle to rent and to improve her income and obtain her dreams and objectives. Juana Rosa will invest the money in purchasing accessories to improve her vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to improve her vehicle

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana, de 44 años, es una luchadora madre soltera. Vive junto a sus 6 hijos, a los que quiere mucho, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Perene (selva central peruana). Luchadora incansable, así definimos a Feliciana, pues ella lleva en la sangre la fuerza y el coraje por salir adelante, ya que hace 12 años se dedica a la compra de frutas a los agricultores, para después venderlos por kilos en las ferias que se realizan los días sábados y domingos en la ciudad de La Merced. En todo este tiempo con la ayuda de sus hijos pudo obtener el capital para abrir una tienda de comestibles en su casa; donde hace 3 meses comenzó abastecer con nuevos productos alimenticios, obteniendo así cada día mejores ganancias. Su principal preocupación son los estudios de sus hijos, pues su meta es verlos profesionales y ejerciendo una carrera universitaria. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los soñadores”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, por los logros obtenidos en este tiempo. Feliciana, con el crédito, comprará varios kilos de plátanos. Asimismo se está preparando para la época escolar, donde comprará cuadernos, gomas, papeles y demás útiles de escritorio.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 44 years old, is a fighter and a single mother. She lives with her 6 children, who want much, but only two of them live in their own home, located in the town of Perene (Peruvian central forest). 

Feliciana is defined as a tireless fighter because in her blood she holds the strength and courage to move forward. For 12 years she has been buying fruit from farmers, then sells it per kilo in the fairs held Saturdays and Sundays in the city of La Merced. 

In all of this time, with the help of her children she has been able to obtain capital to open a grocery store in her home. 3 months ago she began stocking her store with new food products, thus obtaining better profits every day. 

Her main concern is the education of her children. Her goal is to see them pursue a college degree. 

She is a member of the community bank "Los Soñadores", and it is her sixth loan with MFP. She feels accomplished for her achievements at this time. Feliciana, with the loan, will buy several kilos of bananas. At the same time, she is also preparing for school days, when she will buy notebooks, erasers, paper and other stationery.

loans.use: To buy several kilos of bananas and to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Silvia Maribel

texts.es:
la Sra. Silvia Maribel M. tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Reparto por Bajo y se dedica a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Comedor “LAS GEMELAS”, el cual esta ubicado en el MERCADO SAN PABLO de la ciudad capital, su comedor lo abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los dias, primero comienza con el aseo y luego con la preparacion de las comidas.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una estufa industrial para hacer mas rapido sus comidas y en mayor cantidad, esto le vendra a facilitar su trabajo y despachar mas rapido a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia Maribel M., age 26, lives in the Reparto por Bajo neighborhood.  She sells breakfast, lunch, and sweets.  Her business, an eatery, is called “Las Gemelas” (The Twins).  The business is located in the San Pablo Market in the capital city.

Her business is open every day from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon.  First she starts cleaning, and then she makes the food.

She will use the loan to buy an industrial stove.  She will do this to make the food quicker and in greater quantities.  This will help her in her work, and she will serve her customers more quickly.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria H. de 40 años de edad, reside en el Municipio  y Departamento de  San Vicente. Vive sola y ha trabajado  toda su vida para sacar adelante a su hijos, quienes a la fecha ya han conformado sus hogares. Su negocio es una pequeña tienda de productos de belleza, en los que vende: champú, ganchos, cremas, etc., ubicado frente al mercado municipal de San Vicente, sitio muy concurrido por personas que a diario transitan sobre calle principal en la que se encuentra su negocio, quienes le prefieren por contar con productos de mu buena calidad y buen precio. Solicita este crédito para poder seguir abasteciendo su pequeño negocio, y de esta manera poder satisfacer la demanda  productos que hacen sus clientes.  Durante todo este  tiempo ha observado que su negocio es rentable por lo que desea poder tener los recursos necesarios para incrementar su inventario y así aumentar sus ventas y en consecuencia mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
40-year old Victoria H. lives alone in the municipality of San Vincente in San Vincente department. All her life she has worked to help her children get ahead. They now have homes of their own. 

Victoria runs a business selling beauty products such as shampoo, hair accessories, and creams. It is located opposite the San Vincente market, a very busy part of town which people pass through daily on the main road. They pass her shop and often choose to enter as they can find good quality products there at a good price.

She is seeking a loan to buy more products to stock her small store and satisfy her customers’ requests. She notes that her business is profitable, and for this reason she wishes to have enough money to increase her inventory and sales. This will result in an improvement in her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair accessories, and creams

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 52 años, es un hombre muy responsable. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Lucia de 51 años y sus 3 hijos de los 5 que tiene en total, con quienes trabajan arduamente para salir adelante. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la confección de prendas íntimas, siendo su lugar de trabajo su taller, situado en el primer ambiente de su casa. En ella trabajan conjuntamente con su esposa y sus hijos mayores, quienes le motivan a crecer y ampliar su negocio. Por ello su hijo estudia diseño de modas, especialmente en la confección de lencerías finas. De ese modo no solo vende a los comerciantes informales, sino también a las tiendas comerciales y de prestigio. Le gusta la actividad que desarrolla, porque lo realiza en la comodidad de su casa y sobre todo que es independiente. En vista de ello, necesita proveerse de mayor cantidad de algodón nacional, para continuar confeccionando sus prendas y de ese modo abarcar a más mercados, ya que en adelante anhela crecer y convertirse en una empresa formal. Es su primer crédito con MFP, se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que le gustaría seguir contando con futuras ayudas para crecer con su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar telas de algodón, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
52-year old Miguel is a responsible person. He lives with his 51-year old wife Lucia and three of their five children in his own home. They all work hard to get ahead in life. 

For the last ten years Miguel has earned his living by making underwear in the workshop located in his house. He works there with his wife and adult children; they are the reason why Miguel wishes to expand his business. His son is studying fashion design, specializing in fine lingerie. He sells not only to individual shopkeepers but also to large, prestigious stores.

He enjoys his work because he can do it in the comfort of his own home and above all because he is independent. He now needs to obtain a large quantity of local cotton material so he can continue making his products and expand into other markets. In the future he is keen to see his business become a formal company.

This is Miguel’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to repay the money punctually as he would like to continue with the program in order to expand his business. With this loan he  is planning to buy cotton material so he can complete outstanding orders.

loans.use: to buy cotton material to complete outstanding orders

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga Lucia M. es una gran emprendedora, ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante por si sola, y quiere crecer como microempresaria.
Hace poco inicio su negocio de ropa de marca importada, hasta el momento le ha ido muy  bien pero necesita un préstamo para  abrir un tienda pequeña dentro de su casa, y también para comprar más mercadería. Por eso necesita    un préstamo de ₡594 000 ( quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de  los materiales y de mas mercadería. En el futuro le gustaría  poder importar ropa con alguien directamente desde USA.
Ella es socia de la empresa de crédito comunal San Francisco de la Palmera, una de las 100 empresas socias de EDESA .
texts.en:
Olga Lucia M. is a hardworking businesswoman. Although alone, she has managed to help her children get ahead. She now wants to expand her small business selling imported clothing which she began a short while ago. It’s been very successful, but she now needs a loan to open a small store inside her house and buy more merchandise.

Olga is asking for 594,000 colones to buy construction material and merchandise. In the future she would like to import clothing directly from the USA. She is a member of the San Francisco de la Palmera community bank, one of the 100 businesses which are members of EDESA.

loans.use: to buy construction material and imported clothing

loans.name: Jenny Roxana

texts.es:
Jenny es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su  esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Patapo una zona rural dedicada a la producción agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas, golosinas y recargas a celulares. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, gracias a la amabilidad  que tiene Jenny con sus clientes. Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Jenny ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Jenny es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 28 years old mother. She lives with her husband and two children in the Patapo District. It is a rural farming and cattle zone located in the north of Peru, forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store in her house and sells various products like groceries, soft drinks, snacks and cell-phone’s re-chargers to neighbors and costumers in her area. The business is well received due to Jenny’s amiability. She provides financial support to her husband and family through this business. 

Jenny would like to expand and buy more products due to the increase in demand from her costumers. This is the reason she is requesting a loan of 500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Jenny is a hard working woman of good character. She is appreciated and loved by people who know her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo Hernández tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la colonia San Francisco de la ciudad de Danli y se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, actividad con la que cuenta con mas de once años de experiencia.

En la actualidad él no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para seguir comprando vehículos, ya que muchas veces las ventas no son de contado y hace cambios de vehículos en las que algunas veces le devuelven efectivo y en otras ocasiones le toca a él devolver efectivo. 
Don Alfredo vive en unión libre pero con su compañera de hogar no ha procreado hijos, pero si es padre de 3 hijos de su primer matrimonio los cuales ya son adultos y trabajan.

Su compañera de hogar labora para el Ministerio de Salud Publica donde se desempeña como Auxiliar de Enfermería en el Hospital departamental de Oriente.

el credito lo utilizara para reunir una cantidad de dinero y asi poder empezar a comprar otro carro para reventa.
texts.en:
Alfredo Hernández, age 52, lives in the San Francisco neighborhood in the city of Danli.  He buys and sells vehicals.  He has over 11 years of experience in this business.

He does not presently have enough working capital to continue buying vehicles.  This is because many times the sales are not for cash.  He exchanges vehicles, and sometimes he gets cash back.  Other times he is the one who gives cash back.

Alfredo is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his life partner, and they do not have children.  However, he does have three children from his first marriage.  The children are adults, and they work.  His life partner works for the Ministry of Public Health as a nurse’s assistant in the Oriente departmental hospital.

He will use the loan to get together the money to be able to start buying another car for resale.

loans.use: to buy automobiles

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, es 44 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado. Vive en su casa propia con su esposa Blanca, de 45 años y sus 3 hijos de los 4 tiene en total, por quienes se esfuerza mucho para sacarlos adelante. Desde muy joven se dedicaba a negocios informales y que las realiza hasta en la actualidad, pero hace 5 años alquiló esta tienda aledaña a un mercado muy concurrido. Desde entonces con su esposa trabajan a la par en este negocio, por ello de manera ínter diario se provee  las frutas al por mayor, del mercado mayoristas a costos asequibles, captando así mayores utilidades. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, por ello mientras su esposa vende en su tienda, él recorre las calles con su triciclo vendiendo sus frutas y, de ese modo capta buenas utilidades, con las que cubre la educación y el bienestar de sus hijos y paga  el alquiler mensual; muy costoso del local de su negocio. Es por ello, que este emprendedor hombre trabaja arduamente con la convicción, que en  adelante se compre su propio puesto dentro del mercado ó aledaño a ello. Pero, por el momento su prioridad es abastecerse de variedad de frutas, ya que en esta temporada de verano  vende bien. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y dice “que le tengan confianza, porque él es muy grato y responsable” y que también le gustaría pagar contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa abastecerse de diversidad frutas con propiedades diuréticas, por ser muy solicitadas en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 44 years old.  He is an honest and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 45 year-old Blanca, and three of his four children.  He works very hard to get his family ahead in life.

Rodolfo has been working in informal businesses since he was very young.  Five years ago he rented a store next to a very busy market.  Since then he has worked together with his wife in his business.  Every couple of days they supply their business with fruit from the wholesale market at an affordable price.  In this way they make good profits.

Rodolfo enjoys his business a lot.  While his wife sells in the store, he travels the streets in his three-wheeled vehicle selling his fruit and, in this way, they make good profits which cover their children's education and well-being and the monthly rent for their business premises which is very expensive.  This enterprising man works hard with the conviction that in the future he will buy his own stall in the market itself or nearby.  For the moment, his priority is to stock his business with a range of fruits since they sell well in this summer season.

This is Rodolfo's first loan with MFP and he says that they trust him because he is very pleasant and responsible.  He would like to be able to count on further loans.  Rodolfo will use his loan to supply his business with a range of fruits with diuretic properties since they are very much in demand this season.

loans.use: to stock his business with fruits which have diuretic properties

loans.name: Alberto Andres

texts.es: Don Alberto Andres T. M., es casado, tiene 7 hijos, 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, cursó el sexto año de educacion primaria, se dedica a la tejeduria (tejido de cortes tipicos), con experiencia de 8 años, inició su negocio con el apoyo de sus hermanos, su conyugue se dedica a oficios domésticos, solicita un prestamos para sufragar gastos personales, quiere comprar un aparato de sonido que le servira de compañia durante su trabajo, espera desempeñarse mejor con la compra que esta haciendo, y con trabajo que tiene pueda cancelar el prestamo que esta haciendo a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto Andres T. M. is married, has seven children, two of them are still students. His spouse is a housewife. He attended school through sixth grade. He is a weaver and started a traditional weaving business with his siblings’ help. He has eight years of experience.

He is requesting a loan to meet personal expenses and wants to buy a radio for personal use to listen to while he is working. He hopes that this will help him to perform better and to repay the loan requested from ASDIR with work he already has.

loans.use: to buy a radio.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Carlos G. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es el negocio de video juegos, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Sus clientes potenciales son los vecinos de la aldea del Chichicaste y la mayoría de estudiantes que circulan por el lugar, tiene muchos clientes por los juegos actualizados que tiene.

En la actualidad Talo como mas se le conoce en la aldea en donde vive no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para poner a funcionar (2) dos maquinas de video juegos, no estan funcionando por desperfectos y la demanda de sus clientes es bastante, ya que muchos esperan turno para poder jugar.

el credito lo utilizara para hacer la reparación de las dos maquinas y ponerlas a trabajar y así satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, en este tipo de negocio no solo niños juegan si no también personas adultas que les gusta distraerse con este tipo de entretenimiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos G. has an establishment with video games located in his house. His costumers are neighbors of the small village of Chichicaste and students who go around the area. He has a lot of costumers because of the new released games that are available. 

Currently, Talo, as he is better known in the village, does not have the financial resources needed to repair two video game machines that are not functioning properly. The demand from his costumers is high and often they have to wait in line to play. These games are played not only by children in the area but also by adults who enjoy this type of entertainment.
